reviews.review: Lucky Amsterdam!. What a modern and beautiful library on the water. It is nearby Central Station! There is a snack bar and there is a bar that overlooks the canal.

Huge library, but have to pay now for internet usage!. I have to say I was a little dissapointed with this library not too far from the central train station, and I have been all around the world multiple times, and every single library I have ever walked into internet service is generally free, just show them your id or passport depending on what country, BUT this location they charge now, which is quite a shame, BUT other than that book selection is massive, toilet is .20 euros downstairs.

Stunning panarama. There are two places to get the city view and a snack, both are next to each other. The Library is a cool place to duck in and get away. It is easy to get to next to the Central Station. You can go to the top for free and enjoy the city vista. The cafe has tables outside if you are hungry. We were there for the view and didn't feel out of place just enjoying the it.

An oasis of calm & great 'market' cafe. As far as libraries go, this one seems very nice - modern architecture, spacious, quiet and relaxing. That said, I didn't even touch a book, as we were just here for a drink and treat.The cafe on the top floor is superb. It's more like a posh market. Plenty to choose from and wonderfully presented, with a farmers' market feel to it. There's a small balcony area which despite the building's exposed position is quite sheltered. It offers views across the city, though with the flat topography and most buildings the same height there's little to see (pleasant enough, mind).

Books with a view. Even though you have to pay 20 cents for the toilets and a euro to use the Internet, this high tech library has a high end cafeteria on the 7th floor where you can enjoy the view over A-dam for free. The children's area has an amazing doll house inhabited by toy mice (behind glass, alas) that even adults could gaze at for a good long time to take it all in.

A View of Amsterdam. LIBRARY – On the 7th floor of the library, they have a self service restaurant. The food is good and provides a nice break but the reason to go there is for the view, especially on a nice sunny warm day. We had cheese pizza and steak, both good but not outstanding as it is set up to be a cafeteria, from which you have the view of Amsterdam.

The perfect ending to our trip. We went to the public library on our last day in Amsterdam because it's close to the central station and we were amazed! The building is incredibly light and there are lots of cool chairs and it's very calm inside. But then we went to the top and saw the amazing view of the city! We decided to have lunch there and it was a great meal for really not much money and it was prepared freshly in front of our eyes - I'm a vegan and I had a fresh pizza without cheese with tomatoes and mushrooms for 6,50€, and it was delicious. I'd really recommend coming here to anyone!

Amazing library with Cafe/Restaurant on the top floor!. A short walk from the central station. This amazing library is a must visit. The architecture is already breathtaking. I totally enjoyed the children's area as it was huge with many facilities available. Open to public access, even foreigners.
Not just a library. Beautiful building near the water, modern structures and most beautiful the view. It gives you a clear view over the canal.
Enjoy books and the views. You can visit the library and enjoy some readings or for just to enjoy the views from above to Amsterdam.

knowledge and comfort. the library is a place where you can spend hours, reading books checking some music and their have even a cinema , get a card and you can get up to 35 books a year, good investment!

Beautiful library, amazing rooftop cafeteria. Beautifully designed library that we visited mainly to have lunch at their rooftop cafeteria. Some high end food for a cafeteria, alcohol is served too and stellar outdoor rooftop views. Stayed mostly in the childrens section on the lower floor, big comfy red chairs. Kids even got to play their free public piano for the whole library to hear (good practice session for them). Highly recommend if you are in the area and need a bite to eat.

Top Tourist Tip: The Library (Yes, Really). 7 floors, white leather sofas, Mac desktops, every book/vid/newspaper/periodical you could imagine - and that's just for starters. Eat at the top floor cafe - cheap, good, stylish food and a terrific view of Amsterdam. Oh - and did I mention the public piano in the foyer, for those "I simply must sit down and play a piano" moment. Only the super-cool Dutch could create a library that everyone wants to hang out in and worthy of any tourist guide book.

Magnificent views and lovely food. I am embarrassed to admit that we went to the library to take advantage of the wonderful views from the top floor rather than to read or work but like other reviewers I wish that I had access to a library such as this. The library itself is quiet and peaceful and a wonderful escape from the busy city. On the top floor is the café where the food is not expensive but truly delicious, with an outdoor seating area that provides wonderful views over the harbour and the city. My only disappointment was that we went there on the last day of our holiday and not the first!
Great view from top floor. The library itself is a great place to work: quiet and with internet. The top floor gives a good view of the skyline of the city center.

Great library and Cafe with views!. Wish we had libraries like this. Imagine, books in every language, quiet spaces, access to computers, free exhibitions, lovely bar and a cafe with the best views. Get along there for free. Even on a Sunday!

Good to rest, read, eat and see the City. It is really quite lace, so it is good to rest there, You can even sleep in the armchair. There a piano, and you have a good chance to hear as somebody plays.You can it (last floor here a la palin restarurant - it is good), after that, you can go on the terrace to see the view.You don't need any card to enter - just enter and all books waiting for you - very democratic

Excellent Meal at Reasonable Prices. Our group of 6 people from Toronto, Canada was there at the end of April, 2016. Their food selection was excellent and healthy. We had very tasty 'make your own salad' and very tasty chicken. We ate on the 7th floor, where you can get spectacular views of the city. Prices were more than reasonable as well.

Read and enjoy. The perfect place for introverted solo travellers - one can coszy up with a book while enjoying the picteresque view on the historical centre of Amsterdam. The place to miss student times.
Nice library with great view of the canal. i come here quite often and have the membership card. Highly recommend the la place cafe on the top floor.

Surprisingly good attraction . The central library is a massive building with multiple exhibits on the architecture and the health focus of the city strewn between its traditional bookshelves.It's also free entry and has a brilliant fresh food cafe (almost a market!) on the top floor with high views of the city. We spent a good few hours here in the top floor cafe snacking and reading to the beautiful vistas.

This is worth the visit only for the architecture. This main library of Amsterdam is very much worth the visit, if only for the interior design. But of course the amount of books, when looking for a certain subject, is very attractive.

Great view from the library. If you have the time , go and take a walk to the library. It is a great place for some quiet time and there is a La Place on top of it. There is an amazing view from there to the city. It's a must if you want to get a birds eye view.
Great views!. Though I'm a book-lover I'm not a speaker of Dutch, so I couldn't sit down to enjoy the books, however the views of the city from the top floor cafe were amazing.

Not sure why an attraction at all. Its a library that does not compare well with those of London, Oxford or more recently Birmingham. The café is not particularly good either. The view is worthwhile because just about everywhere else in Amsterdam is flat. Main appeal is that it is free!

Awesome view of Amsterdam . This is a great free thing to do in Amsterdam. We rented bikes for the day and made a stop by the library. There is also a restaurant called 'la place' up there so you can have a decently priced (I spent about 8-9 euros) lunch with an amazing view.

Relaxing and spectacular view. In the old Post's building, a very modern public library with an elegant design. All is white and you can enjoy multimedia services. At the roof, a bar and a not at all expensive self service (but very rich and genuine), with a terrace that offer the BEST view of Amsterdam from the seaside!
Definately have lunch here. Great prices, even better view, very nice place to have lunch. Sandwiches, soups, salads, pizza etc all available here. One to visit
Beautiful Library. My kids are avid readers , so this was a wonderful stop for them. They demanded we go to every floor and just smell the books. My little Belles were in book heaven!

great view of the city. I didn't go to the library for books, but for dinner with a view. At the top of the building is a self service cafe with good food for good prices. The outdoor (covered) seating area offers a great view of the city, for free!

Unexpected gem. We were taken here by a friend who lives in the city - when she suggested we go to the library for a coffee, I was a bit 😳 but the coffee was good, the view fantastic & the food tasty & well priced. Would definitely go again.
Great view of the city. Nice place to have a 180 degree view of the city. They have a nice restaurant at the very top with nice food and ok prices ;-)

Most Amazing Library! Cafe, too!. Truly one of the most amazing libraries I have ever seen. Very new, highly modern, nicely thought out. Plenty of room. The building seems light and airy, and is not at all a musty-stuffy book-crammed old-style building. Coolest thing is a excellent cafeteria on the top floor that includes stunning views of Amsterdam. Go for the collection, stay for lunch.

This is what a library should be.. Futuristic building, multi floors, including amazing children's section, top floor restaurant overlooking Amsterdam. Seven item continental breakfast for about three euros - but doesn't open until 10am. Entry free. Minutes from centre along canal path but watch out for cyclists and scooters - they demand priority and if you want to be sure of getting hit try zebra crossing and green light!! Such lovely people but maniacs on bikes.
Free and beautiful . I wish my public looked like this! What a beautiful building and a great view from the top. Plus it is all free. What more could you ask?
Another must see place in Amsterdam !!!!!!!!!!!!!!. You must certainly visit this place. Another piece of master piece in moderm architecture !!!!!!!!!!!!

Great views. We were told to try here for a reasonable place to eat.......the restaurant is on the top floor and yes the food is good and good for a budget but wow the views over the city were great from the terrace outside........worth a visit for the views alone

Nicest library I've ever seen!. This library is awesome and made me envious that I couldn't be a student here just to come study in this library. It just inspired me to want to read. It's modern, FULL of books, has a lot of floors and has a nice view of the city from up above. There's even a nice little cafe on the top level and the food is tasty and not overpriced.
Amazing building, great places to eat on a ledge outside.. An architectural piece and vast facilities modern to social networks and media. Typically Dutch, and in a quieter place to be in Amsterdam

Amazing collection and set up. Book lovers to music lovers, or if you just want to get lost in the books, this is something i definitely recommend doing.Awesome set up. I was amazed.Not too far from the train station.

See the books, stay for the view!. Definitely a not miss in Amsterdam! If you want to see incredible views in Amsterdam visit the Central Library. Aside from being architectural eye candy, the library also has great food selection on its top floor where you can enjoy a meal while looking out of floor to ceiling windows. It's a nice place to sit and relax and enjoy the company of locals.

Not so much the library. Visit a library on vacation? Well my wife worked in the local library system for many years, so it was just a fun visit. But, it is worth seeing a beautifully laid out library with an excellent cafe' which has a very nice view of the city. It is right across from the floating Chinese restaurant, so it is easy to visit and have a meal at either location.

Library, for a 'lunch with a view'. Of course you'll find the books from E.M. Forster here as well but for a visitor hte upper floor is the best to visit. At the restaurant La Place, you can have a superb lunch with a view at Amsterdam. But it is also a place where you can do your work, study or relax with magazines. Nice atmosphere, nice design, one of the nicest libraries I know.

Nice building with the restaurant on top.... Located between the central station and science museum. Walking distance to the city center. You can spend there couple of hour just by reading the book or listening to music. My favorite place is La Place restaurant with spectacular view.

Highlight is the rooftop restaurant!!. What a view of the city and harbor from the rooftop restaurant, called Kopiebon !. It is cafeteria style but has delicious sandwiches and salads and is a perfect outdoor place to eat and enjoy the view at the same time. A real find !!

Coolest library. This was definitely the coolest library I've been into. Worth a quick visit even if you're not taking out any books. There's a lot of art to see and an interactive floor full of student work and current projects being created/demonstrated.

Great Place. Most beautiful and biggest library I've ever seen. Lots of books and world music cds. Lots of computers available. It is also possible to play the piano and the food on the top floor restaurant is very good.

Good View!. There is a good view of the harbor from the heights of the library and there is a restaurant on the top floor and a good pizza place on ground and first floor. Free internet terminals. Other than that - it's just a library.
See the mouse house. Kids would love the mouse house, a large construction where Sam and Julia live (not live mice but stuffed)

Interactive library, close to Central Station. A new experience in the world of books! You can read many ways now, and this headquarter of books shows you many. Also in the field of music. It is spacious, cool and pleasant. We loved the restaurant on the top, La Place, where you have a great view over the inner city. Absolutely worth a visit!

MOUSE HOUSE AND BRILLIANT DESIGN. This is one of the most beautiful libraries we have ever seen. It is bright and modern. The book shelves are curved and there are lots of areas with comfie big chairs and cushions for reading. A great internet area is also available. The lights are bright and cheerful. Don't miss the amazing Mouse House in the children's section as this was a highlight. Excellent views of the city from upstairs where they also have a cafe. Well worth seeing what a great library can be and the place was packed!

A Pilgrim Site for Book-lovers. OBA is a wonderful example of good use of public money. Huge collections, lots of open space and nice modern architecture, open until 10 pm. The library also has lots international newspapers and magazines. It’s just a couple of minutes’ walk from the central railway station, so a good place to wait for a train... But if you are a book-lover, reserve a few hours of one of your days in Amsterdam for this place – it’s definitely worth it!
Nice view!. I would recommend a visit to the library. Not just for reading a book, but also for the view from the top floor balcony.

A huge pretty library to take a break . Went there thanks to trip advisor reviews. Six levels, level 2 - fiction and 3 -history are interesting and for non Dutch. Other levels books are in Dutch.Ground level kids section is beautiful. I almost wished I could read Dutch. Open till late, 5 minutes walk from central station is an huge advantage. So keep it for a rainy dayOr when you are hungry and want something fast. The cafe is one of the best in the area.I wouldn't go out of the way to visit but worth it if you can make it.And there is a piano, which if you are lucky will have some visitor playing it beautifully.

Amazing Public Resource. I wish my local brand new and very expensive Central Library was even half this good. A lovely place to spend an hour or two browsing, exploring the exhibitions, etc. Cafe on the top floor has wonderful views. Great children's section too which might be handy on a rainy day.
beautiful library. interesting ,great architecture ,very good music department. great restaurant and coffee on the roof with wonderful view of the city

Great view from the top floor. Great View from the top floor. with a market. Great for a afternoon lunch and view of amsterdam. the Library itself was a beautiful building both inside an out. Highly recommend !

huge, modern library - definitely worth checking out. If only libraries in NYC could be like this one! This is probably the biggest library I've ever been in. It's very modern, and has quite a few floors. They even have a cafe on the top floor where you can grab a bite and a view of Amsterdam.When I visited in April 2016, they had this exhibit where you could use your phone to take a 360 selfie. It was kind of hidden, so I don't think a lot of people knew about it.If you're in the area, you should definitely check this place out!

Library Visit. Great place to spend a rainy day. A 7 storey library with the latest technology. Lots of English books. There is a café if you need a break. A play area for children and easy access from all areas of Amsterdam by train or tram.

Enormous Library - extraordinary Cafe!. If only all libraries were like this one. Was killing time hilts waiting for my cousin so I popped in to use the wifi! What a surprise! Excellent facilities, just so jealous that I don't have one like this anywhere near where I live!

A must see; for all who love libaries or just curious about what a very modern library looks like!. I spent 6 days seeing the sights of Amsterdam and would rate this in the top 5! Its modern, user friendly, comprehensive in its collections, and tops it all off with a piano open to play.. In addition there are two very places to eat in the building as well.

You Need to Go Here!. Our friends recommended several "must dos" in Amsterdam and a visit to the Central Library was one of them. What a fabulous place! Actually, after an extensive trip to both England and Holland and LOTS of sites/tours, my hubby an I decided that this was one of our highlights. Take the escalator and stairs to the top floor. You have quite a treat in store, i.e., fab look over the city, history factoids to read, pleasant patio to rest and renew and the GOURMET café is something to wonder.

Well worth a visit. As someone who works in libraries I couldn't resist popping in and I can see why it is a rated attraction. A very modern feeling building, free to access and from the seventh floor the view over Amsterdam is incredible and coupled with a fantastic café on the same floor even better. The building was a great example of what libraries can be; creative, multi purpose and available to all. All parts of this library looked well done with a great finish and worth going to just to take it in.Side note - toilets available for a small charge.

Excellent view. Visit it for a nice lunch.. Beautiful building. You can view the Nemo museum from it's roof. It has many books, modern design. The entrance is free. Go to the last floor to eat a healthy meal. The restaurant is really value for money. For 12 euros you can eat a really decent meal.
Worth a quick visit!. I stopped here to see the Muizenhuis only, but was impressed with the entire library. It is big and busy, but welcoming. Nice place to sit and read between rain storms!

Modern design. Once inside you will see interesting modern design on ground floor so it is worth to check if you are around. Go to top floor and you can take a look from nice terrace and enjoy the view on part of the town. Also coffee and some food available.

Great building, relaxing atmosphere. Interesting to see culture, food and technology in one place all the more with its intriguing architecture. Good buffet options at the top floor for a break at any point of time in the day.

If you need to print something. Location: As you face the Central Station it's about 7 minutes walk down to the right (the floating Chinese restaurant is almost in front of it).You may have your iphone or your ipad in your bag while on the road but you may still need to print something. With the decline of the internet café printing can be a bit of a pain so knowing about the library can be really useful. It doesn't cost anything to visit the library and costs very little to use the computers or print. Really nice building, pleasant personnel.

What a treat!. As a retired librarian, I enjoyed seeing what other cities are doing to meet needs for access to information. Great place to use computers. The children's area on the lower area houses the Mouse Mansion, similar to a handmade dollhouse for mice. The top floor has a refreshment area with a outdoor balcony where you can sit and eat or look over the surrounding area of Amsterdam.
Impressive. Impressive design, fresh, convenient, beautiful children book area. A fine example of the investment in public education

One of my favorite places. This is one of my favorite places in Amsterdam. The library is very big and spread out! It's a good place to study, but also one to have a quiet day.. There is a library called La Place on the topmost floor of the library with a great view of Amsterdam central.
Great View. If you are near Central Station this a great place to view Amsterdam. Head to the top floor buy a snack or beverage and take in the view from the deck.
Lovely library. The library was massive. it was beautifully done with many stories, as well as a food area where you can grab some wine and sit along the windows, observing the city and canals below.
Amazing!!!. This is an amazing place to visit in Amsterdam! There are many computers and sofas to read something. There's a good self service restaurant and a beautiful view.
Nice view of the city. The library is new and specious. The top floor has a big terrace with the view of the city and great café. It's about 10 min walking distance from Central train station.

For book lovers and the view. One of the nicest modern library I have ever been. It is nicely set up: you want to wander around and read books in the comfortable chairs they put in front of the bay window. Just grab a book (there are travel guides, and books in English), or plug your computer, and enjoy your reading while boats are crossing the river in front of you.The ground floor dedicated to kids makes it a great visit for families. Do not leave without admiring the view from the top floor, where you can have a drink and some food.

Interesting Intriguing. Had a stroll through this library with my boyfriend. Its really cool and there are so many interesting exhibits and things to look at while strolling up the building. Very much reccommend this maybe not too much for young children as it is still a library

Amazingly Libary. This is a library that is more than just a library. Very modern a has ambiance that makes you want to explore. Once you are satisfied,go to the restaurant on the top floor for good food and a great view of the city on their outdoor seating area.

Very impressive . A must for every book lover. Whether you are young or old don't skip this place in the center. Start from the bottom, at the kids place. Don't miss the "Mice's house" on display, feel how much they pay attention to the young ones, and then explore it all, up to the top. Enjoy the nice view from the balcony and the nice food in the La Place.

Smells so good!. If you love books, you'll love your visit here. It smells so good and is incredibly well set out. Make sure you head to the very top floor where there is a cafe and outside view over the city

Amazing building. This building is so great to look around. The view from the top is well worth a look and I enjoyed exploring the whole building. It's a great place to study with a space to suit everyone.

Love for print. My friend is a teacher and loves to select nice books to read to her class. I like to wander around and browse. So happy to see that many people still are in love with books. This oBa is so grand that you can wander around for quite some time. And afterwards we always go to the cafe on top to see the skyline of Amsterdam.

Awsome!. This is one of the nicest libraries I have ever visited. It's very modern and with such a cool interior design. I used to sit in one of its comfortable chairs in front of this big window just to have this beautiful view of the city (I guess it was at the 6th floor). Enjoy!

Great library for the whole family. Wow, such a great library. As an American, I'm super jealous because there's nothing comparable in the States. The bottom floor has a kids play area, and the floor above the ground floor (which is either the first or the second floor depending on the nationality of you, dear reader) has a great selection of English fiction, so come here on a rainy day if you're a bookish sort like me.

A Most Worthwhile Place. For a few hours of peace and quiet go to the OBA. A beautiful building with a very rich library. Lots open to the public with a large area where you can read just about any magazine imaginable. There is a small restaurant and coffee-bar. We love it!

Culture and great food!. This is a fabulous addition to the must-see sights of Amsterdam. Worth wandering, even if you can't speak Dutch. Then go up to the 7th floor for fabulous food and views of the City!! In fact the La Place restaurant is so good that it's worth a visit in itself!!

Go there to eat and enjoy the view. Beautiful building inside and out near Central station. Cafe on 7th floor has lots of vegetarian options and is very reasonably priced. Serves beer and wine. Beautiful view. Enjoy.

Great bibliotek. I study here from time to time, lots of books(also english), lots of study places. No free wifi, if you live in Amsterdam you could get 20 euro for a wifi subcription for one year; many relaxing pleces where you can read and enjoy the view(see photo); it's free to enter; nice&new architecture, resturant Place at last floor
Best library ever?. Sure looked like it! The whole 7 floors are amazing, the rooms are well taken care of, and the lounge on the 7th floor offers amazing views over some parts of the city!

Great library and open to 10pm!. We popped in on a rainy afternoon after reading the good reviews and were not disappointed. The library is great for kids, with a section of English books, a great atmosphere, comfy chairs, loads of quiet corners, funky décor, toilets, lockers for bags, a great cafe on the 7th floor. An exemplar of what public libraries should be. Our children both insisted we came back for a second visit before we left Amsterdam.

Beautiful Library..... The library is beautiful. Here, locals come to read, study, do their homework...and eat! The there's a wonderful food court at the top of the library with spectacular views of Amsterdam. You can get anything from fresh juices, delicious salads, chicken, beef, soup, pastries, to even beer and wine!I only wish libraries were like this where I live (near LA) .

One of the best. This library is extraordinary, a mix of interesting books, cultural displays and all sorts of fun things happening. A reflection of an incredible people and society, how open and inviting the library is to everyone, and how well maintained.
Great library to study, relax or admire the view. Tip, go to the top floor for an amazing view of the city! The library is very big and there are many places to sit so it's never overcrowded.

Great library . Took the kids in for a short visit on the way to nemo. They are beside each other. We only checked out the kids library and it was amazing. Has a big English Language section. Plenty of places for them to play and explore. Check out the Mouses house

Rainy day haven for hot coffee. The cafe in the 7th floor has excellent coffee and a nice view of the city. The library is beautiful and interesting and, of course, free, although it costs .30 to use the restroom, so bring change.

We loved this fantastic library. My daughter loves libraries and this modern public library is one of the best. Great architecture and thoughtful design plus an truly excellent buffet/canteen restaurant on the top floor.

Nice to spend some time just for a visit. Amazingly even is not much know by tourist you will enjoy a visit at the OBA in its central location, near central station. Is a new building, in a new developed area, and despite the library is often used by locals you can see people around and is just because is nice visiting.Library is not such a real real quiet and silent place as we think it is, mainly if young students are "studying" there, and there is a restaurant La Place upstairs and a better one Vapiano on the ground floor which you can have a good lunch there as well (dutch standard). Library is around 7 floors, and a underground floor for children where they can play, read or go around for a while. If raining outside, and you are in the area, nice place to keep children happy!

Nice diversion from the hustle and bustle. Took my son who has an Autistic condition and so was having a hard time with the crowds in Amsterdam.He doesn't read Dutch at present but enjoyed the space , the quiet and the scale. Cafe on top floor looked and smelled lovely , but was busy so he didn't want to stay.Pity the balcony was closed when we wee there as the view was awesome. Was a recommendation from a friend for something to do in Amsterdam which can be very expensive and for some people very overwhelming. If your not on a super tight schedule its an excellent place to chill

Wow. Amsterdam's Central Library was the biggest surprise of our family trip. We came here to pass some time on a rainy day and it turned out to be one of our favorite attractions. The children's section is the most beautiful I've ever seen, with a good selection of English books and big poofy chairs all around for us to sit on. The decor is beautiful, with big animal sculptures around. There are little tables the little ones can sit and draw on, a giant tee-pee to play in, a sort of castle the kids can climb, and so much more. And this is just the children's section! The rest of the library was even more incredible, with 7 beautiful floors filled with an enormous selection of books, magazines, newspapers, multimedia and more. On the second floor you can sit and watch the trains go by (lovely for kids), and there's an excellent cafeteria with great views of the city. As a book lover, I could easily spend an entire day here. Don't miss it!

Fabulous LIbrary. It is one of the most beautiful libraries I’ve ever seen, the library itself looks absolutely fantastic! It’s 5 minutes walking from Centraal Station, so make a stop here. Who likes engineering and architecture will love the infrastructure of the building. Everything is very organized, In addition to free admission, you also can use the computers, see the huge collection of books and media, go to Valpiano (Italian restaurant not too expensive) or do what most everybody does when comes in, run to the terrace La Place, which has a cafe with a spectacular view of Amsterdam

Best view on Amsterdam from the 7TH floor. Go directly to the top , where you can also enjoy a lunch or a drink at the Cafeteria La Place .
you can enjoy th view from the terrasse which is breath taking.
then , the Library is all yours .. very well equipped and all the books you can wish ..

Check out the top floor for a good view of the city. My husband and I went straight to the top to check out the view of Amsterdam. The view itself is pretty good (but I heard the view atop the Double Tree Hilton is better), but a bit obstructed by the building itself. The library itself looks absolutely fantastic! I could not believe how many books and media it contains, and it appeared to be very, very organized. It was filled with young and old, students, tourists, and presumably Amsterdam residents.

once in a life experience for kids. I was there some years ago with Polytechnic institute and I felt the kids area would be fantastic for children; this week I went back with my family (my husband and 3 y.o. twin babies Chiara and Simone) and we spent almost 2 ours in the kids area and every moment was worthy; I wish we could have such a library in turin! they even display giant books without words so the experience of reading is possible even if we don't speak dutch! the kids fell in love with this place immediately and didn't want to leave; staff was very kind and we went in with our doble stroller; I could even leave my luggage at the front desk for free.
Biggest Library in Europe. 8 floors Library. Has books and music for all ages. On the top there is a cafe or restaurant with a nice view of the city.
Nice view from the restaurant. I came here for lunch and to enjoy the view over Amsterdam. Food was okay by La Place chain restaurant.

Fabulous Modern Library. This library has a wealth of information to offer, books, audios, exhibitions, children's section. It is a bright and airy building and when you go up to the top floor the views across Amsterdam are beautiful.
Panorma view. Visited to see panorama view of Amsterdam, though the outdoor balcony opened first in april it was still the best panorama view we found in Amsterdam

Most modern library.. Huge library with central escalators , offering many aspects for learning. As tourists we found the seventh floor restaurant excellent value , serving a varied menu and delicious food overlooking the harbour and city beyond. Disappointed the balcony al fresco area didn't open until Easter as it was a calm sunny day , worth visiting just for the view .

Great restaurant and fabulous library. Well worth a visit if not for a progressive interesting library then for a great lunch on the 7th floor restaurant. Not the easiest to get to unless you are at the central station area.

Nice place to read all papers and have a free view form the top. not only for lending books but also for reading all the international papers and to have a coffee on the top floor with a free view of the city

Read all the magazins of the world!. The new library (OBA) is a place wehre you can spend a whole day. Beside lending out books, DVD's and CD's you can vist exhibitions, go in the internet, listen to music, get concentrated in one of the silend study cabines, read a book or read international magazins and newspapers. On the rooftop is a restaurant with a stunning overview of Amsterdam. Admittance is free.
Gorgeus library. I love reading and having lunch on the top terrace.The library is huge, but well organized.You find everything you need.Great service.

Great library . We had a visit at the library on our way to NEMO. This library is the biggest, most modern library I've ever seen in my life. So many stocks, so modern. I wish I could study here sometimes but I'm just a tourist :(

Go to the top floor for the view and a cheap meal. Nice views of the city from floors 6 and 7. There is a cafeteria at the top that does good, freshly made and cheap food, that you can eat with a beer or a glass of wine. The pizza was made in front of my eyes, and was very good. Lots of fresh fruit and vegetables available.

Modern Library and Good Food. This modern library is free and open to the public and provided a great place for some downtime and (dare I say it!) work while I was in Amsterdam. The cafe on the top floor had very good and fresh food although I was bummed that the rooftop open seating area is only open during summer as I could see that the views of the city from there would be amazing. Well worth a lunch visit!

You need to pay for wifi. As for a location, it is nice location and view upstairs is pretty. But if you are visiting and looking some place to connect to wifi you better go for a coffee somewhere else with a free wifi.

A quick visit to the library. This is an amazing space which I would love to spend time in. The spaces are beautifully organised. Since I'm not a local nor a Dutch speaker we made our way to the top floor where the café is located. A great selection of food to sample while enjoying the view. I would avoid the coffee as it is made with an automated machine which serves the coffee or hot chocolate at an insanely hot temperature.
magnificent view. On the top floor you have a view over Amsterdam . With very nice warm weather . There is also a restaurant for drinks.

Impressive place. From outside and inside, it is designed with modern and innovative style for a place that is usually suppose to be boring - a central library. 5 floors and restaurant on top roof with great view of Amsterdam will please your time.
take a rest here. The restaurant on the top floor gives a good view over the cite,But you can also deepen your knowledge.
Great photo opportunity . We snuck in here to go the the top floor to take a picture of Nemo and bridges etc. Beautiful building, beautiful view.

Great cafe and impressive building . Went to the library for lunch - restaurant on top floor is very good. Loads of choice - soup, sandwiches, salads and hot meals. Good prices and a view over the city topped it off- recommend if in the area.

Relaxing place. The library is a very nice place in Amsterdam to take a break while travelling. At the third floor you will find nice seats at the window site. The restaurant on top of the building is very good as well.

Good food, amazing view. Even though the terrace is closed in the winter, you can still enjoy the view while eating good organic and well prepared food.
The library itself is very cozy and I would definitely go there to a quiet book time.
Go there for the view!. The Library is 10-15 muinutes walking from the central station. Apart from many books, they have a restaurant on the top floor, where you have a great view over the city.

Great view. Called in on the way back to the station enroute home, having been advised that the view from the restaurant terrace is spectacular. Unfortunately the terrace appears to be closed in the winter, but had a meal anyway which was good and reasonably priced.

For free! Do not miss. Fantastic library with a big lunch area. Lovely view over the city. Excellent place to go to and listen to your favorite music for ex. Or take a book and lean back in one of the comfortable seats

Wonderful view and great cafe. A surprise hit with the family, due to the 7th Floor terrace with a great view (outside was closed when we visited, but view still visible!). Our sons also loved the children's section in the basement - impressive Lego Star Wars display and other attractions - a real gem (and free to enter!) between the Station and Nemo.

Excellent cafe!. The library is modern and well designed. I recommend going all the way to the top on the escalators which gives you a sense of the scale of the place. Excellent cafe on the top floor with a great range of hot food, sandwiches and rolls, salads snd cakes. Great view from the cafe tho unsurprisingly the terrace was closed in Feb!
Not your typical library. The children's library on the ground floor is exceptional. It worth going just for the views. It is also a great place for enjoying a reasonably priced, relaxing meal.

Good place to have a nice view of the city. The library is modern and very close to central station and nemo.Go to the top floor,there is a cafe with nice decorations.A bit bad luck to be there in winter,the terrace was closed.But you can find a window seat to enjoy the top view of the city.Ordered the apple cake and coffee to have a lovely breakfast to start the day.The locals also like to go there to enjoy the view.Go there early to have a better seat,not many window seats available.

Amazing . When I first visited I was stunned by the volume of literature and media. I mean there's so many floors. You'd probably be hard pressed to not find anything. The best part of visiting the library is going to the balcony on the top floor to enjoy the skyline of Amsterdam. On the same floor is a restaurant where the food is okay and is not spectacular but is definitely convenient. On the bottom floor there is a reception like area where you can buy tickets for many of the sites and theatre shows, so it is indeed a well visited place. You have to swing by the library if you want to take a selfie of the skyline or need a quiet place to study.

Great place to have a break. The library itself is pretty fantastic and up on the top floor is a cafe when there are tables for two to 10 and a bar at the windows overlooking the harbour and Amsterdam. In the summer the balcony is open too.The food is freshly made and prepared in front of you. Everything from fruit smoothies, to home made soup, burgers, salads, grills and sandwiches. There are people working, reading and socilialising. The view over Amsterdam is only visible form the seats near the windows.The atmsophere is calm and there is lots of space.

Go to the top floor!. I'd read on a blog to go and visit the cafe on the top floor and it did not disappoint. The food served there was amazing and the smoothies were lovely and tasty. My husband to be commented that the hot chocolate was in his top 5 ever. Definitely worth going to!
Top floor views.... Top floor views are enough to make a stop here. The escalators are beautiful, and so is the overall design. If nothing else just go upstairs to take in the view.

Amazing just to see and wonder around. We stumbled upon the library by mistake and thought it was really fabulous.With local people all using the library for different reasons we just wondered around taking it all in. There is a lovely cafe overlooking the river and a little exhibiton section with interesting pieces of art.I would have loved to use this library to study, very modern and interesting to see.

One of the best libraries in europe. This is a great library with a very large selection including mp music and places to sit and listen. There is also a huge number of internet terminals(used to be free)but still moderatly priced if you need a computer.The architecture is oustanding. I recommend going to the top floor for the great city view and restaurant.There is also a vapianos(great italian, low prices) that can be entered to outside, same building.

Beautiful and relaxing. We loved spending some time here. It is a very beautiful building with wonderful seats looking through huge windows overlooking the water. An amazing place to go and relax. It has a cafe at the top too.

What's not to love?. This is one of my favorite places in Amsterdam. In addition to comfy chairs and quiet places with outlets to catch up on work, there is a great cafeteria-style restaurant (La Place) on the top floor. When the weather is nice, you can eat on the terrace and get a great view of the city.

Never been to a library this big before. There's not much library in my country so when entering this library I thought at first it was a mall. They have various collections of books, videos, but I'm more attracted to the architecture and layouts.I wasn't here for long though.

Welcoming and Beautiful!. If you're the kind that loves to visit libraries to sit and study, read, or write - this is the place for you! It's welcoming and open, and there are tons of places to sit by the window for a water-side view! I think I stayed for 3 or 4 hours just reading and enjoying the atmosphere!

excellent restaurant on the top floor. beautiful library but we only went to use the restaurant on the top floor which has fantastic food at reasonable prices. Also has amazing viewing platform but it is closed November to march.
EPIC LIBRARY. This is the biggest and best library I have ever seen! Nice architecture, live piano music, a lovely place to study. Has every dvd ever! Worth a visit.

a modern and fine place. The library is a very young place for people who are looking for browsing,for books and for a lovely coffee.Modern systems to use all the services available..close to the main station..it is easily reachable
A world of knowledge. With 7 floors of books, audiovisuals, newspaper, magazines and wi-fi access, this is the best place to spend a few hours on a rainy day in Amsterdam.

A very modern and fun place - but still this is a library!. Absolutely a must-see! the whole library is worth seeing - it such a fun, hip place, nothing dull or dusty, but this is still a library, a serious institution. Very professional and yet friendly, a great pleasure to have a look. On the top floor there is a cafe serving lots of tasty, healthy food, and an open terrace, where one can take greatest pictures of the city from above - marvellous views!

The best view and great cheap food. We were recommended to go to the central library and honestly the view of the city is fantastic It's a great lunch time or afternoon place and the fresh food is gormet canteen style. Amazing food and coffee and beerYou have to go. And right by the station and nemo too:))Worth the walk!

Gorgeous. I have never been to such a gorgeous library, you certainly don't get any of these in the UK! Apart from the wonderful interior the main draw for me was the cafe at the top on the 7th floor, with wonderful views over Amsterdam.The cafe is quite posh, with freshly cooked food and lots of healthy stuff. The menus are all in Dutch, but luckily the staff speak English so although it's a bit tricky to order you can definitely cope. Food was lovely and fresh, and for the same price as some of the stalls outside but of much better quality.Wish I had found this place sooner, I would have definitely returned.

A dreamed library for library lovers. When you want to know a country, the best place to go is to visit their Central Library.There are many different types of reading corners and working tables. Old wooden chair, contemporary plastic chair, sofa corner etc.The children level are filled with big armchairs which parent and child can read together.There is a piano at the main entrance. There is a sign welcoming experienced people come and play for a limit of 30 min. During my 2 hours there, no one abused the use of it - neither too long occupancy or banging by children. You can see the quality of people here.

Great view for a sunset. Went here twice in three days! Its a really easy travel to the top where there is a lovely self-serve restaurant. Went for a coffee one night and came back for dinner to watch the sunset. Very affordable.

A refuge. We went there with our 2 years old son during a week end, when the rain became too persistent for walking around.
A wonderful place, spacious, with a lot of books (obviously!) and a coffe-restaurant on the top.
A 5-stars refuge!

Restaurant on roof. The library has a fantastic restaurant on the top floor [7th]. It's good value and fantastic food, often cooked right in front of you, depending what you choose. We were told about it by a random guy on a train in UK. Loo woman was a bit stroppy first visit. 2nd time different and ok. Food is well worth the effort.

Great view from the restaurant at the top. Big library just a bit along from the Central Station. Great view over the city from the restaurant at the top. Cannot get great pictures though due to the concrete jutting out over the top of the balcony area

Surprise Amsterdam Attraction. This library has one of the best views in Amsterdam and the top floor provides a great place for photographing the city. The food court on the top floor also is excellent and often has soup and sandwich specials for around 5 euros. it is a good place to get a quick but nutritious lunch and it is just a few blocks from the main train station, the central city, and many of the popular hotels here.

Top class. This is an excellent library in Amsterdam. I really love libraries, and value the role they place in communities. I also enjoy seeing modern libraries, and how their architecture compares with the beautiful old libraries such as the National Library of Ireland, the New York Public Library, and the Edinburgh Central Lending Library. This library is Amsterdam is really well designed. I like it a lot. Spread over seven floors, there are loads of aesthetically pleasing features, such as single person "pods", and a gorgeous view from the top floor. The top floor also houses a large café/restaurant, with a huge selection of food and drink. Really. You could justify visiting this library just for the food. Definitely recommended.

Lovely place to relax for a while. This is a short walk from the central train station. Anyone can enter. If you are in the mood for reading, there are many English books. There are also thousands of CDs that you can listen to. I went in mainly because I wanted a quiet place near the station for an hour. I went to the 7th floor where the comfortable chairs offer a great view over the city.

Go to the TOP for the Best View. If you are traveling then it is unlikely you will be checking out any books, but the architecture is intriguing and worth the visit. But my favorite part was seeing the panoramic views of the city from the top floor! Just breathtaking!!! They even have glass overlays that give a now and then snapshot. There is a restaurant on top too, although I didn't eat there.

Fantastic!. Great place. I entered the place just from the street, nobody controlled me, checked my bag, etc, kind of surprise for me, since in my country you cannot enter library like that. Then I was wandering on six floors full of books, CDs, movies and alike. The interior is very beautiful with great restaurant on the 7th floor. Fantastic cultural center and meeting point. I loved it, would spend there more time if I could.

Great place to visit with toddlers. We stopped by with our young daughter, having noticed the impressive kids' section on a previous holiday. She loved looking at all the books and exploring all the hideaways, seats and toys. There was plenty to keep her occupied and they have sections for books in foreign languages too. We then went to the 7th floor cafe, which had a brilliant range of food and plenty of seating and high chairs.
amazing cafe/restaurant at the top.. There is both a great view of the city and a fab eating place at the top. Most unexpected and definitely worth a visit!
A beautiful library. This is a beautiful, huge library with everything for everyone and a very relaxed atmosphere. There is plenty of space to work and a restaurant with a beautiful view at the top.
Nice view. Nice place to go, whole area is worth a visit. With good weather lunch outside at Vapiano is good idea, going to top level is free and you get some views

Impressed by the size of this library. I was impressed by the size and beauty of this building. Inside there are lots of books, films and places to study or navigate on the internet.
Not much to see as a touristic attraction, but it is worth entering to take a picture of the view from the top of the building.

First class public library. This is an exceptionally nice public library, not far from the center of Amsterdam. There is a restaurant on the top floor with panoramic views of the city. To use wifi you need to become a member, which costs 20 euros for a year.

7th Floor Cafe is a Must!. This is one of the imposing new enhancements to the harbor area. Don't be intimidated. Go ahead in and take the elevator to the seventh floor restaurant and theatre. It is disguised as a cafeteria/commissary, but one of the stations prepares food fresh to order. Most of it is organic and locally sourced. Great fish. Generous portions. Sit on the outdoor patio or the "window bar" for a rare view of the city toward the south.
Worth a visit. If you like a good library this is a must see. Good for rainy days and if you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

One of the best libraries in the world. My wife is a librarian and insisted we go here during our honeymoon because apparently it is one of the most famous and popular libraries in the world, not to mention being on the cutting edge of technology in terms of libraries. There is pretty much everything you could want from a library and I would have to say that it was pretty fascinating to see and on the top floor (7th?) there is even a balcony that has a pretty good view of the city and a very good café.
Great library. Fantastic place to visit. There lots of activities for kids, some books in english. Great place to work with laptop.

Worth a stop. A shockingly large collection of CDs & DVDs ! Whole floors of the building filled with shelving. The building itself is an interesting structure and the views are cool. Definitely worth a walk around.
Go on a sunny day. Lovely 7 floors of Library. Has a great view point of Amsterdam.Sadly the balcony wasn't available. Would of loved to had a coffee and cake out with a birds eye view

Well worth the walk. This was further from the train station then expected but well work the walk. The view from the observation deck off the restaurant are wonderful and the library itself is floor after floor of open, light, airy rooms filled with books, art, media. If I lived near this library, I would visit every day!

That architecture... !. I went there to have lunch on the 7th floor from where you have a breathtaking panoramic view of the city. The restaurant offers a large choice of dish, rather good (try the fresh smoothies !) and for a cheap price (I ate for 9€).
The library is huge and its architecture is quite impressive.

Great views, but not much else. This review is slightly biased as I went on a fairly rainy November day and although the building is nice this is far from a must visit in Amsterdam. The views are great but there isn't much else to see from a tourist perspective. Also be aware that unless you're a library member you have to pay for Wi-Fi.

A fantastic public building. The views are famous. The food court on the top floor utilises the space wonderfully. Do take time to explore the books. There are many in English. The free piano downstairs is always nice as the conservatorium of music is close by and the students show their talent.
Great to spend a couple of hours. Really nice architecture, interior, collections of books and relaxing environment to spend a couple of hours !

IMPRESSIVE!!!!. This public library is just impressive. And it helps visitors understand why the dutch boasts such high standard of living. Any nation that puts so much effort and so much work into building up an imposing, modern, free-for-everyone (regardless of how much money u have) and well organized library will most definitely produce high-quality citizens.As an avid reader, I felt touched by the fact this place is open for everyone.

Beautiful view!. The library isn't very impressive. It gives a nice view of Amsterdam though. Also, there are comfortable reading chairs where you can recline and read whilst looking at the amazing and vibrant city that is Amsterdam.

Modern public library with ample space to read and work on PC. Within the policy of the city council many public functions were brought from the inner city to the waterfront of the IJ (former harbour). This applies to the Court of Justice, the Music hall and also to the central building of the public library. At the same time the new building was brought up to date, in the information age. So all kinds of digital media are available here. The result is quite good. Also remarkable are opening hours, being all 7 days, 10-22h. To lend material you have te become a member, but on the spot many more is to be consulted, like a large number of magazines and newspapers, and there are workplaces for the Internet.

Amazingly huge and well organised modern Library . Could not have expected such a modern and high maintenance library in Amsterdam. The 6 th floor provides lovely view via glass windows. Piano played by public was such a wonderful idea and mesmerising interior with bar and restaurant on top. Must visit place in Amstetdam.

Great place to eat. On the top floor is a self service cafe. The food is great and well prices. Can't remember the last time I had a beer in a library. Plenty of space to sit. Free Wifi. Small outside space with views but closed in winter.
Wonderful library!. The world needs more libraries like this. The space, books, videos, radio station, restaurant... draws people in, and that is a wonderful thing.

Great Library Experience. This place is amazing. Just imagine more than five floors of books and other library space. I went specially for the architecture and was blown away. Also, the library has better views than the Nemo Museum, so definitely go. No free wifi, but it is definitely a good place to rest your feet and enjoy nice views and books.

Gorgeous Modern library with great views of the city. There is a bar in this library. I wanted that to be the only line in this review because how damn civilized is it that there is a bar in the library? Grab a book (and yes, there are English titles to choose from), grab a glass of wine, sit yourself in a cozy chair near a window overlooking Amsterdam...what a way to spend a few hours.

Great to visit, heaven for book lovers. The Public Library is in a great location with nice cafeteria on top floor. Excellent views of the city from here without the overpriced drinks you get a few doors down. Children's section is recommended too. Very friendly staff.

Great place for (not-only) book lovers. I have visited the library several times. It is very pleasant place for reading journals, books, to study with good atmosphere. And if you are hungry, there is a good restaurant with nice view to the city.

Beautiful Library. Usually the architecture of a public library doesn't match the archive. After all, you are there to browse and read, not look at the building, right? Well now you can enjoy the building and checkout the collection.

Great. The library sits to the left of the Bahnhof as you are leaving. 5 minute walk. It is several floors. Has many books and computers available for use. On top they have quite a restaurant. We went there for lunch and sat out on a balcony overlooking the city. Nice views. There were 4 of us and we had assortment of things to eat and drink. We were all satisfied. Served cafeteria style, prices are reasonable. Worthwhile visiting just for lunch.
Using the Central Library. I used the Central Library as a place to work while in Amsterdam. Great facilities, the staff is great and there is an excellent restaurant.

a true hidden gem. It's a gem because ..who goes to the library when visiting a city? But I truly recommend it. It has the best views from the top floor, you can have some nice food at the La Place there and you can be amazed of how good this library looks like. it's very modern and the vibe is really good, because nice people go to libraries, right?

Interesting building and nice place to visit. I collect books there every 3 weeks and always enjoy a visit.The architecture is quite interesting and downstairs in the kids section is a huge 'doll house' but the dolls are replaced by mice.Everything is in there and the details are amazing.You can also play on the piano that is downstairs or have a quiet read in a magazine or newspaper in that section.Right next to it is a Vapiano restaurant that serves fresh pasta and pizza for very reasonable prices.

Great view . 4 of us ordered mushroom&tomato soup, pear pastry and Latte at the top floor restaurant, soup was very good, pastry ok, Large Latte with big glass almost 500ml, very worth it for the view and overall experience.

wonderful and inspiring place (and building). this is the kind of library you want to have at your city. the building is nicely designed with a sightseeing coffee shop on the top. At the first floor you can hang out with your children, sitting on comfortable couches to read a bit and have fun. all the other floors have absolutely everything. Inspiring place

Roof top cafe with a view. With airy cavernous interiors and a feeling of light filled modernity find refreshment on the top floor where there is a cafe offering tasty faire and outside terracing with views of the surrounding harbour and buildings.

Modern. Huge library with great views. Had a little look round and lots of facilities. I enjoyed dinner at the top and views were lovely of Amsterdam. However it was raining and windy when I went so wrap up warm as it's cold at the top on the balcony.

A real surprise!. After touring this wonderful modern library with its unique architecture and variety of places to read, research and study, I was delighted to find a restaurant on the 7th floor with a wonderful array of goodies. Pick up some food and eat out on the deck overlooking Amsterdam.

Perfect place to have a dinner!. Went there just to have a dinner with the city view as it was highly recommended in the previous reviews, but of course I saw the library itself and it would be great to be able to come back there and spend some time with a nice book! Heven't seen a better library before! Very light and colorful! As for the dinner, it was also very well - the weather allowed us to seat outside and we enjoyed the beautiful city views. Sups, pizza and apple pie with nuts is definitely worth trying!

Amsterdam Panorama at the top floor. Beautifully designed library in teh centre of Amsterdam, right next to the Conservatorium. Great views of the City from the top floor, where you can have a drink and/or food.

Great food and an amazing view of Amsterdam. Do not miss the restaurant on the top floor. Delicious food, excellent value and a stunning view from the roof terrace across Amsterdam. We had lunch here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Do not miss this one!

Breathtaking view of Amsterdam. Just the perfect place to be for a fantastic view of Amsterdam.Lovely to go there and enjoy breakfast or lunch form the top bar and take lots of pictures.Splendid architecture and relaxing environment in the many levels of books and medias and very curious spaces to focus and study
Drink beer in the library!. Great view from the cafe on the top floor; close to Central Station. Outdoor seating even. Open and bright library.

Excellent for vist and a meal. This is a beautifully designed library filled with light, books, and lots of comfortable seating. While we visited, there was a fun exhibition "Humans of Amsterdam" that was modeled after "Humans of New York". We also took the stairs to the top floor, where we enjoyed an excellent curry chicken rice bowl made just for us and sat with a view looking back over the city of Amsterdam. This is one of my favorite places in downtown Amsterdam. It's conveniently located to the central train station.

I would visit the library more if they came like this in the states!. Wow! Hard to believe this is a library! Beutiful canal-front multi-level building with a cafe on the patio on the ground floor and an inside-outside cafe on the 7th floor. Didn't actually eat there, but did peruse the offerings, and it looked fantastic! Not sure if it's worth the trip if you aren't already fairly close by, but definitely should check it out if you are in the area, or as another reviewer said, great for a rainy day.

Great on a rainy day. I love this place! I'm not sure it's really an attraction - it is after a multilevel library, but the volume and organization of the books is incredible. AND the best - there is a self-serve restaurant with a huge variety of healthy food and a great view at the top. So first, go up the stairs then (if I remember) 7(?) escalators to the top.

interesting building. I only wanted to go in to see the views across the city.I loved the little cafe on the top floor and the rod deck did not disappoint.peaceful,beautiful and worth a visit if you have the time
Good views. The cafe restaurant at top is a good value especially od you are looking for fresh roasted vegetables. Nice views from the roof deck where you can ear.
Very peaceful location with great view. From the top floor, what a view of Amsterdam. Loved the cafe, There was such a variety of food & the price was very reasonable.
relax, read.. As a former literacy teacher who ran a library for a year, I am a sucker for all things "library". This delivers everything I look for except that old musty bookseller...mmmm.

a book with a view. want to have a great view over the city and see a beautiful modern and vast library. This is the place. Food offering is great, library has everything you want. If you are lucky there is a piano player who really knows how to play. Take the escalators into the top floor and pass by all the different section of the library. Impressive. When you reach the top floor get a drink and spend some time on the terrace. Great view, and an image which explains everything you see. AND ITS FOR FREE !!!
nice views on the top floor!. Tourons! There is a moderately priced self service restaurant on the top floor. Be a bit quiet on the escalators, this is a library after all.
Modern building and working atmosphere. Original and very modern buiding. It is very nice to work there, with a lot of materials and even foreign books.

Central Library (Bibliotheek) - Amsterdam. We had a rainy day and had to wait until we could get into our apartment we rented from Amsterdam City Apartments. We relaxed, read and had lunch in the 7th floor restaurant. This is a remarkable and truly modern/up-to-date library. Definitely worth the visit.

Awesome Library. The library is huge and spectacular. The design is savvy and interesting. Just love all the books and inviting reading areas.
The cafe on the highest floor has good food too. Get a place near the window to see the city of Amsterdam.
Week in Amsterdam. Free to go in. Awesome library. Large. Has 5 floors plus a café. Great view of Amsterdam from the north side. Just neat to see.
Fantastic experience. We went as a group with kids. Kids love it even the adults.. We had a fantastic time! Nice bright and airy rooms in there. Kids can spend hours reading for free.
Not to be missed. The best Library we have ever been too, wonderful kids area and top floor eating area with some of the best views in the city
Quiet roof top terasse with great views. Nice, quiet roof top terasse with great views. A lot of different food to choose from. Child friendly atmosphere
Great view from the restaurant. This is a beautifully modern Library. They also have a lovely restaurant on the top floor and one can eat outside and enjoy the view on nice days. Great photo op.

Peaceful place. A 7-floor library with a huge collection of whatever you want. I spend more than an entire morning inside, looking for all of my interests. From classic to contemporary books, from art to the history of photography, you could find all you need.
At the 7th floor you have a wonderful panoramic view of the canals.
Lovely place. A beautiful building in the heart of Amsterdam! A nice place to spend time and enjoy the nice view on the top!

We came for the view but stayed for the food. As a retired librarian I usually make visiting libraries low on my list - been there, done it. However, this striking building near the Central Station came highly recommended by a friend. We admired the open access on all the floors and found the cafe food very appealing even though that wasn't what we had in mind. The rows of fresh fruit smoothies were irresistible and we found the sandwich selection to our taste as well. It was good food and reasonable. Sitting on the terrace and then spending time at the fixed viewing stations of the city was well worth a break from the August crowds.

Gorgeous. An amazing piece of modern architecture on the outside, but wait till you get inside - it's one of the most beautiful, ultra-modern libraries on earth, like Ikea went to bed and woke up next to Matthew McConnaughey in Interstellar. Even if you don't want to actually sit in it and read something, it's worth it just to wander around for half an hour before you go to the Science Museum over the bridge.

Go to he top with an over the top view. Go to the top, not 'over it. Though tjhe view from the terrace is very over the top. Great, especially when there is no rain or fog :) Nice building, airy and light. Worthwhile to see. The restaurant on top is OK but not very special as wellas expensive in my view.

A great place!. This is a great library with lots of extras! When the weather is nice, you can have a coffee (or something else) at the restaurant up top on the terrace, where the view is great.I especially love the children's department, where you can see the real "Muizenhuis" and there are so many nooks where you can sit with your child and read together!
A couple of hours in a nice place. Very nice walk and the restaurant is beautiful. International food, very relaxing staying. It's definely good to go for a visit.
Awesome library and great food at cafe. A library like no other with an awesome (cheap) cafe with views of Amsterdam. The library looked new and very well kept and organised.

An unexpected pleasure. A friend recommended that we visit the library and I am glad we did. It is a very interesting contemporary building with a lovely cafe on the top floor that has an excellent view of the city. Plus they have an excellent selection of fresh food at very reasonable prices.

Good place for lunch. We went to this library to eat lunch. The lunch had been recommended by someone handling our transfer. The cafeteria is on the 7th floor and has a great view. There is a good variety of food and drink. We had a very nice lunch.
Recommended to visit.... Free entrance to the Library. On the last floor there is cafe.Where you can have cup of coffee or branch/lunch.

Love at the first sight and still very happy after all those years:). Really wonderful library, with books and magazines in many languages. In my opinion, a true reflection on the character of Dutch as a nation. Worth a visit even if just to appreciate the architecture and see how versatile the collection is. Staff helpful and you can even buy tickets for half price shows for the same evening. I LOVE OBA!!!

Great cafe and views over the city harbour. The library is well worth a visit for the great views over the city and inner harbour plus the cafe has a really great range of fresh food and is good value. You can easily walk here from the central station past a range of new hotels and restaurants, keep going and head for the library you won't be dissappointed!

Incredible view!. This was our first vista to the Library. What a view! The terrace on the roof is well worth that last flight of stairs! As with so many places in Amsterdam, it is unique and shows the creativity of the Dutch.
View and good food. Amazing view and there was a La Place restaruant. These restaruants were sold fresh and delicious food. :)

Great cafe. The library is housed in a very modern building, with floors and floors of books.
There is a great cafe on the top floor, with a great selection of fresh food.
There's also a conservatory where you can eat and marvel at the wonderful
views over the city.

Modern library with great views from the top floor. Crisp, clean, "sterile", stark, bright - 7 floors of modern library with every "luxury" a person could ever want in a library. The top floor is a cafeteria-style eatery with an option to eat outside where there are incredible views of Amsterdam. Go - even if it's just for the fabulous view!

Great building and nice views. Great building from the architectural point of view (made mainly with glass façades), great location and 6 floors filled with books. Is has a coffee place with a great view of Amsterdam city.

Great design, good equipment, huge collection, good food and drinks with a stunning view.. The staff is so very helpful. There are all kinds of seats and corners to read and to study, to listen and to watch. The design of the building, the furniture, the rooms is great. The view from the top floor restaurant terrace is breathtaking.

Don't miss. Oba is a very big bibliothec with several themes and a multimedia floor.
You should go to the last floor to have a good view of Amsterdam

Beautiful Library on the water!. I only had time to see the first few floors, but the first floor view is stunning! Love the modern, clean lines of the shelving, and an interesting feature on the second floor is the radio station.

Nice view!!!. You can go there and have a drink or lunch in the terrace on the upper floor. The view of Amsterdam form there is absolutely fantastic and you will spend a nice time. Don't loose the opportunity to have a moment there!.

Nice and very large library. If you live in Amsterdam this is a great place to visit for art exhibitions, the restaurant on the upper floor and the computer access but for tourists, it may not be worth an extra trip especially because it is a little out of the way from most tourist activities. If you do visit, take a quick stroll through the stacks and check out how the books are categorized (murder mysteries, cooking, drama, comedy, etc.) - they use a very interesting picture system.

Superb architecture and a great city view. You gotta give it to these Dutch architects: they really know how to build an inviting library. After visiting the Koolfhaas designed library in Seattle i quickly fell for this gem. Don´t forget to visit the rooftop café on the top floor - great city views!

Beautiful Library!. Huge, beautiful library. The restaurant/cafe at the top has great food and snack options. I was able to grab a strawberry banana smoothie and chocolate chip cookie and sit out on the deck which has an amazing view of the water.

Wish we had a library like this!. This has become our favorite "fast food" place in Amsterdam. The cafe on the top floor is wonderful - food, view from terrace and free wifi. Taking the escalator to the top floor you get amazing views of all the different floors. They have all sorts of seating and plug-ins so people can use their electronics on each floor. It is bright and inviting. They have piano in the lobby. One time a gentleman was playing incredible classical music which we enjoyed for 30 minutes. Close to Centraal Station, NEMO and the Oosterdocks. Definitely worth a visit.

Wonderful. OBA became one of our highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. Modern, clean, organised and absolutely beautiful. You can seat and read any book you like, or you can have a nice coffe (or a meal) ate the restaurant at top of the building. Feel free, just go and make your visit at your way, just be shore that you'll get lost in some great book and the beauty of this place.

Good Views Near the Train Station. The central library is just a few blocks east of the central train station, and is worth a quick visit. It's free to enter, it's an interesting building, and there's a great view from the top-floor cafe (which is a good place for a coffee and a snack or a meal).

Libraries are normally not on the must list, but this is one definitely is.. The mouse house in the basement of this building is a must see whether you're with children or not. We spent well over a half-hour checking it out. The library is only a short walk from the central station and there is no admission charge. It also has an excellent cafeteria on the top floor with terrific views of the city.

Excellent and away from the tourist routes. We went to the library largely to escape the sheer quantity of tourists in central Amsterdam; I am of course a tourist myself, but sometimes I simply want to get away from people like me :-DAnyway, the library is significantly away from the tourist routes. Technically, the library presented excellently with a huge book stock and was modern and well-organised. We went in the evening and so many floors of the library were very quiet and pleasant.Part of why we went, ironically, was in order to get some dinner and this was possible on the very top floor, where there is a large self-service restaurant, where fresh pizza is also prepared to order, which can then be eaten on the outside terrace, which provides excellent views.

WHY DOES THE SYSTEM ONLY COUNT CHINESE CHARACTER??. 為什麼只有中文字元可以被算字數這樣我剛剛打個英文算甚麼？這是一個很好的圖書館、算是我看過管理好滿高科技的，但是有一團小孩從頂樓餐廳跑下來的時候有點吵My friend suggested me to go to this library, I'd bet it's one of the best and technical libraries in the world. You've got to pay form your creditcard throught the machines in the lobby if you wanna use the internet in the library. (since you're a foreigner)This is the coolest library i've ever seen. Being a nerd means that you've got a brilliant perspective towards library. The only problem was as a solo traveler it wasn't possible for me to lend any books I was fond of from there. I sat and read for a few hours there and went to the top floor which provides a spectacular view of Amsterdam and some authentic meals there. The food was so delicious and were affordable after a couple of days of waffles and cold-meals. Recommend! There's strange asian restaurant in front of the library though, it was hilarious to me...lol nevermind. just go for the library.
Looks great from the inside too. This huge library in the center of Amsterdam is a nice place to visit, to chill a bit, to read or just to use the internet. Also the view is amazing.

Who knew?. We were at the OBA ofr the opening of a conference, and decided to go back after the conference for brunch and a look around. The café was really good, the selection and quality of food amazing - for a library. It is open 7 days, 10am-10pm. The big surprise was the Mouse House display in the basement. It is beautiful, and needs a long visit to do it justice. Both children and adults need to see it. If you are visiting the nearby Nemo centre with children, make sure you cross over and don't miss this gem.
Good food and great view. I went there to eat something and for the view. Besides eating, as a tourist, you shouldn't spend time there. There are so many things to do in Amsterdam.
Loud, dirty & altogether terrible. Don't go there, it's absolutely horrible. Also, it's way too loud if you also go there and then, it'll be even louder. That's not good. Too loud.

Great top floor cafe. Best views in the city from the top-floor cafe, which you can go up and visit without having to use the cafe. Although, the food is particularly fresh and enticing so staying to enjoy that is recommended.
Surprise on the roof. We did not actually use the library but on the top floor there is a restaurant and the food was good but the view was amazing
Restaurant:). We love that library. The most because restaurant on a roof is amazing! Really nice place for all people!
