Highly recommended. .. Highly recommended. very nice and modern building. nice views from the 7nth flour. A good place t eat . Open tll 10th Oclock

Nice place to visit. The library is nice place to visit. Its beautiful and modern from the inside and they have a piano in the main entrance hall, and you are free to play it if you wish (my firend did). The wiews on the roof are fantastic and you can enjoy some good quality lunch there aswell.

Get a good view of the city for free. Superb audio selection, modern and cozy design and nice staff. Most importantly, it offers a good view of the city for free!
Not many English books though.
Beautiful building. To be honest I would be able to judge the collections but what a beautiful architecture! Also, the top floor offers a great view of the city!
for the book lovers. Amazing place, good collection of books and a very good cafe on the top floor .The views from top are good .The place is close to central station

Great views!!. We visited the library only for the view as it was on our map as a must have photo!
Glad we went and wish we had tried the food as it looked great!!
Useful and Modern. This has all the features of a helpful place even as much is able to utilitized on a self-serve basis. Wonderful spaces and views of the city.

Cheap but totally amazing breakfast on the top floor. I arrived into Amsterdam quite early on a night train from Zurich. I wanted to visit the library anyway - being quite a lover of vast book collections - so I arrived there first thing. The actual layout and size of the library is in itself awesome ...great to have a casual wander around if, like me, you're strange enough to just enjoy *looking* at lots of neatly aligned books. Okay, the breakfast. Go to the cafe on the top floor. I ordered just a cappuccino for about €2.50 but the worker told me that for €3.25 I can take about 5 items off the breakfast buffet menu PLUS the cappuccino. I ended up with: freshly squeezed orange juice, a cappuccino, two croissants, a boiled egg and a bread roll! I might go back to Amsterdam just for the cheap breakfast.

Fantastic library but don't go for the view. Lots of reviews go on about the view over the city. It's ok but nothing compared to that from the Sky Lounge at the Doubletree at Hilton, just along the road. Back to the library; outstanding design, caters for everyone - kids, adults, book lovers, music and movie lovers, and food lovers. Really nice quality array of fooderies on the 7th floor....and reasonable prices too. It's in a really nice part of Amsterdam, near Centraal Station but away from the party goers. Worth going for the food, if not the books
Well worth a visit.. This is amazing library that is situated over 7 floor, I think. Extremely well thought of with loads of comfortable sitting places, charging corners and abundancy of books.

View from the top. Definitely worth a visit. The view from the top is beautiful, though I do agree with people who say it's not high enough for a perfect panoramic view.The food in the café there is great, but it's not mandatory to eat there to reach the terrace for the view.

Nice architecture, decent food, paid wifi, pay toilets. Other reviews call out the views from the cafeteria on the 7th floor as reason enough to go. Not in my opinion - it's not high enough for the sweeping panorama. Food is good and relatively low price, but unless you plan to borrow a book our dvd, not really worth it. Bathroom tax of 20 cents, and yes, they make change at the door. 1 euro for 30 minutes of wifi - go to the Starbucks down the street instead.
superb view from the top level. library is clean and has a huge collection. superb view from the top in a cosy little restaurant (la place)!

went for the vie. Many people had talked about the view from the cafe but I thought it was just okay. The cafe food looked good but I didn't try it. I did try to use their computers for internet but it required a credit card and the machine did not like mine.

Nice view of city. Great views on a clear day across Amsterdam and good restaurant. Just beside Central Station and open until 10pm and close to passenger ferries (free) across to the north of the city.

Not to go there. I advise everybody to take the trouble and go to the central library and avoid this place. I may look pretty, but the people that work here are a pain in the ss. Simply ask them a question and they treat you like you insult them, wake them from their slumber. I tried several times to print a document here, but every time they tell a different story. But of course I am the stupid guy, that doesn't understand how you're supposed to approach them. Actually I think they use this place for unemployed women to get used to working in an office. As a boss I would avoid hiring any of them and as a customer I would avoid this place at all times. Try it at your own risk, you've been warned

Brilliant place to visit. There is a reason why a public library is ranked no. 5 on the "things to do in Amsterdam". Its a must visit.The children's area in the basement is one the most charming areas I have ever seen - if I was a child I would be delighted to visit this library. There is also a great store of music and movies on the higher floors and a live FM station running from the library (which seems logical as the RJ can pick out any music he or she may like from the library itself)There is also a free piano accessible to only those who can play reasonably and when we were there a young pianist was playing the most wonderful music that was resounding in the background making our library visit all the more enjoyable.The mouse sculpture is art! Nothing short of art!

Great view, interesting architecture. This definitely is not what you'd expect of a public library: it is huge, modern, spacious and filled with books, CDs, music. The view from the top, as everyone will mention, is quite spectacular.However, beyond that, what I liked most about this library is its location. It emanates a different vibe than the rest of Amsterdam and, for that reason, is worth discovering.
Great place to visit. Very impressive library. The building is modern, and the views are amazing. There is a very good self service restaurant on the top floor, with a terrace with incredible views.

One of the best libraries. You may not think to visit a library while traveling -- I don't typically, either, but this one is a sight to behold. This is modern library and beautiful. The collection is large, and there's even a radio station that broadcasts from inside the library. There's a piano for playing downstairs (though a sign notes that it is for experienced players). The escalators are also neat -- they operate slowly but then go full speed once you step on it. This library makes me wish I had spent time studying in Amsterdam!
Wonderful library. Very modern building with an excellent concept that makes you feel like hanging out at the library :) There are two restaurants in the building. Membership for kids is free.

Went on a riany day and loved it!. I went here mostly to escape the rain and it was well worth it. I ended up staying for several hours, reading magazines and sitting in the cafe. There is a huge selection of music on one floor and the cafe terrace has fantastic views over Amsterdam.

an interesting place to visit. I have never been in to use the books but there is lots of computers available for use and there is a reat view of the city from all the floors ... the top floor also have nice food and bar on it ..... this is not your average library

Modern Vibe & a Great View. Such an amazing library, with modern architecture and a great atmosphere. It's located right beside Amsterdam Centraal (main train station). Head to the 7th floor for an amazing view and a bite from La Place.
Great view of Amsterdam. There is a great view from the 6th floor of the library. There is also a cafe there. It is an easy walk to the library from the central train station.

A library and a Business Center!. Went to Amsterdam for a meeting and I had all morning to myself and a lot of work to do.The library is free to enter. Wifi is purchased at the dispensing machines next to reception. The staff at reception are very friendly and speak perfect English.You can sit in any floor at one of the many large study tables. Clean, good reading light...PS: if you like my review click OK!
Amazing space!. We loved the central library. It was organized and user friendly. The space was large, well lighted, and like an architecturally interesting department store with the escalators.
what a 'library'. Didn't look at any books but the view and the restaurant on the top floowr were amazing - well worth a visit.

Wow, What a Library!. If you love libraries, this one will thrill you, even if you don't read Dutch. You can buy an inexpensive ticket to use the Internet on your own device, or you can use the tickets to surf the Internet on their (rather elderly) Windows based computers. There are interesting art exhibits, lots of periodicals, and terrific people watching. The view from the top floor is a fine one, and doesn't require you to fight crowds to see it.One plus for this disabled visitor was the easy access all through the building.
The best library of amsterdam. It's just it, the best library of the city. With a great view, public computers and a huge variety of books. I feel like it need a little more books in english tho.

Excellent library. This building is throughly modern, well laid out, and contains millions of books. The walls are almost entirely devoted to looking out at the canals and city. There are plenty of seats in alcoves, covered by screens, and at old antique tables. There is a pretty good self-serve canteen on the top floor, which also has excellent views. The only downside is WiFi is restricted to library cardholders only. Remember, this is a library, so remember to "shhh."

Stunning view, amazing library. I visited this library couple of months ago on a sunny day. The location is very convinient for students - it stands right next to the central station The building itself is very impressive, bright and spacious, filled with modern furniture. On top of it there is a restaurant and even though we felt incredibly awkward for sneaking in there, we did it anyway and it was more than worth it! The view from up there is incredible!

Great place to relax and ..READ. Beautiful building, free access and a nice restaurant at the top.Inside you'll find a huge selection of books and DVD's, CD's.. local students and international visitors in a modern and relaxed environment
Free Aries views of central Amsterdam 💕. Excellent for views of central Amsterdam from top floor. Lovely restaurant on balcony. Free admission

Go for the View!. Slick and modern looking library. Most likely you won't be borrowing any materials, though they seem to have a very healthy amount of stuff to look through, but go in anyway and head up to the top floor for a nice cafe and an amazing (and free!) view of the city.

Very impressive library.. This is one of the most impressive libraries I've seen. However, it is a library and it isn't historic so not sure I'd put it on a must see list. More if you're in the area, then it's quite nice.
a modern library with a beautiful viewing about city. many and diverse domain of interests, large space for reading and very organized. you can ask for helping if you want

Impressive!. A large and modernized library. Although most writing and books are in dutch, its easy to figure out what you are doing. Friendly and helpful staff. Must check out the miniature mouse house, amazing!

Amazing place for work and much more. A beautiful, light and spacious place, full of inspiration and 'good vibes' for working, thinking, reading and having thoughtful conversations =) ...a piano on the first floor, where anyone could play (I was lucky to listen to someone playing very gently Yurima's "Kiss the rain".. beautiful))))... a large children area where kids can run and play..... many sofas and soft bags to sit and read among the shelves... and a wonderful cafe-restaurant with a terrace overlooking the town on the top floor offers a great selection of fresh and very home-like tasting food :-)Entrance is open to anyone, you can just walk in and wander around, picking at books... There is a computer area with wi-fi, but I guess you need registration to use that one (not sure)I highly recommend the Central Library for a visit to anyone who stays in Amsterdam a little more than just a couple of days..)))

Casual. Good self-service.. Good view, tasty food, nice selection. On the top floor of the library you will find a spacy self service place, suitable for a bite between meals or a casual meal. Nice place for children. Beware of the pidgeons when eating outside! Don't leave plates behind.

Public Library is Awesome!. I am a librarian and I can tell you that this is the coolest library I have ever visited! Check out the café on the 7th floor for wonderful fresh food and a great view looking over the city. The children's room is amazing downstairs.

Best library ever!!. Soo cool! Wish I had a library like this at home. It would definitely motivate me to study more lol. The contemporary style, lighting, study spaces, children's section and rooftop patio/restaurant is the standard to which all libraries should try to live up to. It might seem weird to visit a library for 'fun' but I highly recommend people check it it out. It's a very inviting place.

Library with books and also a top-level cafe. We visited the central library and spent about 20 minutes wandering around the stacks, especially browsing the English language novels. The library covers 6 floors of books, I believe mostly in Dutch, but we also saw English, French, and German, and I'm sure there are others. We then enjoyed lunch in the La Place cafe on the top floor. It has a great view of the canal, including the nearby NEMO science center. The food was also good and reasonably priced, at least for Amsterdam. We were glad that we took the time to visit.
Good food great view. Go to the top of the library and you will not be disappointed. The food is reasonably priced of good quality. Sit on the terrace and enjoy the view of the city.

Stunning views and great food. The interior of the library is stunning, and the escalators speed up when in use. Take the lift to the top floor and enjoy extensive views over Amsterdam with information provided about what you are looking at. The restaurant up there is great too with a really good range of healthy, well priced drinks, snacks and meals

Amazing view. Visited their vast collection then went up to the 7th (?) floor café to look at the view of Amsterdam. Great photo op! Free too! Easy walk from Central Station or the Cruise Pier. Definitely worth a visit if only for the views.

Wonderful spot to relax while touring the city. The Public Library near the Central Station is a nice modern building with a lovely architecture and a great choice of books (of course, mostly in Dutch). The best point for tourists is the top floor cafeteria with panoramic terrace, which gives you a good spot for eating, resting and looking over the water at Nemo, Central Station and the old town.Toilets are not free - 0,2 € fee!

must ! on your visit to Amsterdam. Just see the architecture of this amazing public library - read a book for the kids on the first floor. visit the gallery on the second floor, listen to music on the 3rd, see a movie on the 5th and have lunch at the nice restaurant with a view on Amsterdam on the 6th. Perfect afternnon !

Fabulous Library. Definitely worth a visit even just to see the views of Amsterdam! The cafe on the top floor is lovely, it is very clean and the prices of food are reasonable. It is a fantastic library especially if the weather isn't great.
Its an Expereince. Amazing Place, for a tourist, it's a must visit place. To have a detailed visit and experience have enough time with you.
best library i've been. very bright and big library with a cozy laidback atmosphere.The set up is very nice.only downfall os it is a bit out of the citycentre.

Modern beautiful building near the IJ. Located close to central station this modern library comes to its full potential. Spacious, nice collections in history, art, literature geography, etc. Deserves all attention and gives a nice view of Amsterdam on top of it
breitner review. went for the exhibition and loved the friendly staff and layout of exhibition. wished had time to explore more of building and items - fascinating place

Amazing for booklovers!. In its core, the OBA is a place is like any other library. Offering books, CD's, DVD's and whatnot, you can get whatever you're searching for.What is impressive, is the architecture and the sheer size of the library. It is definitely worth a visit, be it only for the view and the cozy terrace, or the books - hence why this is a library :)

Open and airy - Pizza!. This is really the most lovely and open and airy libraries I have ever seen. It is right on the way to the Science Museum. We popped in to see the kids books. There is a great resto right there (Vapiano) and you can look into the library from there. They do handmade pasta and pizzas and salads. Loved it!

Helpful staff. Great library with wonderful staff and a large section for kids. You are able to pay a small fee to use the computers and to print things. The staff we talked to was very pleasant and helpful.

More than a Library. We stopped in to view the library & washroom break. We also had a good and reasonable supper in cafeteria style restaurant on upper floor. I had pizza that was made in front of me. Service was friendly but slow. We spent time on balcony enjoying the sites of Amsterdam.

One of the best restaurants in 'Dam with a great view. It's a library! 6 floors of books and CD's etc ;) (though they do have exhibitions and other bits and bobs I am told). However the 7th floor is a delight. It's a whole floor restaurant, very reasonably priced with much of the food cooked to order in front of you (if you watch and aren't attracted to all the other dishes!). Go and have a pizza made or steak and chips. That good, went three times.

Beautiful landscape and amazing library. The most beautiful landscape I saw in Amsterdam was in the panoramic cafe of this library. You can go up and don't need to eat anything to just be there for some minutes and admire the view from the city and take great snaps. The library itself is also really interesting. Beautiful, organised and a welcoming atmosphere. They have a floor with a huge collection of music and films that made me wanna have a membership card!

Modern architecture meets modern library. Light, welcoming, friendly, inspiring children's library, more DVD's than HMV (although I haven't bothered to confirm this) and a great little modern cafe on the top floor with a view over the harbour and rooftops.

Beautiful Library. I decided to go into the library on my walk back to my hotel one night. They have a large selection of books and electronic library resources. I really enjoyed the library and was surprised to see that there was a cafe on the top floor. From the cafe, you also have a great view of the city and waterways.
The dam 2015. Great meeting place best and great free views from rooftop cafe must visit for amsterdam please stop by for a book and a beer. Only in amsterdam. ..

Go for the Mouse House!. My wife, a middle school librarian, put this on our agenda to see the Mouse House. I went along with it, and was glad I did. The library itself is in a great area to look across the canal to Amsterdam without the crowds of Centraal Staion, but the Mouse House is incredible. There is picture book and story about this work of art. It is huge and extremely detailed. It is truly a work of art and I can't believe that they were able to move this thing into the library. Both children and adults will be able to appreciate this. When we were there there were only a few others that came by and looked at it. Good wholesome fun in Amsterdam.

What a view!. We discovered by chance that you can go up in the Bibliotheek lift to the viewing platform where we enjoyed fabulous views right across Amsterdam. There is also a very good café/restaurant on this floor so we had our morning coffee on the outside terrace where we could watch the boats going by & the hubbub of the city beyond. We would recommend it if you are in the area.

Amazing place. I used to come to kill time between the classes while studying at UvA, but even if you're not a student, this place is a must when visiting Amsterdam! Enter the library and go straight to their rooftop cafe to have a cup of coffee while enjoying amazing panorama views of the city. And if you play the piano, you can make everyone's day by playing one that stands just by the entrance of the building (I hope it's still there!).
Beautiful views. Great place to start your trip in Amsterdam! Go to the top floor to take pictures, the views are beautiful!

Well worth a visit. The OBA is a beautiful building and worth a visit. From its architecture to its top floor restaurant with delicious and good price/quality food and drinks, to the implied message that the Netherlands invest in public spaces like this as a place to meet and for everyone to be able to enjoy the wonderful areas inside to learn, study, read and or just get on one of the many public computers to surf the web.
Impressive. We visited here for lunch after reading a review of the top floor cafe, very worthwhile. Huge selection of food and great view over the city, as you can imagine this is a popular spot!
Fantastic food and surroundings. Trendy place, spacious, great views, fresh food, the lot!Building is in a central location. The walk from Central station is worth it even in cold weather.
Just had good time. We just had good time here. All the visitors and tourists just wanna be here at least few hours. Me and my lover happy to visit again with the best trip advisor :)

Impressive. Visited the library to see the city view from the top floor - sadly this was slightly disappointing, but the library itself - wow! Absolutely beautiful! I did not anticipate bring so stunned by a library but it's truly incredible, more of a library-museum hybrid. The cafe on the top floor is not cheap, but 100% worth it, good handmade food, sandwiches were really good. The lady on the till told me in good English that if I wanted soup with my sandwich, there was an offer meaning it was only 5 cents more, which I thought was kind of her to tell me. There are also multiple pianos dotted around which 'experienced pianists' were free to play. And people do play them! I regret not playing myself now. Definitely worth a visit.
Simply extraordinary. The building is magnificent, the views from the top are wonderful. Just go to the last floor and enjoy a coffee and the free photo opportunity.

Amazing views from the rooftop cafe. The library looks very impressive, with state-of-the-art facilities spread over 6 floors. However I'm afraid that like most tourists I headed straight to the cafe on the 7th floor. The food is very wholesome and good value but the real draw is the panorama of the city. If you can grab one of the outside tables you get unrivalled views of the Amsterdam centre and skyline. Only a few minutes walk from the station, it's definitely worth a visit.

Ultra Modern Architecture . The Library is situated just a short walk from Central Train Station. As you look towards the station you walk to the right, cross the road and carry on past the Hilton Hotel and eventually you will come across it. (Just past the floating Chinese Restaurant).It is free to enter and is a great place to enjoy lunch and have a rest from walking round.The Library has 6/7 floors connected by an illuminated free standing escalator. It is ultra modern and I have never seen anything quite like it. It's a very impressive sight. Each floor represents a different subject etc. If you get the escalator up to the top floor there is a lovely restaurant called La Place which is reasonably priced. There is an outside area which affords great views over the harbour and parts of Amsterdam cityWhen we visited last year there was a free art exhibition on one of the floors. Well worth a visit. Lovely venue for lunch.

Worth Seeing!. This wonderful modern public building is worth seeing! It is an easy walk near the main train station. It has a great view for free of the city. It has fine coffee and reasonable in price restaurant. Could be a great place to spend some time if you are waiting awhile for a train!

If you're a book lover, this is your paradise.. From where I come from, libraries have 2 floors max. To see a library with 6 (!!!) floors was just exhilarating. Very well organized, a nice ambiance and, of course, loads and loads of books. If you're going to NEMO or somewhere near Amsterdam Centraal, give it a go. It doesn't take very long to walk across the floors and get a taste of this fantastic place.

Best Library in Europe, Maybe the World. Travelling, you are not necessarily worried about a library. However, if you are going to work in a library, the Amsterdam Central library, down the street from the train station, is the one worth going to. The architecture is amazing. There is a restaurant on the top with view overlooking the city. The glass façade on every floor also affords people with laptops to sit in comfortable chairs and stair out over the city. And if you are caught short and you need to do a little work, they have tons of free PC's. Internet cost is minimal. Its a great place to relax, or catch up on some work. There is also an excellent video floor, as well as an arts section. You can reconnect with the culture and history of Europe here, in a warm environ which is free for anyone seeking a little respite from the rain or cold. This is truly a special place.

Great library, good cafe and view on top. Its a great public library with lots to browse. Good part is that its free and each floor is dedicated to a particular subject. You can see lots of students come to study as well. We actually had to keep a time check while browsing the library since we were on a short visit to the city. The food at cafe on top floor was tasty and cheap and the views of the city were good, wish the building structure didn't block the panaroma.
Great view!. The greatest place to see Amsterdam panorama and have a rest (and drink coffee, and eat in 'La Place') in the middle of the day!Try both 7th and 6th floors for a view!
Library Amsterdam. A very nice library. The design is nice. At the top floor there is a nice terrace and you can overview the city

Good Meeting Place. If you are looking for a free place to hang out and meet with others, this is a good place. There are many places for a quiet discussion, and a restaurant/cafe on the top floor where you can have louder discussions without being asked to buy food. There are also coffee places in the neighborhood with free wifi.Wifi is available, but not free. There is a simple book and music collection.

Decent. The library is worth visiting if you're in the vicinity but I wouldn't make a special stop to see it. A friend raved about the view from the library's 7th floor balcony so we made a point of going there for lunch one day. The view was alright - we didn't find it spectacular. In fact, it's somewhat limited. The food was great and it's a chain called La Place -you can get a very nice selection of items.
just the place for a leisurely drink on a Sunday afternoon. Great decor - shame we only found it on our last afternoon in Amsterdam, would have liked to have eaten there as menu looked good.
Food / View. There's a great view from the top floor of the library. I heard the food is good -and cheap- though we didn't partake.

Meet fellow book-lovers and enjoy the view. This restaurant is on the top floor of the Central Library, and offers great views of the city. After getting our cafeteria food, we ate at a long table where we quickly struck up a conversation with some grad. students in physics and economics which lasted long after our meals were over. The Dutch are very friendly, and we met nice people everywhere, but the library was outstanding. I had a tall hamburger, which did not splatter all over as they usually do for me. Very Tasty!If you are looking for a casual atmosphere, this is a find!
Go up to the balcony on the top floor for the view!. Beautiful new building by Centraal Station. In the entrance, up the escalators to the view right over the city

Beautiful building, great amenity space for the public. We went to see the building as an architectural landmark. The escalators just keep going up and up with different resources on every level. The actual resources given to the people of Amsterdam are really great, lots of reading material in book and electronic form and little hidey spaces to rest/read/study in.We were just there as visitors on a cloudy day and spent a good few hours just enjoying browsing the books and people watching. There is a radio station on one floor, an old man was napping on another and someone else was happily (not sure about legally) smoking cigarettes while listening to music on another floor. Book selection for browsing offers a number of english options and a diversity of subjects.The wifi in the building is not free but it is a great space to rest unmolested by staff or the general public.There is a cafe on the top floor with an open air deck offering a panoramic view of the city, obscured to an extent by the structure. The cafe has a reasonable selection of cafeteria style food options, a bit chaotic in system regarding collecting and paying. The day we went although the food looked appetising, it smelt a bit odd in there.Alternatively, chain pizza/pasta restaurant Vapianos is on the ground floor along with another few unfranchised bars/restaurants that may or may not be open. They all form part of a new build district along the shorefront.It's a fairly easy walk to the library from the town centre or train station but not necessarily always pleasant as you have to cross a few main roads at some point.Worth a browse though if you like books and modern buildings and want a peaceful 'attraction' that is free.
Not only for the reading!. Great library, worth the visit not only for the reading, but also for the great panoramic view of Amsterdam.

Great View. Visited to enjoy the view from the cafe. Restaurant ok; view interesting. Take the escalator to cafe, rather than lift, to see a wonderful library - media floor looked amazing: lucky locals.

What an asset to the residents of Amsterdam - as a library.. We made our way here to see the view from the restaurant on the top floor and it was pretty much worth it. We had high hopes of the restaurant itself and on first impressions, you certainly couldn't fault the choice and variety of the offerings, but the cooking itself and the service had a slightly familiar public institution vibe. Nothing quite delivered (literally in terms of service) sadly. You'll get fed but it's not a treat. Much better places in town to splash the cash. It did seem popular with young families with lots of smoothies and fruit for the littlies. As a library, I'm guessing it's pretty much perfect.
Fantastic. It's free, you can see the city from above. There's a cafeteria at the last floor, delicious and healthy food, but expensive.

Pretty. It was nice. We actually went to have a view of the city from the top floor. We had a glorious sunset that evening I found it very strange that you had to pay to use the WC. Also the opaque toilet doors were a bit embarrassing
Stop for a second. Such a great experience. Highly recommended.Place where you gonna feed your eyes, soul and spirit. Do not miss it.
Lots of books!. i always find books interesting, this place is perfect for book-lovers.. lots of choice, lots of international book also. best for having "ME and book only time"

If you have time and need a break. Near Centraal Station and free to visit. Very good views of the city from the top floor. Eet Cafe (eating) on top floor with good food but found it a bit pricey. Worth a quick visit but would not go out of my way to see it.
Library with a restaurant and a view. Very close walk to the central station, 10 floors of library with a restaurant and a view deck. Remember change for the bathrooms
Modern architecture. Especially for kids, it is a wonderful library. Library has a very good cafe with a nice view of Amsterdam. Library has very detailed parts for music, movie, history erc..

Nice library. I would say this is a typical library for Holland, but if this is your first visit to a Dutch library, you'll not understand. Open space, interesting and futuristic architecture, good lights

Good rest in crowdy city. Admission is free. Ascend to the 3rd floor and look through old atlases. But in general, everyone will find what he likes.
Upstairs La Place where you can eat with a beautiful view of Amsterdam and the Nemo Museum.

nice place with nice views. This is a very beautiful place in Amsterdam where you can take excellent pictures. There you can read all kind of books and you can admire beautiful views through the glass walls. Ireally recommend you to visit this place.
Good view of city. The restaurant was very good very reasonable and range of food very extensive. The pizzas were great cooked to your own recipe and ready in a very short time
gorgeous view from the terrace. Nice restaurant with a gorgeous view from the terrace. Self service and good food. Nice and interesting architecture.

a big library .EXCELLENT AMBIENCE. I liked the place because the ocean is touching building boundary .
and it is very beautifull to see that.
so peace and calm

Great Library. The library was beautiful and gave a great view of he city. I enjoyed my visit and the lunch I ate on the top floor. I would not go out of my way to see it, but if you are in the area, you should stop in.

Good for books and views. Although we were not in the market for books, the library is an interesting building in its own right. At the top floor there are great views of Amsterdam and the waterways that make it what it is.

Great place to spend your time in. This library is amazing, I wish I knew dutch so I could read ALL the books they have :) The building is huge. They have PCs with internet, but it's not free and you need to buy a library pass.The view from the last floor is very nice.The Muizenhuis (Mouse House) by Karina Schaapman displayed at the bottom floor alone was well worth the visit. Imagine a handmade doll house inhabited by mice, with over a hundred different spaces – and its own storybook.We went specifically to see it, but being so close to the Centraal Station and to the Nemo Museum, you could go and visit it while passing by.
Superb. Liked: Light and airy. Fab views of the city. Excellent restaurant.Disliked: nothing well worth a visit. Intend to spend more time there on next visit.
Great View from the Top. We didn't explore the library or dine in the cafe, but the view from the top was fabulous. You look southward over the city. Bring your camera.

It is not a fake, library like this exist!. My visit in the Public Library was short. That was my last day in Amsterdam and I didn't have a lot of time before the flight. I went to the library because I heard that I can eat something there in the reasonable price. I was surprised when I came into the building. On the ground-floor, one man was playing Nocturne op.9 no.2, Chopin. My favorite Nocturne! That was first good impression! I decided to visit library. A lot of floors, a lot of papers and books (Dutch, English...) on every floor, exhibitions of paintings and not only... I could see students in the study areas. I saw also some playgrounds for children - mothers were sitting on the pillows and were reading the children's book... I was so amazed! On the last top of the building was restaurant. I ate my lunch with friends on the terrace and I admired the stunning view of Amsterdam. I was so sorry that I didn't have more time to use the library, to read something, to rest in the building...

Make your way to the top!. As a book lover, the central library was a must see for me. It's a little out of the main town, but you can walk down the canal which I found quite pleasant. The library itself was very modern and spacious. We ventured to the top floor to find a charming and reasonably priced cafe with a decent selection of vegetarian food. The visit here was made more enjoyable by the lovely views on the terrace at the top! Beautiful view of Amsterdam

Books, anyone?. In a time where libraries are often associated with "books" only, the new Library is definitely worth a visit.Located in the newish ODE area, the building is a triumph of space, light and usefulness. Go to the top for amazing views!

go here for view and food!. we ate there twice in 4 days stay at Amsterdam and the best food with lowest price ever! Dont forget to try their tomato basil soup , actually everything we had their was amazingly delicious.3 mins walk from Amterdam Centraal, and you wont regret going there not only for food but for the roof top view.. awwwhhsome :)
nice view from the cafe. It's a short walk from Central Station just opposite a Chinese restaurant. Go up to the cafe where you can have a meal and rest your tired legs while you enjoy the view.

Lovely once inside. We found the tram didn't really serve the Library, I guess people walk up or take a different bus, but it was a short walk (with some stairs) from #26 IJBurg tramline Musiekgebouw stop to the back side of the Library. It wasn't the prettiest corner of Amsterdam. Once inside, the building was bright and handsome with many floors of books, study places, a children's area, and a La Place cafe on the 7th level with a patio overlooking the IJ (I think :) ) and the city. We enjoyed a delicious, light meal of roasted veggies, salad, soup and great bread while admiring the view. It was cold in the breeze outside so we popped out for photos after eating. The view was worth the trip and the cafe gave us an excuse to linger at the windows.

Great view from the top. We just went for lunch on the top floor, which was great, but the view from up there is fantastic. It's got a lovely terrace to eat outside on, the menu is vast, all served from a carvery type counter inside, and cooked fresh there and then.

worth stopping by. We happened by the library and I had read that it was impressive building, so we decided to check it out. Totally worth it. Amazing building, inspiring really. There is a piano near the front door and when we walked in we saw a man go over and start playing. Lovely. Great views of the city. and the kids section? WOW. If we lived there, we would be there all the time. really worth dropping by just to see.

Great cafe at the top with wonderful views. It's a large library with many floors. The cafe on the top floor offered a wonderful, delicious cafeteria-style format, with many tables and a great view of the city.

Amazing building and great view of the city. Public library's don't normally get very much attention. However this is not an ordinary library. It is a amazing building. The interia it wonderfully thought out and designed. Then to top it off it has breath taking views across the city from the 6th and 7th floors. Try and visit around sunset to experience the city in a different way. to most
Great resource for families with young children. Bottom floor is full of children's books with interesting seating areas that kept our 2 year old entertained for a good hour or so.

Really clean, big and quiet. My girlfriend and I walked from the city to this library for the sole purpose of having dinner. Had dinner at the cafe called "La Place" on the 7th floor which offers great views of the city. The library is really big and quiet. Toilets were perfect.

Fantastic facility, why can't all libraries be like this?. Over the years we have seen the development of this dock area... From looking through the hoardings while the piling was completed, and now to our visits to the exhibitions on the mezzanine level, the admiration of the art works , IT and books on various stages' and the super view from the 7th floor visit, and of course eating at La Place.... Always a treat, never disappointing!
Views from the 7th floor are great. Free, central library with a great little cafe on the top floor with great views of the city. Within walking distance of the central train station.

Great view from the top. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-JVofCW4p_cCheck out the view! We stayed for a few days and wandered around most tourist destinations. The view from this library was amazing and it was free to access. Loved the library too especially the funky kid's section.

Food For Thought, with a View. My family was a bit dubious when I said we should eat at the library, but you've never seen a library restaurant like this! Bio-friendly, fresh-cooked food with a terrance that offered a splendid view from the 7th floor on a warm sunny day. Cafeteria style service offers lots of choices at a reasonable price. Don't miss the fresh French fries! A friendly local at the next table commented that the library also has two bars.

Beautiful facility; good lunch stop. This gorgeous building offers a 7th floor terrace where visitors can eat outside while enjoying views of the city. The food is served cafeteria style, and offers several healthy options. Beer/wine also available.

Secret place: last floor restaurant. Go to the last floor restaurant to have your meal in a relaxed enviroment with great views of the city. Suggestion: extra large salad plate can feed two people for 9€

Relaxing and well worth a visit if you have time to spare.. The library is quite out of the way but it is near centraal station and there are bars around. Went mainly to see the view from the top. It wasn't as great as I was expecting from the reviews I'd read, but it was still the best view I had of Amsterdam from above. Its a beautiful and modern looking library. Didn't try the food in the cafe at the top as I'd just had a meal, but I probably would have if I could have managed it. It looked like a great place to chill out with a good range of options.

Great Views and food.. We'd done a lot of the usual attractions, but a local recommended a visit here (she actually said a night visit which I can appreciate now how good it would be) Its right near Central Station and its free!! We had drinks and a snack from a lovely cafe on the top floor. Everything was fresh/natural. Large choice of actual meals as well. The views were brilliant and both outside and inside seating areas to eat and relax. Well worth a visit.

MouseHouse. Even if you don't need a book , a visit to the Muisenhuis in the Childrens Department is a must with or without children.We spent at lest 40 minutes looking at the model-what a shane i wasn't tall enough to see the top rooms else I would have stayed longer.The cafe on the top floor afforded beautiful views if the harbour.

Stop, Look Around, Enjoy. Yes, the view from the top is great, but what I found the most enjoyable were the layout and all the sheet music they had available - AC/DC for the French Horn? Yes, please.It's just a beautiful, well-funded, well-maintained library, something you don't always see all over the US. It was full of people playing with children and studying on a Monday afternoon. Really neat to see and experience.
Good food. Top floor, cheap and good café, with a view. Wok cooked curry made with your choice of ingredients. Fresh pizza, fruit juice.

Yes the view and cafe are both fantastic. Its been built recently and is a cool place to hang out with kids in a city that you are always trying to protect them from the sketchy areas. Its a very open feel of a building and has a great terrace cafe and its view on a clear day is spectacular
Amazing Views from the Veranda. This is an amazing building and well worth a visit. Go to the top floor by the restaurant and get an amazing view of the harbor.
The Library. It was a very modern library with a reasonable restaurant on top, down by central station. clean and modern library, toilets not free!!

Great for lunch (and books!). A lovely environment to spend some time. Worth going to to the 7th floor for a great lunch - loads of choice, freshly cooked and healthy. Great atmosphere. The view from the terrace is also a highlight.

Fantastic place. We went as it was raining one morning and were pleasantly surprised. A very modern library and really big. The cafe on the 7th floor also has an outside deck overlooking the river. The cafe - La Place is excellent. Lots of choice, all freshly prepared. I had a sandwich and a pint of Grolsch, my wife had a mixed salad and a fresh fruit drink with change from €20. It is a bit out of the way, to the side of Centraal Station, but worth a visit.

Fresh "Green" Offerings at Bargain Prices. Located on the top floor of Amsterdam's Central Library (right side of Central Station). Pick and choose from a variety of fresh, organic, "green" offerings (even the wine is organic), enjoy the view over Amsterdam from the terrace. VERY reasonable.

Great place to focus. Amazing modern architecture with view over the water at oosterdoks Amsterdam. Light flooded interior makes it a great free study or work environment. Vapianos on the ground floor offers a not too bad budget lunch.
Amazing. Please go you won't be disappointed! It's modern architecture is both spacious and vibrant. The restaurant and terrace are pretty fab too.

It's a library - but holy cow!!!. I probably did what most people who see the top attractions list on trip advisor do and asked myself, how can a library be so impressive. And it was close to the hotel we stayed at, and also free to go to it so it was an easy decision to make a short trip to. I'd heard about the view and went straight up In the lift to the top floor. What a view over amsterdam! I love a good view and marvelled at it from all angles.After this, I worked my way down the floors marvelling at exhibitions, I had some tickets to print out which the staff were very helpful with, and lots of quirky art and design. The sheer size is awesome and I'd love my city's library to have a quarter what this place has. A thing of marvel!
Amazing. Amsterdam's Library was one of my fav places to chill at the city. It has an impressive design and the titles available are even more impressive. You can also enjoy the very cozy café.

Try La Place on the 7th floor. We made lunch here, but friends say that breakfast is good too. The selection is fantastic. Fruit, cooked lunches and a variety of fresh sandwiches. It's on the 7th floor so go into the library and turn right to get to the lift. The views are pretty good too.

view over the harbour. As I was staying on a boat two minutes walk from the library it was very handy to visit.The view from the upper floors of the building were fantastic,and with a good supply of most daily broadsheets the library is well worth a visit if you are in Amsterdam.

next generation. This library is of the next generation. I was used to books, dust, narrow hall. This is the opposite a beautiful building with a lot of space with many books. Place to sit to study great view of the city and La Place restaurant.

Great View. Great library, modern interior, good restaurant at top with amazing views(free views) no need to walk up stairs either (escalators up and down).Well worth a visit if only for the view.(There is however a small charge if you want to use the toilets.)

Must see, for several reasons. The library per si is already impressive because of their organization and collection. You can find what are you looking for easily, specially because the subjects are divided by floors. Apart from that, in the terrace you can have a great and amazing view of amsterdam for free! It has some signals so you can easy identify what are you looking far from there. You can also have some food and drinks for while, since it has a restaurant (which isn't that cheap, but not that expensive neither). I would advice starting your tour in Amsterdam by going there (if the wheater helps, of course), since it located just few steps from the station.

Visit the restaurant at the top!. You know, it would be just an ordinary library (even though the architecture is very good) if it weren't for the top restaurant. Buy something there and sit outside, drink coffee and take pictures - definitely worth the visit.
Hidden gem. This new library has the most amazing restaurant. On the top floor of building with terrific views of the city. Food was really good and an enormous variety. A busy place at lunch time.
What a view. Go there when you are tired of walking around and sit on the benches or go upstairs and look out of the windows to have a great view of Amsterdam

Amazingly Open Library. The library is unbelievably open. Everyone can access it and find something interesting to read or listen to inside free of charge. Initially I went there to print few papers from the internet and after took a short walk around. Will definitely return there many times.
View at the top!. Go to the cafeteria at the top for a view of Amsterdam if you're in the area. We didn't look around there at all other than that.

fantastic music section.... lots and lots of sheet music. all genres. i think i've deforested some country or another from all the copying paper i've used at this place...good place to kill a few hours in a'dam, fairly close to central station, while reading a book...decent cafe AND a vapiano's italian restaurant adjoining...and don't forget to take one of the schindler elevators. or, as the british might say...'schindler's lift'.

One of the best places to visit. This is a must see! The interior is very modern and very cool. Lots of books and music to go through. The cafe on the top floor is delicious and the views of Amsterdam are amazing!!

Puts Other Libraries to Shame. The library is an imposing building with a unique architectural design. When you exit Centraal station turn left and walk along the riverside for a few minutes and you will find yourself at the library. We dined at the 7th floor restaurant. We watched the young chef prepare our oriental dishes, flames from the wok nearly touched the ceiling. Who said libraries are boring? The food exceeded expectations and was reasonable priced. Great mix of people in the restaurant which was packed to capacity on a Wednesday afternoon. Fine views of the city. Worth a visit.

Amazing view and amazing architecture. The public library is an amazing place, not only for the view, but also for the place itself: modern, confortable, quiet, books and an amazing DVD colection. I would visit Amsterdam just to visit again this library. The city view from the balcony on the top floor is a different way to see the city.
Great Style for a library. Beautiful library, never seen such a place before. Felt more like a stylish club rather than a museum. Amazing views of the old center of Amsterdam

If you have time to spare. As mentioned by other reviewers, this is a perfectly adequate library. But I would not consider it a great attraction. To make proper use of the facilities, you need to have a membership. Also, usually a lot of the computers are in use, though it does depends on which time you stroll in. The customer service is in my experience fine. They are willing to help, though fairly ‘neutral’. The views are good though; both from the top balcony and from the terrace. There is also a small restaurant on the top floor and another Italian one at the terrace. There are food and drink establishments at walking distance outside. The library is also situated in a fairly favorable spot; Science Center NEMO (aimed at families and kids) is close by, The National Maritime Museum, the Schreierstoren, Central Station, etc. So overall it is just a regular, modern, library. Maybe worth a visit if you have time to kill or enjoy exploring libraries; entry is free after all. I personally would not know what you could really experience in the library as tourist attraction (aside from the views), which would make it worthwhile to make a detour for it.

Super cool children's area in the library. You may not put libraries on your list of places to visit, but this one is pretty cool. It's near the Central Station, and on your way to both NEMO science museum and the amazing Scheepvaart (Maritime) museum. Check out the lower level where the children's books are. Make sure you climb the fun tower that overlooks the area, and best of all is the mouse tree house by famous Karina Schaapman. If you're with kids, let them play in the Yip and Janneke hideaways, loll on the cool chairs, and then make your way up to the restaurant, La Place, on the top floor for a delicious snack or meal overlooking the city of Amsterdam.

to be visited. It is that kind of place, where you feel you want to start study...and even if you don't study anymore it is nice to go to the roof terrace for a lunch or a coffee enjoyng the beautiful view of the city!

Lovely modern Library with wonderful views. By any standard this must be one of the best libraries i have ever visited.Multi- storey centrally located with lots of seating capacity. the cafe on the top floor is not to be missed not only for its wonderful selection of beverages and cakes but for the panoramic views.This is well worth spending a couple of hours.

A Must SEE!!. Very Very Beautiful! Many floors full of books and many people studying and reading.At the last floor the view of the windows is amazing!When i was there i have the opportunity to see a mini concert of violin

What a library!. I love this library... The architecture, the view for each floor where chairs are provided for you to sit and contemplate, the vast collection of books and accessible computer terminals and finally, the top floor cafe with great cafe food and a summer terrace from which you can look out over the city.

Rude personall, antic old books. Most rude, tourist unfriendly person I have ever met. I went on 26th of december on 5th floor on search of medicine books in the 'greatest librabry of netherlands'. Right! I looked a bit on my own and not finding any department I approached the blond lady sitting at the Info desk. She looked at me quite with superiority and answered me as if I were stupid 'Couldn t you find it yourself?'No, could you help me? But what book do you want? I want to know only where the medicine books are located just to take a look.I don t know where they are, I am working to look for you, can t you see? answered she really annoyed and important. Well, I know I don t look my 27 but come on!!Therefore I said I don t need her help, and indeed after that I could find a few sheelves with books from 1978 without illustrations and with antic theories.So much for the tourist's must see biggest librabry in the country!!!PS: For what is worth...it seems a good study place, the furniture was comfortable!

Wonderful place to hide from the rain.... In the years we have lived here, we have invariably come to the central library at least once a month. They have a fun collection of books, including quite a few graphic novels, a good collection of films and music. It's also just a nice place to pass the time, especially during the harsher weather. It can be a little tricky to find a seat on Saturday, but even then you can almost always find a corner to enjoy a few books in or just sit and enjoy the view.The cafe on the top floor has some of the best hot chocolate around, the milk is steamed through real chocolate chips while you watch. They also have good, cheap, fast, and tasty pizzas for around 10 euros. During the warmer months, they also have an outdoor terrace with an amazing panoramic view of Amsterdam from seven stories up.Both the library itself and the cafe are incredibly family friendly. The kid's floor of the library is well organized for a range of ages, with plenty of quiet corners to sit down and read a book to your child, and lots of fun things to climb on or through. The cafe has high chairs and has enough corner tables that you can generally find a place for even a large stroller.Best of all, it's right next to Central station, so it's perfect if you have an hour or two before your train.

An avid reader ? This is your place !. Being an avid reader, this library is one of my favorite corners of Amsterdam to " hang-out " on any season of the year. Excellent location : not far from Central Station and on to the rest of the city's tourist attractions. International newspapers. Excellent supply of English magazines on different fields. Far excellence organized departments. Lots of DVDs. Computer accessibility is outstanding. Quiet corners every story. Kids have their own place. Plus the stunning canal view on the top floor with a self service restaurant. Toilets are well-maintained. In one word, it makes me feel good to be here !

not just a library. there are hundreds of computer terminqals (almost all the time occupied), it's a terrific library and don't forget the cellar with all the childrens books - like and art museum!
On top a balcony with great view over Amsterdam and a good lunchroom (self service)
Good views. Modern building with all facilities. Visit the excellent 7th floor cafe to enjoy the great self-service food choice and the summer views from the terrace.

Looking for some peace and quiet, as well as some great views of the city?. I visited the central OBA library a number of times. It is one of my favorite place in Amsterdam, but then, I love books and information. If you don't it still is a great place to visit, as it has a la Place restaurant on the top floor and every floor has great views of the canal and city! Also it's architecture and interior design are spectacular!
Gorgeous building. The top floor restaurant with stunning views across Amsterdam and lovely food. Also chairs dotted on every floor by the windows to just read and relax... Heavenly.
View spot!. It's near Central Station, go to the top floor offers a great and free view! The library itself is very modern too if you're into books.

Amazing views inside and out. The Openbare Bibliotheek Amsterdam (OBA), a short walk from Central Station, offers amazing views inside and out. Visit V&D La Place restaurant on the seventh floor for a fresh fairly inexpensive meal with a terrace overlooking the city.

Great place to work when it is necessary to work during your holiday. I needed a place to do some work during my holiday, and this was recommended to me by a local. And indeed, it is a great and inspiring place to do some work. Nice architecture and a beautiful view from the top floor!
Beatifull and huge. Nice to see how build a real perfect libary! Nice restaurant with nice view. I just went there to see and not to eat.
Really cool place. Not far from the central station, good location. Quite convenient for all. A beautiful place itself. Like all Dutch place, it's very well renovated and designed.

Smart place to visit.. This 'bibliotheek' was one of my favourite place in Amsterdam. It is huge, but always clean and quiet. It has a nice and different atmosphere. I suggest everyone to go and visit it.

Balcony with a view!. Travel to the top level to find a cafe offering many options. The view out the floor to ceiling windows is great. If you are there during the right season, the balcony will be open so you can go and take photos. Sadly, this balcony is closed from October through the winter, opening again in Spring.

What an inspiration this library is!. What a forward-looking library this is. From the bar to the restaurant, to the hundreds of computer terminals to the variety of seating options to the student group-study areas, it's a gem. Go visit and you'll be inspired to take some ideas home.

An amazing place but no free wifi. Located near the water this place is a masterpiece. So many books, lots of comfortable chairs and couches. There are computers that members can use as well as wifi. But those aren't free for regular folks aka non-members.

free wifi, great view of the city and nice atmosphere. Close to the central Railway station the public library offers more than books. Nice restaurant, terrace, wifi and a way to get away form the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautiful modern buildin as well and even when you do not speak or read dutch you will feel at ease.

Try the restaurant. My man and I like books and being in libraries so we were partial to this library. It is indeed very nice, modern and full of light. We were under the impression there weren't that many books but we might have been wrong. That said, as tourists we didn't really care.What was nice is the restaurant on the last floor. We didn't eat there on our first visit but did go on our last evening in Amsterdam, as we were tired and not wanting to spend much time and money. The food was great considering it's a food court, not to mention they sell alcohol (In a library? We liked that!) Definitely plan on eating there as a quick, delicious meal in the middle of your day or for a relaxed evening. It's not cheap but still not as expensive as a traditional restaurant.

Favorite place to think and read in Amsterdam. Loved the 3rd floor reading chairs alongside the windows- perfect view over the canals, watching the boats float by. Super helpful library staff. Plus a great lunch place with free 30 min wifi on the 7th floor.

great place. If you are in Amsterdam and wannted to spend some time in reading, this could be the best option for you where you can use the internet,read , write and chat with your friends, additional things, here you can get free wifi,,, reco

Interesting building but disappointing. We are told that the library had magnificent views of the city from the coffee shop on the trip floor. It is a beautiful building, with a great coffee shop- but the veranda with views has been close for over 2 months and there are no signs until you get to the top. Disappointing,
Go for an excursion. Just visit this library as any other attraction in Amsterdam. This is something you will not see in other countries.

Great place with coffeshop and free wifi.. I was told to go and get a decent cup of coffee amongst the local people in the Roelof Hartplein library by my Dutch friends. I did and enjoyed just being there and making use of their free Wifi and looking out of the window. Friendly staff too.

Outstanding public library worth a visit if you have extra time.. Access to this library is free. The modern designed building is located right next to Amsterdam Centraal Station. It provides a great place to check e-mail, study up on your visit, read one of the 1.7 million books, see the library museum, have a coffee or hot chocolate in the cafe/restaurant or meet locals.This is a much more pleasant place to spend time than the train station next door if you are waiting on a train.

If You Have Time. I like to have a look at the central libraries for the large cities I visit. This one to me was just average. They have a nice collection, but not a lot in the way of architecture, exhibits, or atmosphere. It's not far from the city center though if you need something to do for a few.

Bieb Amsterdam. Acces is free.Six floors of books and media.Nice place with a good restaurant. Also a good place to study and meet other people.Good ICT available. Many special events during the year. Great view on Amsterdam.5 min. walk from the Central Station. Membership to lend books is € 35,- for one year.
clean, calm and well lit. Nice quiet and well lit place. If in need for a rest, go here, read a little or close your eyes.It's close to the central train station.

Great books and amazing view. Even if you don't like books visit the OBA (close to central station). The view on the 6th of 7th floor is amazing. You can take the elevator up there free of charge. This is a beautiful hidden gem in Amsterdam. The restaurant on the 7th floor is really good too but slightly on the more expensive side.

Beautiful library with free and nice view of the city. This library is to the left of the central station, and close to the NEMO exhibit. It is seven floors, with the top floor having a pretty nice view of the city. On the same floor is a restaurant/cafe called La Place, which serves everything fresh, and where you can enjoy a nice cup of coffee while enjoying the view. Note: if you want to use the bathroom there you will have to pay 50 cents. At the bottom of the library is a bike rental place, where you quickly jump on your bike and ride around the city. Hope you enjoy it!
Breathtaking view . What an amazing place to sit and relax for a bit. One of the best views of the city. You can also grab a bit on the restaurant(7th floor). Amazing.

Not amazing. I've been to other new libraries. This one was not amazing but functional and I dare say built on a low budget. For a country with some amazing architecture this was fairly average but still a very functional and good library with great views from the top in summer.

Great view of Amsterdam. As there aren't many really tall buildings in Amsterdam where you can get a good view of the city from above this is definitely worth going to just for the view! Sadly the terrace was closed when we went in December but we still enjoyed the view and got some good photos.
Excellent view. But the rooftop is closed during winter. Even during winter, you can stop for a coffe at the bar and watch the view, although you can't go outside.
Great view to the city. Free to entrance & great view to the city. Unfortunately the terrace was closed on december. Coolest library ever.
Great place for reading books. It's a great place to hang out and read, large selection of books etc. There is also wifi avaialble.I found the staff a bit unfriendly unfortunately.

I had to see it. Since it's getting harder to find places with computers, what was once called "internet cafes", libraries are the next best thing especially if you don't have your own device. The charge is one Euro per 30 minutes for using either the computer for Internet or using the WIFI with you own device. I was on floor three I think where I went to use the computer. I was ready to hand my Euro but the librarian said she didn't handle cash anymore. I just wanted to use the computer for no more than 15 minutes and she let me use for free (I happen to be lucky at the time so don't expect that to happen to you).I didn't know until I came home and have read this on their website "As from the 1st of January 2014 the OBA does no longer accept cash payments" So unless you own a Dutch debit card, then a credit card (MasterCard or Visa) will be the next best thing.There are seven floors in this building. I briefly visited each floor. The children's is on the lower floor. On the seventh floor is a huge cafe. Go outside to the patio for a spectacular view of Amsterdam. The day I was there was very rainy and windy so I did stay outside too long, just a quick glimpse.On one of the floors they had a neat display of books about different people, one of which was Nelson Mandela.There is a huge a/v section. There is this massive amount of DVD's on this huge round shelving unit. The library is about a five minute walk from Centraal Station. This main branch is open from 10 am to 10 pm seven days a week.There are a total of 26 branches in Amsterdam. There was a branch near my B&B that I went to visit as well. It is a short five minute walk from Museumplein.You can visit for free BUT there is a fee as I said for the Internet and if you're staying for a while in Amsterdam and want to borrow materials there may be a fee for that but you'll have to ask at the library.

Possibly the best library ever. The library is huge, with 6 floors. The bottom floor is the children's library and is beautifully designed with little nooks and crannies for reading. With it's modern architecture and many cafes and restaurants, you'd be forgiven for thinking the library was a shopping mall. The best restaurant in the building is on the 7th floor. A great place to eat if there is a large group of you, La Place is a buffet style restaurant with something for everyone. You'll need to join the library to borrow a book, but you could easily spend a long time hanging out there for free.

wonderful and "gezellig"library. It is a great library, good literature in many languages, nice atmosphere to study, specially when they play the piano at the entrance. :) Good location and food places nearby, The view from the terrace is breathtaking :)
Nice cozy library. Interior is done up very nicely, with 6 levels of books and multimedia. At level 7 is a nice cafe that serves value for money breakfast/lunch/dinner, with a good view of the city.
Cafe!. There is a cafe on the last storey of the building. Simply go inside and move up using the escalators. No registration to the library is asked at the entrance.

Great library!!!!!. Stepped in for a few minutes just before leaving Amsterdam. Wish I had saved more time to experience all that this place has to offer. This is any book lover's dream. Also, it's perfectly organized and is also quite beautiful in its design. Each floor is a different subject or medium. There is an entire floor devoted to children... And it was awesome! There was an amazing dollhouse behind glass, great lounging pads for kids to lay on, and great little reading nooks as well.We didn't get to eat anything in the restaurant, but it looked great. My only complaint was that I couldn't find a bathroom. The sign on the wall said it was on the children's level, but all I was able to find there was a bathroom just for children. All in all, fantastic place! Great access to computers, assistance, and plenty of work and meeting spaces.

Modern Library!. I love this place. There's a cafe on the top floor (6th floor I think) with a great view of the city. This library has internet and books in English. Sometimes small music events are going on outside the main entrance.

A treasure of books!. One of my favourite places in Amsterdam. It is located near water and beside Music School and there is a piano inside so if you wish to play, you can! And there are so many books around you!

relaxing break from sightseeing. We went to the Bibliotheek after reading previous reviews, it is a lovely space, very calming, with plenty to look at. on the top floor there is a cafe which looked very good, with masses of fresh food at reasonable prices. We didn't eat there, but definitely would try t in future.

Chic bibliotheek!!. wow what a library, dont forget to go up to the top floor for a snack or a meal. Shame its winter and the balcony was closed. Well worth a walk around and a book browse. Really nice view.

Wonderful Library. When you come out of the Central Rail Station, turn left. It's a little walk, but if you keep going you will see it. This library has floor after floor of books, a floor of its own of movies and cds, a children's floor, magazine area, a small museum, and a café at the top with wonderful views of the city. Escalators and elevators will get you through each floor.

Spectacular view over Amsterdam. One of the best free attractions in Amsterdam.. This is the largest public library in Europe. Anybody can enter, form 10am to 10pm, any day of the week, all year long. Go to the third floor (my favourite, about travel) and see the study spaces, and maybe take a seat next to the huge windows, and let yourself enveloped in the beautiful view over the port. You can also have a coffee or lunch at the 7th floor, again enjoying a spectacular view. Even better if the terrace is open.

Beautiful building but it was all dutch to me (sorry). We loved visiting the building and the cafe was amazing but of course being a dutch library we could only wonder at the treasure that was contained within the shelves. I'm sure had we spoken dutch the library would have been much more special

Incredible building and incredible lending service. I loved this place, starting from the design of the building and the fact that it's the only one having a completely electronic lending service. Everything's so well organized. Designs are neat and clean. The atmosphere was just perfect: relaxed and calm. We even got to hear a little bit of on air radio broadcasting. Just perfect! There usually are free exhibitions and conferences, so if you'd like to you can attend them.

Great River View at the Top Floor Restaurant!. Even if you aren't into reading, I'd recommend this library for the sheer awesomeness of interior design (sleek and definitive lighting features) and architecture (natural lighting, glass and open concept). There are so many levels to explore with even a cafe and restaurant on different levels!The views from the glass walls are amazing as you look out into the river. The children's section in the basement has an incredible doll house and a maker room (this wasn't open when I visited). I love that the book return system is automated and the clear walls let you see how the books are sorted! (The librarian in me was super ecstatic :D ) You do have to pay to use the bathroom though :(. Its in the basement beside the lockers that you can also rent.
walking tour. I found the library a little difficult to locate. There were excellent views from the top floor balcony

Read and relax. I visited the library because I had time to kill and its just a walking distance from the central station. It was however very rewarding, entrance is free, you could pull books from the shelves and read. it is a great educational architecture and if you can get to the 5th or 6th floor, you can see a good view of the town. You can thereafter settle into a comfortable corner and enjoy some peaceful time.
Amazing!. You will love this place if books are you passion. There are tons of books, both new and old, tonchoose from! Make sure to spent some time here!

avant garde. This library situated at an increasingly popular niche just next to the Central train station ! The director of this wonderful place said he was so proud that the library reflects the cosmopolitant atmosphere of Amsterdam. It is very modern and comprises the digital world as we no it today. I often go there for translation work, books music and dvd's because mobile disturbance is not tolerated. Great place to grab some food as wel and the view from the top floor where one of the restaurants is situated is beautiful Amsterdam in full view it is just mesmerising.

Coolest library. If all libraries were this cool, the kids of the world might study more. blasting excellent architecture coupled with clever lighting. Sharp lines and scenic views. Many nooks and crannies to grab a book or hook onto wifi. It's a worthwhile visit and a welcoming warm shelter.

Wow -What a delight!. First of all this jewel of a library has a restaurant at the top with outstanding views of the city. We did not eat there so I cannot say anything about the food, however the art work, the extensive English book section, the children's book section and the media library sections were very impressive. They also have art displays that change from time to time. Great place to visit even if only in town for a short period. The escalators to the floors make is a welcome break from all the walking and stairways normally found in the buildings of the historic community.

Nice view of the city. The public library of Amsterdam just close to Central station, is a great place to visit in Amsterdam. Especially, when you are at the 6th floor of this building where there is a cafeteria you will have a nice view of the city. If you are a book lover, this is the right place for you. Wonderful collection of worldwide books are there. Also, you can have a yearly pass for reasonable price and take the books for subscription with you. After all, if you are a tourist it is also one of the good attractions of Amsterdam to visit.
Near to Hotelboot Iris,4 floors with great top floor restaurant with fanastic city view. Great piece of modern architecture, with computers available,ground floor cafe,upper floor restaurant

Spent a few great afternoons here. A library is typically not a interesting tourist attracting. However, if your aim is to get out out of the hustle bustle that Amsterdam has to offer the top levels of the building have an amazing view of Amsterdam and a canal or two! Settle in one of the chairs and pick up a book for a great afternoon!
loved the fresh food and smoothies. Reasonably priced and fresh food attractively displayed for lunch, including a lovely variety of smoothies and chocolate/sweets for a different desert!

A different world. This is a library located next to the Central Station and the Nemo science centre. It might seems to be quite boring to visit a library as a tourist but it is really worth doing. The entrance is free, and you only have to pay if you would like to take a book home (I have no idea if it is possible for tourists). There are 5 or 6 levels in the library, and you may access any book shelf inside. While you are in the library, you are allowed to sit or even lay with a book and read it. There are some computers and I assume there's Internet access there. On the top floor there is a cafe with an open terrace for the warm seasons.

Have lunch here!. Do not miss the chance to see this beautiful venue so close to the train station. The cafe on the upper floors offers wonderful, tasty food cafeteria style and reasonable prices. Awesome view over the main plaza. Truly, a gem!

Fantastic views. We walked to the library and travelled up to the top on the modern swanky elevators. The viewing gallery is a bit cramped but offered great views across the city. There was also an excellent buffet style restaurant when we had some soup and coffee; it felt a little like a student refectory but a very stylish and upmarket version. The location is central and a good place to get you bearings and have a pit stop before continuing your exploration of the city.
Go to the top floor. The view at the top is awesome! You can also get free wifi and the book collection is actually quite big.

Worth visiting . I really liked this library more than I expected. There are lots of magazines in English and music which you can check out at listening tables. The cafe was great with a fabulous terrace overlooking the city. I will be returning.

What a great place to play piano. Of all the places to find a piano to play in the world....the Amsterdam Central Library has a piano near the main entrance that "experienced" pianists are allowed to play. If you are good, you will draw a crowd. My 11-year-old is an expert player, and drew a crowd of a hundred to watch him play. He blew them away. The library itself seems very nice, but we only went there for the piano.

A library with a view. The trip to the central library was more interesting than the library itself. The are not that many seats for sitting and reading. As a central city library it is not that engaging. There are good views from the top floor. Lots of escalators. High ceilings. Open plan. Decently quiet. There was some sense of people reading or studying. Not the most memorable aspect of my stay in Amsterdam but I would say that it is worth going into as a tourist.
