Overrated in my opinion !. Design is ok, you got a great view from the top floor + a buffet restaurant/coffee, that's all. Otherwise, nothing that special about this library. I've been to many public libraries in the World (Seattle/Montreal/Seoul/...) and I was more impressed by those ones than the one in Amsterdam. I'm sure there is more interesting things to see in Amsterdam.

A very beaultiful Amsterdan's view, for free!. When you are in Amsterda, you should visit the lybrary! It is a very big and modern build with 7 floors with panoramic view of Amsterda and a very good coffe at the 7th. A calm place to admirate this fantastic city!

Public library cum art room. A place where you can do more then borrow books. AT the top is a nice restaurant with a good view of the city. And in the building are works by contemporary artists like Claudy Jongstra as part of the overall design of this great modern building. Lots of shows and lectures are given as well.

The library with the nicest views I have even seen. Nicest library ever! Perfect place to seat and read or study. The views on the top plant are amazing and there is a la place restaurant where you can enjoy good quality good at a reasonable price. opening hours are really convenient (9am- 10 pm). Really worth it to pay a visit if you are staying in Amsterdam.

Makes you want to go back and read real BOOKS!. The architecture is stunning - lots of open space and light - and it is not your old, dusty, sssssshhhh, library. Be sure to pay a visit and try the restaurant on the top floor. The view is great.

Pay a visit. We went here to see the fantastic new building and to recharge batteries after a long day mooching about.Splendid, welcoming building with great stock. I enjoyed looking at the atlases.Great cafe on the top floor, with good value and tasty food (incl. pick you own ingredients for a stir-fry). We sat out on the terrace and enjoyed the Amsterdam twilight

Good dinner with a view. I went to dinner at the library in the evening after arriving from the airport. It is close to central station and provides a great view of the city. Food choices were limited as I arrived quite late, but the pizza was very good.

The Restaurant is the reason why people visit.. The Central Library is not that central but worth the visit around early lunch time to sample the food!! It's a library and there is not much to see other than what libraries usually have. It's very art & design in its architecture and offers a great sky view from the roof, which is free.The restaurant is on the top floor and has the most amasing choice of food from; fresh grilled meats & fish, fresh breads, soups and fruits, pancakes and cakes. The list could go on and on. The prices are unbelievably cheap considering the quality and taste.Highly recommended and a nice place to chill out from walking for a while. Lots of seating inside and out (with great views)
Great View. This is worth a vist. Very near the train station. Has a cafe on the top floor with a great view over the city. Was a bit misty when we were there. The cafe has good value food.

Amazing. I wish libraries were like this where I live!! What a wonderful bldg. Lots of places to lounge, computers to use, and a great place to eat on the top floor!! Just a short walk from the train station.

Open (space, mind, design & everything). A very nice place that invites you to read, watch and listen to whatever you find interesting. A great view from the top. A little piano at the entrance that welcomes anyone with a little experience to practice. Loved it!

Must see. lovely building, a whole new concept of a library. So nice, clean, white, serene, and colorful at the same time, and the restaurant on the ground floor (separate entrance) is absolutely amazing. Must do Very cheap, very fresh and very delicious.

Panoramic view of the city. For travelers who are unable to climb up the Westerkerk to get a panoramic view. this is a good alternative. And there is a good restaurant serving good variety of fresh cook food at reasonable price.

A library? Yes, It's Worth a Visit. Libraries are not usually on the traveller's circuit but this one is pretty neat. Six floors of materials, funky space-like "pods" for researchers and a great view from the open balcony on the top floor. There is also a cafeteria that looks more like a restaurant. Where else can you buy a beer to go with your library visit?

Incredible views + Food!. Easy to get to, this library is modern, friendly, free and huge! Escalators/lifts take you to each floor including music and film sections - you could easily spend the whole day here! To top it off, on the top floor you can enjoy great food and experience a breathtaking view of Amsterdam!

coolest library I've ever been to!. Very cool modern building, we enjoyed exploring the different floors and wishing our library at home was like this! Partial view over Amsterdam from the top floor (much better view from Hilton Double Tree up the road). We had dinner in their smart canteen - fresh pizza for hubby, and Thai noodles for me, very good. Had to pay to use the toilets though, boo.
Great cafe on the top floor. There's an excellent cafe on the roof, with a good selection of food for lunch. There is outdoor seating, but it's always been raining when we've been there.

Interesting Building. As we were staying at the Andaz Hotel which is housed in the old public library and as my wife works in the Library service it was only apt that we paid a quick visit to this building. Really good layout and cafe on top floor with views of the city.
architecturally beautiful. A must see of the beautiful buildings in Amsterdam! And you've got to go up to the roof-top cafe to see the view of the city!

WONDERFULL. This place is MUST for Amsterdam visitors. If you not in love with books, you can probably become one here. If not you can rest in peacfull place and if you have a lack someone will play on piano downstairs for a half our. It is sign on piano that everybody can play if they are a profesional pianist and for half an our. You can just sit and read magasines from all over the world and rest and it is all for free. On the last floor is wondrfull cafe with food which looks artistic and wiew from upstairs is marvelous

Absolutely beautiful. Very nice library, huge selection.This is how all libraries should be like. It's absolutely beatiful, not the moldy smell of old books but a light-filled space, inviting you to read something.If you are passing by, get the lift to the seventh floor and walk out onto the balcony; the view of Amsterdam City from the top is incredible. the best part is the 7th floor where you find a great cafeteria/restaurant. The food selection is amazing – some of it is made to order.The library is very easy to find as it is located a short walk to the East from Centraal Station. Absolutely stunning and one of a kind.

Go in, you won't regret it. We love libraries, and thought that it would be worhtwhile to visit this one. It's long opening hours made it also an easy visit, they are open every day until 10 PM. It is a very impressive bulding, and it was also very impressive to see how busy it was close to 9 PM. It seemed that people just went there to find a quiet place to sit and read (or play solitaire on computers). Although we don't speak Dutch, we could enjoy every floor for what it had to offer, the display, the variety, etc. We even went out to the terrace in the top floor, which has a great view (i assume that in day-light you can see a lot more from here).

Great view over Amsterdam city center. Visited this public library on October 8, 2014 in the afternoon when it was cold and raining outside. About 10 minutes walk from the Central Station and next to the Double Tree Hotel by Hilton. This library has glass window and good view over Amsterdam city center especially at the 6 floor and 7 floor with terrace. One cafeteria at the 7 floor and the food looks good and reasonable price.Stayed in the second floor for English books and novels. Good location to escape from cold and raining weather in Amsterdam.

One of the best libraries I've been to. This was one of my favourite parts of Amsterdam. It's quite different from any other library I have been to. The open plan style of the library gives it a very open and welcoming feel. The library's collection was something I was absolutely amazed at. They had an entire floor dedicated to just CD's and dvd's. The piano in the foyer of the library, which you were welcome to play on was very nice (especially since I quite miss my piano at home). The cafe on the top floor of the library was a highlight with their wide range of menu items (at reasonable prices), free wifi and excellent views of Amsterdam. I arrived before sunset, had a leisurely dinner then was able to see Amsterdam by night from the balcony which was absolutely lovely. I ended up at the library twice during my 2.5 day stay in Amsterdam; no doubt if I lived in Amsterdam I'd probably never leave!

White inside, great view. It is among Central Starion and Nemo. The inside part of the building is very interesting. The design and the predominance of white colour gives you a relaxing sensation. Do not miss the top floor, where you will have a great view of the city and an opportunity to try the restaurant with many healthy options of food and drinks.
Great view from the cafe on the roof top!. Spacious, lots to offer. The cafe on the roof top was fun and offered a fabulous view of the city and river.

Good library in the center of Amsterdam. Great new architecture. The people that work at the library are friendly and there is wide variety of books you could read in the library itself. It wasn't possible for me to take a book with me, but there are a lot of quiet places you could go to read. I also played the piano a little bit.

Read, rest and enjoy the view. Once it started raining and you are in the area, it is a good option to grab something to read and sit on one of their comfortable pear shaped single couches facing the windows. On the top floor, where the restaurant is located, you have a nice view of the city.

For clarification, this is a LIBRARY.. I love libraries. I really do. Beautiful, quiet, wonderful resources. However, I want to clarify that this is not an attraction. This is an establishment. A public quarter for those seeking exactly what it is, a library. Don't get me wrong, all these reviews are correct in that it is beautifully designed, large and majestic, and wonderful view on top. Some couches. Great lighting. Etc. Could go on forever all within how to describe a nice library.However, if you are a tourist picking out attractions to visit during your limited stay, this library is not a priority. This is not a must-see attraction such as Anne Frank's house, any of the museums, or even Dam Square. Please PLEASE just know what you are blocking out time for in your limited day- It's a library. Don't expect more.

Good views from the cafe on the roof. Modern building with about 6 or 7 floors! Good views over the central station from the rooftop and the cafe. Plenty books and computers to have some downtime after all that walking!

Must see!. You've never seen a library like this one! You can read, listen, see, surf, eat, drink, relax.... And have a lovely view on the old city of Amsterdam while enjoying a drink on the roof terrace.
Best looking library ever. Not sure about the quality of books, but the architecture of this place is brilliant. Striking building. Worth a visit just to have a nosy around.

Great to visit, catastrophic to read. Even though this place is called a library, it is not a library. The ground floor boasts a piano that anyone walking by can sit down to and show their skills or complete lack thereof. Have you ever been to a library with a piano? Library was once for reading, reading requires concentration, concentration requires absence of a piano on the ground floor. The genius of an architect who designed this place also made sure that you can hear the piano three floors up.The last floor has a terrace with nice views of the city of Amsterdam--for free! Many tourists read tripadvisor and come to this building for the views. What this means in practice is that the library is filled with tourists on their way to the terrace, shouting in excitement and anticipation of the views and on their way down screaming with anticipation of food, drink and more excitement at their next destination. These people were never told to keep their mouths shut when in a library.But wait, it's not just the hysterical tourists, the genius of an architect who designed this place thought--why don't we add insult to injury? So he put a playground inside this abomination of a library. Playground! For kids, you know. To slide down their slides and scream off the top of their lungs due to either pleasure or discomfort of the experience.In short, you can spend here the whole of 15 minutes on the terrace staring at the Amsterdam city views, but do not even try to come here to read. You're better off at a construction site or at the nearby central railway station.

Not your typical Library. This was an insiders tip for us. The Library has a wonderful 7th floor Cafe with a large selection of foods/soups/salads and snacks along with beer and wine. It is very affordably priced and has a view of the city at just a fraction of the price of the Hotels and other skylounges ... a much better value.

Add to your must see list.... What a surprise! I have always loved libraries but this brings the notion of "the library" to a new realm...and I am proud of our library in Seattle.It is worth the walk to Oosterdok to visit this spectacular site and it is FREE!TIP: Be sure to visit all the spaces on the different floors...ending with the top floor (six or seven) which provides a beautiful view of the city.

an excellent meal. in the cafeteria on the Seventh floor. Food is prepared in front of you:grillades,pizza and stir-fry for a very reasonable price.And the view on the city is wonderful. Granted I love librairies and I always visit one on my trips.

Brilliant!. As I was in Amsterdam with my daughter who is a true bookworm we decided to pay the library a visit. I'm glad we did as it was amazing. The layout and open design of the whole building defies my previous knowledge of what libraries look like and the atmosphere is great. When we arrived there was someone playing classical music on a piano so we sat in the very comfortable seats and listened. The range of books, cds and dvds is really outstanding and if I lived in Amsterdam I could quickly see this as becoming one of my favourite haunts!

Modern library with terrific restaurant and view from the 7th floor. We had read about the view from the library but were surprised at what a modern up to date place it was--with some ususual designs and lighting. Also suprising was that fact it was open to 10 PM, even on a Friday (you usually do not have that in libraries in that states). On the top floor is a great view from a patio looking over central Amsterdam--it has a great buffet restaurant called "Le Place" which operates other restaurants in the Netherlands. There are also a calendar of events of many lectures, music, etc. taking place here. The library is a few hundred yards to the east of the Central Staation along the water. Another plus--rest rooms are free here.
Worth a visit. Try the restaurant on the 7th floor - great value, good food, with views over the city from the terrace. Impressive building and facilities.

Very Impressive. Wow, this will change your perception of good old libraries forever. Enormous in size and numbers of books stored, it is a cosy brightly lit building that makes you want to stay there forever.Very user friendly, full of cosy furniture, the atmosphere is indeed very homely.Leave your Kindle at home and come see the true Library of the 21st century.

Interesting. The Library is a good place to check emails while in the city located a short walk from the Central Station. Also the top floor offers great city views and has a nice buffet style restaurant.
Best view of the city. Best view of the city from the top floor where you can also get a great meal at a really reasonable price. Oh and the library is like none I have ever seen.

Modern Tempel of Wisdom with great top floor view!. The new museum focuses on experience all aspects a museum could offer, not just stockpiling books.Go grab a book and chill in the comfortable designer sofa's or go to the top floor for a coffee with cake with views of Amsterdam!
Awsome. So much to look at its old world with the new tech Loved every bit I wish I had more time here next time

Between Central Station and NEMO. I had seen reviews of this library so decided I would check it out next time I was by Central Station. I took the lift to the 7 floor, enjoyed the views, then came down on the escalators. Oh how I wish there was a facility like this close to where live.
Great view of Amsterdam. Went to the top floor of the library for an evening meal. Lots of fresh food at reasonable prices. The pizza was lovely. A must if you want a good view of Amsterdam!

Probably the best public library I've ever been.. The public library of Amsterdam is an architectural gem. Let's start with that. The building itself is a must visit landmark. To go around inside you need a membership card but still you can enjoy the view, a light reading and a cup of coffee.

A jem in the heart of the city. When my friend showed me the Amsterdam Central Library, I was amazed at the sheer size and thought I was entering an airport terminal. There are about five levels, and you can probably find any book you are looking for. There are many small study and relaxation areas, its a quiet and calm space, and its sleek design helps you recharge for another exciting experience in Amsterdam.

Hi-tech design. One of the most impressive libraries of Europe, pity that in the NL openbaar (public) means you actually you have to pay to make use of it. I guess it all goes to maintaining the building and the staff (or at least I hope so).
Great view from the roof. And the cafeteria there is top notch. A great place for lunch. The food is fresh and the service is friendly.
Really nice library. Oh, this one was nice. Splendid library with a unique location.Great (I had to write "great" and "this" to reach the 50 characters)

Amazing choice of food - best library restaurant ever, and great views!. I visited following reviews, mainly to take advantage of the views from the top floor and was not disappointed. And we were completely blown away by the quality and selection of the food on offer - something for everyone inc juice/ smoothie/ salad bars, stir fry/ grill/ pizza/ pasta/ sandwiches, soup all freshly cooked at fantastic prices. Unfortunately we'd had a late breakfast so couldn't take full advantage of the offerings, settling for coffee/ cakes/ pastries. The day we were there the cafe closed at 5 which is a shame as I would have enjoyed an evening meal there (the library remained open till much later). It was also very busy so quite difficult to get a table. Next time I return to Amsterdam this will be the first place I visit!

Stunning modern design on the IJ. State of the art library with beautiful views of Amsterdam. Much to explore, including the design of the building itself. La Place cafeteria is on the top floor with outdoor seating.

Library. This is more than a library you can listen to music or play the piano if your capable but the best bits for me were the views from the top floor over the city and the cafe served the most magnifent food so if you have the time make an effort and pay a visit

A "Must" if you love books. Maybe if you're not an avid reader, you can't see what all the fuss is about. It's a bookworm's Heaven. Books. Views. Food. And they even sell half-price tickets to events. Makes my hometown libraries look pretty puny.
Love the building. The entrance with view to all the floors above is super. A bit of everything, Modern, nice view from the restaurant on the top. Next to Amsterdam’s Central train station

A book worm's paradise. First of all, I am a PhD student in literature. I legitimately enjoy visiting libraries. This was a really interesting visit.The library here has a really unique, user-friendly design. While there are tons of quiet areas to work (and a variety of different seating options), the library also has a lot of central areas where people can meet and talk. It was great to see this incarnation of a library; I have never seen anything like it.However, I suspect that this is so highly ranked because of the seventh-floor terrace with views of the city. OK, Amsterdam isn't the largest or even the sexiest city, but the views are free. The barrier is fairly high - definitely over a meter tall - but below that, there is clear plexiglass, so kids can easily see through. Shorter adults may have trouble, though. I'm 5'7"/ 170 cm and the top of the barrier was at chest-level.The food in the cafeteria looks good (lots of different food stations to choose from, including a pizza oven!) and the price seems to be OK; however, we stuck to drinks. A well-lit cooler showed off a decent variety of drinks, alcoholic and non-. If you're in Amsterdam with a group of picky eaters, this would be an excellent, affordable place to go. Admission is free and on a rainy day, it kept a friend and I occupied for almost two hours (including a drink in the cafeteria). However, I am giving it four stars instead of five because I wouldn't consider it a "must-do" in Amsterdam, like taking a boat tour of the canals.

Amazing interior - worth a visit. The library is a fantastic example of simple and modern design. It is an inspiration in terms of public facilities and definitely worth a visit for anyone with a design eye while in Amsterdam. Go and enjoy the beautiful space and the tranquility. I also recommend taking the elevators to the top floor and enjoying the view off the top deck.

Modern building - good views if you are tall. Nice new modern building, interesting to go up through on the escalator to the viewing balcony at the very top. Good views (unless you are short!) and nice cafe on the top floor which we did not use but smelt good.

Stunnung library with excellent views and eatery. Just to the left of the main railway station as you come out is the main Central Library (Openbare Bibliotheek)A new modern spacious building with excellent facilities.On the top floor is a restaurant with excellent fresh food cooked why you wait. An excellent choice of meats salads etc all for a very good price.Then the views from where your eating there are a bonus.A definite must when in Amsterdam.
Beautiful views. If you get a chance, go to the top on a sunny day and see the beautiful views it has across the city.

An Awesome library. I came from a country where the libraries are commonly sad. Finding this library is like coming to a wonderland, even for those who doesn't like to read. The building has several floors with every floor has each awesome collection from records to books. It also has many comfy corner to read, focus on your laptop, or just sit back and relax. The design of the building is minimalist yet equipped with high technology feature.This library also has a special place for children. This is very good and I will definitely want to take my child there.

I don't understand how this is a main attraction. Don't get me wrong, it is a lovely library, and if I was a citizen of Amsterdam I would love this place, but as a tourist I just don't get how it is ranked so high. (currently #3 attraction in the city)It is in a nice area near the main train station, and has beautiful views of the city, but there is much more to see in Amsterdam than a library. I went to the top, ate lunch, enjoyed the views and left. I had a very pleasant time. The architecture is great ... I just think there are more things in the city to see. If you only have limited time in the city, I would wait to come back until your next trip. Again, its lovely, just shouldn't be one of the main things you should strive to see.

Nice to see, but it's not a MUST see. This is a very nice library for those that want to get some reading in, but it shouldn't be a surprise that being able to read Dutch is definitely a plus. I would encourage anyone with a fascination for great libraries and literature to visit, but it's not a must see for the majority of people.

Books with restaurant on 7th floor. Stumbled upon library after an over priced dinner nearby.Architecture and easy flow to each floor, makes this a modern marvel. Not many books for English readers, but worth the trip.Seventh floor cafe is a treat, first time we enjoyed coffees and recently we had portion sized Chinese food, split able and made with very fresh ingredients.I wish libraries in the States followed Amsterdam's lead in this type of cafe in public spaces.

Phenomenal Library. Architecture and Collection both phenomenal. Visited later in the evening after a full day of touring. Children's area was very impressive and interactive. Enjoyed our evening meal on the top floor which had an open deck to view the city - food was fresh prepared, wide selection, and reasonably priced.Not to be missed - something here for everyone to enjoy.

It's free. This library is an anachronism in more ways that one. First, library's in general are anachronisms. But this version attempted to head-off inevitability by installing 500 internet terminals, only to have mobile tablets become a world standard, with which you have a personal internet terminal most everywhere that you are. Still, it is a large attractive modern building. And best of all, it's free.

View from top floor food court is worth the trip. Very nice library, huge selection. Computers and printing service. View from top floor food court is worth the trip. Food and drink selection is very good.

Nice place for sunset. We rode a bike around the city and went into this modern building after trying to go into Nemo but it was closed. It caught us by surprise with it's good view of the city. It was very spacious and comfortable to stay for the evening. Has a cafe at the top which supplies a good variety of food. Best modern library I have visited.
Lovely Open Space Building. If you are passing by, get the lift to the seventh floor and walk out onto the balcony; the view of Amsterdam City from the top is incredible.

Piano, modernity, view.. A top notch library, newly built, very modern. Seven floors (or maybe more?).There is a great view facing the water but please be respectful, this is a library.Someone's usually playing the piano in the lobby on ground floor. You can hear the music on the other floors as well.

Great food, beautiful view. I went here because it was so highly recommended on Tripadvisor. I am originally from the Netherlands, so I was wondering what the fuss was all about. I must say I was pleasantly surprised going here. It is a really nice library, lot's of space and quiet places. But I mainly came here for the lunch menu and the terrace. Lunch is incredible, so many choices of fresh food, it all looked delicious, I could go here every day for lunch. Prices are also reasonable and the view from the terrace is very well worth the 10 - 12 min walk from the train station. It is a fun place to go for all ages. I went with my two daughters, age 12 and 9 and my niece (16), and they were all impressed by the place.

Outstanding Views and Lunch Value. Having read previous Tripadvisor reviews of the new central library we decided to include it in our walking itinerary one day. It was well worth it and we particularly enjoyed the lunch on the top floor which has splendid views of Amsterdam and a wonderful range of fresh and cooked food served in an up market cafeteria style. Most of the customers were locals and we enjoyed the soup and focaccia and drinks which were all very reasonably priced. There is a small 20 cent charge for using the lovely clean toilets.

Fantastic place!. I could have spend hours in this place. We loved the architecture, the view and the upper level restaurant. The food was great and the prices even better. I wish I had a library like this to visit.

What a library should be!. The library is awesome. It's architecturally beautiful, and worth a look through. There is a great restaurant on the top floor with very fresh food, and an Italian restaurant by the entrance. There's an art exhibit space (free). This is where you can find same day, half price tickets for shows in town. I wish my town had a library like this - it's a real community centre and showpiece.
Great library. The uilding itself is something different. It's beautiful and modern with a nice restaurant. But the best feature is the great view at the top.

Many reasons to visit the Central library of Amsterdam - OBA. The "Openbaar bibliotheek van Amsterdam - OBA" is a great place to visit, not only to access an incredible number of books, music and other collections, but also to have a good simple meal looking to an amazing view of Amsterdam. The building has 7 floors, including a theater at the top and a nice simple restaurant "La Place" at the 6th floor. The whole building has lots of glass, which makes the environment light and agreeable. I went there for a training in one of the meeting rooms. The location is quite convenient, close to the Central Station in Amsterdam and having subterranean parking. The meeting room was a bit dark in comparison with other areas in the building, but it was quite comfortable.There is a big area in the first floor attractively prepared to receive kids.

One the best views. This is a incredible place, not only you can read a book, study, connect to internet or really rest, (they have nice couches to rest, in a quite place), but also you can go to the top floor, just buy a coffee and enjoy the views of the city from there. Its a great attraction for tourist but also pimps the daily life of the local people.

Incredible library. We went there to see how it was, and to see the view (you get to see the center of the city from across the river). It's an incredible, enormous library. The services are absolutely amazing, it's beautifully decorated and they have an art gallery which was actually interesting. I just wish we had something nearly as nice where I live, because it must be great to enjoy their book/dvd/music services. I'm envy! Worth the time to visit if you'd like to see a really cool first-world library.

lovely views. I only visited in order to take advantage of the brilliant views from this building. As I was a tourist and not a member of the library I could not make full use of the facilities, however, this library looks excellent with a vast number of resources ( books, CDs, DVDs and computers which offer free internet access to members). As for the views they were indeed spectacular and worth taking 10 minutes out of your schedule to experience as well as taking in the architecturally impressive modern library.

Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow, wow, wow.. Oh flips, this place is incredible! I am a librarian. I nearly had a turn when I walked into Central Library. This is almost the perfect library - utterly, utterly wonderful. A LOT of thought has clearly gone into considering the usage, needs and ultimate design of this building. An absolute must-see in Amsterdam, especially the 7th floor, with it's balcony views across the city - the restaurant is a La Place, and pretty much the same as all the others, but that for me was the only gripe. Fan-blooming-tastic!

Beautiful library with a great cafe. We came here twice to eat dinner on the 7th floor. The food was great, wine and beer available, and a nice outdoor area with great views. The stir fry was very good. You choose your own veggies, filling a small, medium or large bowl and then the cook adds the meat and the sauce. We loved eating here!

Wonderful, imaginative architecture and interiors. Went in as a tourist, just for a look around as had heard there were great views and was a beautiful building. Both were true and it was lovely to wander around. There was a public piano in the foyer and accomplished pianists were invited to play, so there was beautiful music accompanying our visit. There was also a photography exhibition, jewellery on display and some incredible felted / tapestry walls. There is also free wifi and an extensive cd / DVD collection, plus loads of magazines. Great oasis of peacefulness!

Wonderful library, excellent cafeteria. This is how all libraries should be like. It's absolutely beatiful, not the moldy smell of old books but a light-filled space, inviting you to read something. Also, the cafeteria on the rooftop is worth a visit, it's reasonably priced and offers a view over the city and local as well as Italian and Asian food.

Great spot and nice spot to grab a bite. We went to the central library after reading about the view from there. It was great to see the city as it should be seen, from the water with its clump of taller historic buildings and the ever-present brick rows of houses. The restaurant there was also lovely with a nice selection of meals, desserts, fruits and drinks including watermelon "sap."

Amazing Cafeteria. The building itself makes you think every single library in the word should be like this one. It was very vibrant and inviting, large collection of books and multimedia as far as I could see. But what stroke me the most was indeed was the cafeteria :) Very fresh and tasty. If you are looking for lunch or coffee break only, just go there, you will not regret it.

If you are nearby - go for it. Cool library, but I only went because I was near it and had about 1/2 an hour to kill. The view is okay, but really not great for photographs (in my opinion). Cafeteria style snacks/food on the top floor in case you are hungry or thirsty, but you don't have to buy anything to pop out to the terrace, just be respectful of people who actually did buy food there. If I lived in Amsterdam, I would totally come to this library often. There was live music on two floors, great stations to listen to music, a beautiful children's place, great light, etc.
Nice view. Beautiful, modern building with a nice bar and restaurant. Don't miss the roof terrace. Nice view of the city!

Great View and Food. I'm impressed by how Amsterdam makes a place like a library such an interesting attraction. Great view at the top and their food was great. Yummy mint and honey drink seems to be a dutch specialty. Wish I could read dutch to actually understand all the different things that offered by the library.
Great Lunch Spot. The 7th floor cafe serves a wide variety of great food, some of it cooked as you watch! But the best feature is the outside patio with views over Amsterdam!

Beautiful Libray, and even better food. I became aware of this attraction from Trip Advisor (THANK YOU) and we were so happy that we took time to see it. For people who love books and libraries it is a beautiful building, however the best part is the 7th floor where you find a great cafeteria/restaurant. The food selection is amazing – some of it is made to order, and they serve wine and great sangria. Just outside of the restaurant is a great patio that overlooks most of city. It was a great way to relax after a busy day of sightseeing before hitting the night life. Location is about a 5 min walk from the train station, just past the double tree hotel.

A cozy Bibliotheek with stunning architecture and charming views. Coming from the United States, I really didn’t know what to expect when visiting the Central Library (Openbare Bibliotheek) in Amsterdam. To be honest, I was completely astonished by what I found. The outside of the building is absolutely beautiful with stunning glass windows as far as the eye can see and numerous floors that seem to never end. The inside is even better. Contemporary lighting is found throughout the lobby with beautiful hardwood floors and plush lounge chairs dotted throughout. Each level has different departments on it so be sure to read the directory to find what you’re looking for or just have fun and explore the whole building. There is an elevator located in the back of the library that will take you to the different levels with ease. The absolute best part was finding the quaint restaurant located on the top level. They have an amazing outdoor platform from which you can see a panoramic view of the city. The views were stunning and definitely worth while. The library is very easy to find as it is located a short walk to the East from Centraal Station. Absolutely stunning and one of a kind.

Interesting concept experience. Hard to rate this place: is this mainly an excellent lunch restaurant (loads of fresh vegetables, fruit, wonderful presentation) with a good top floor view? Or is it just a welcome break-away from the insane tourist crowd, just minutes away around the Central Station? Or a minor basement event for families with young kids - who will love the mice doll house-? The modern, minimalistic and thematic library concept is probably not the reason why quite a few international tourist show up. In any case: we enjoyed our OBA visit which lasted approx. 1,5 hours.

You can't miss it!!. loved everything in this place. This is a big store building very modern, where you can find any kind of source you can possibly look for... very high tech, the staff is very attentious and pleasant. You need to reserve most of your day. It is worth to visit all floors.

A library every city should have!. A calm oasis near the heaving Central Station. You can wander at will amongst the shelves (though reading Dutch would obviously be a help!). Non-members can pay a small fee and use the internet and print stuff. There's a branch of the great Dutch eatery La Place on the top floor and clean (pay) toilets in the basement. Great views over the city from that top floor too.

Miserable - no customer service, bad attitude, avoid this place. When we planned our trip we were surprised to see the central library as the #2 attraction in Amsterdam. As a family of avid readers we were intrigued. The building itself is pleasant. The problems are how customers are treated:- One added service the library has is to sell tickets to tourist attractions throughout the city. We tried to buy. The first person at the counter said they do not sell tickets. We showed from the library brochure that it is a service. A manager (I guess) came into help and said they sell tickets, but only 2, they will not sell 5. What is this nonsense? So we walked to the tourist office at the central stations, about 300 m, and bought tickets.- WiFi is not free- The restaurants on the 7th floor have a good selection but incredibly the toilets are charged. 50 Euro cents does not matter, it is the principle.We were all very disappointed with the customer facing aspects of the library! The collection itself, especially the children's area, is nice.

Stunning library. I wish all cities had libraries like this. Light, airy, spacious, excellent selection of magazines, films and cds as well as books. Brilliant cafe with skyline views over the city. Would love to have this in my town!
Incredible children's section. While the library isn't exactly a typical tourist attraction, it's definitely worth a visit for the incredible children's section and general layout on each floor.
Worth for the view. Modern and nice building, but this is all about the view. Bad thing is far away from center, go at the sunset time and enjoy a coffee in the top floor

Interesting building, nice cafeteria, great view.. Even though it's a pretty long walk from the touristic center of A'dam, this modern 7 story building near the harbor is worth the trek for its modern design, which shows how beautiful a functional public building can be, for it's cafeteria which serves some really unusual choices, and for the view over the city from the outdoor eating area adjacent to the cafeteria. The view reinforces the idea of how flat A'dam and the surrounding countryside really is. There literally is nothing on the horizon--no mountains or even hills. Admission is free.

It is not a tourist attraction.. It is a library, so I would not describe this building as a tourist attraction, People go there to study, read books or even watch movies. Nevertheless, there is a nice restaurant in the last floor where you can have a view of the city of Amsterdam while you enjoy a cup of coffee and a pastry. There is an exhibition room in the ground floor. When we went, the exposition was about fashion (kind of ugly to be honest). I would visit the place if you want to spend some time reading or if you want to have a detour and eat something at the restaurant.

Best view of the city. A local friend of mine recommended this place. I wasn't looking for a book, but from the top you get one of the best views of the whole city. Amsterdam is a beautiful place, and this is a great way to take it all in.

Nice views, beautiful library and great restaurant. A walk from the central station you can find this nice place . Beautiful library (best for kids), in the last floor great restaurant, with natural food and good views of the city. If you have some spare time, it worths the walk.

Amazing Libarary. Really great collections. Well organized bright and cheery. A place that you like to be. Most U.S. libraries should go there and then emulate it back home. Each segment make you feel like you are in a small easy to use libarary instead of a huge place which it is. The folks who work there are very pleasant and helpful.

A modern, quiet space with stunning views. Amsterdam's Central library is a wonderful haven a short walk from the main station. In the foyer you'll find a piano for public use and a detailed plan of each floor.The children's department is magical with towers, hiding places and 3D art including a mouse house and giant polar bear.The upper levels are dedicated to books (including an reasonably sized English language section), DVDs, CDs and video games (classic and modern). You'll also find multimedia rooms, study pods, pleanty of computers and a wall of forgotten socks.Go to the top floor for a beautiful skyline view of the city. A terrace is open here from Spring until mid-Autumn.WiFi is expensive for non members so if you plan on visiti often a membership is recommended.
great place well organised and easy to use. so many bikes!!!!!! you have to be on your guard!!!!!! transport so easy on the trams outside central station

Amazing place. This public library has an amazing collection of different kinds of works, including a huge rang of sheet music, together with a piano with headphones to study. The architecture of the place is very nice. The cafeteria is located on the top floor and has a terrace with good views of the city. It is a self-service buffet with wok, grill and pizza cooked at the moment. The food is good and not expensive.
Big library. A big library, a nice view from the top floor. You can have a drink there or have a bite at Vapiano, a nice Italian restaurant.

Check it out. Our room wasn't ready at the Hilton Doubletree so we went to the library. Very modern building, seven floors (one that is all DVDs) and a restaurant on the top floor. They have over 600 computer terminals!

Interesting space. The building to me is not the best but the inside spaces are worth to see.there is an area for kids, one for worldwide magazines and newspapers and on the top floor a restaurant bar.

An island of peace in the busiest part of Amsterdam. Located near to the busy central station, this library has more than books and peace to offer. The modern architecture, holds different floors with books in different languages, sometimes art exhibitions, the already famous free top view and there is a whole floor with children attractions. It is easy to go back to your childhood and let your imagination flow there. with a nice coffee place at the top, this place is worth a visit!

One of the best free views in Amsterdam. The Central Library is my home from home. I pick up my books, go online, chill out, have a coffee or even a really good lunch dinner, and to top all that I can enjoy one of the best cityscapes available in the entire city - and that is totally free. Apart from the various exhibitions they have to offer you will occasionally be serenaded by some (anonymous) one playing piano on the gound floor, the strains rising up through the building. If they are good it's quite enchanting.

relaxing atmosphere, magnificent views. I used to go here to study for my exams, when all university libraries were overcrowded and this place was still new and relatively unknown. I loved the architecture, the atmosphere, the study rooms, the variety of lounge chairs, the view, and of course, the opportunity to grab a coffee and have a break at the rooftop terrace. There is free Wifi and free internet on computers. With the years this place became increasingly crowded, at little less fresh and clean, and as this is a public library a small portion of its crowd can be a little dodgy. So always watch your stuff, but don't miss the amazing views!
Modern bibliotheque. Lots of space, books, audio and videos.Good ambiance to read a book or study.Don't miss the view of amsterdam and the restaurant on the roof !

I'd go to the library everyday. The Openbar Bibliotheek has officially joined the ranks of the places that can make me feel like a kid all over again (the other one is IKEA). There are rows and rows of books and floor length windows that let in lots of natural light - the entire place is very modern and there is an entire level for multimedia! My favourite was the kids section with the large beanbags, stuff toys and other decorations. I'd go to the library every day if I were a kid!The location is a little out of the way so I visited it right before I was leaving Amsterdam from Amsterdam Centraal station. You can leave your luggage at the library reception and its a breezy 5min walk from Centraal! A really nice way to spend an hour or so before catching your train.

Wow!. Central library is a must! Everybody goes to the central part of Amsterdam, everybody sees the canals but not everybody manages to see this flat city from above. When we went there it was already quite a late evening, we sat outside, grabbed a coffee and enjoyed a new side of this great city. It's not about red brick buildings and canals, go there and see something totally different :)
Amazing!. This library is absolutely stunning. The modern architecture, the layout, the light and space are worth a visit. This place is one of my favourites in Amsterdam. Make sure not to miss it.

Go here if you care about urban planning, modern architecture, and great food. And 50% off cultural tickets.. Go here if you care about urban planning, modern architecture, and great food. The largest and most advanced library in Europe. To die for view on the 7th floor of the whole city. Two gourmet restaurants, two radio stations doing live broadcasts, Massive comic book collection, yes! One whole floor of music and movies to check out from around the world. (Each floor is about the size of an average warehouse) Also a theatre, and exhibition space. Oh!, Underground storage area for 2,000 bikes. And an extra special perk: You can buy tickets for any cultural event that day for 50% discount on site. And being Amsterdam, the ticket INCLUDES RT public transport to and fro. Only a 6-7 minute walk from Centraal Station along the water.
great. dont forget to visit one of the most important bibliotek in amsterdam!! you can find all of your book taste!!

Cool architecture, good location. We were allowed to leaved 4 pieces of luggage and wander around for a bit. We were welcomed with some sort of musical presentation in the lobby which I found surprising being in a library. It was quickly over however. We went all the way to the top and checked out the cafe/restaurant and checked out the view. It was the coolest library I have ever been to, which is quite the feat because I have been to at least five. Very modern look and a wonderful place to visit (for free!)

Very modern library and great food!. Visited the library upon reading reviews regarding the restaurant on the top floor. The library is very modern and is nice to explore. The main reason for visiting the library was to have an early dinner at the restaurant on the 7th floor. The restaurant is sort of like a cafeteria but you can also get hot food, which is made in front of you. We paid €23.50 for 2 big bowls of noodles with chicken and vegetables as well as a large bottle of beer and a bottle of water. The food was tasty and filling, which is exactly what we were after!

Light lunch with a view. Amsterdam is not known for high rise buildings and there are few places with an overview. Therefore I like this "open for public" top floor cafe for lunch with a view. They offer decent food and on a sunny day it's ideal to sit outside. Good for first time visitors to get a bird's eye view. Good to combine with visiting the harbor, museum of modern art, Nemo, and the music hall.
Lovely restaurant.. We enjoyed a lovely Italian meal at the restaurant. You are given a card each and card is swiped when food is ordered.Good if going with a group.

Great Location. One of the most popular things to see/visit for tourists from out of town, this place is a 5-minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal...plenty of places to eat/sit around as well. RECOMMENDED

Book Nerd dream. The building is very modern and the layout is great. Go to the top and see a great view of Amsterdam for free! If you're hungry you can also get some food from the cafe and sit on the patio. The staff was super friendly. Worth a look- even though tourists can't check out materials.

Wish I had this library in my town. This is by far the most modern and vast library I have ever visited. I love libraries and this is certainly my favorite for more reasons than one - their collection of media and books is among the best in EU, the reading rooms and facilities for members are top notch and the design of the library is modern and very innovative. Tips:1. Visit the top floor restaurant level for nice views of the city. 2. You can buy half-price/discounted tickets for same day concerts/events happening in Amsterdam3. Look out for small art installations/ mini exhibitions on different floors
Good place to visit for design lovers. Lovely libraru with very nice interior and furniture design.
Great view. Headed to the top floor (7th) to see the best view of Amsterdam. Lovely cafe too, great soups and sandwiches. Wish all public libraries could be this nice.

modern design, great view. visit this building if you like modern design and then go all the way up and enjoy the view while you have a cup of tea or coffee. a great place to visit if you are tired of the old house along the canals.LOL
Wonderful!. I was very amazed to see how modern the library is, even though i can hardly call it an "Attraction" its just nice to see the students studying in the public library!
Nice library. While it's nicest library I've seen, it still hardly at attraction, at least unless you have some test next day.

The place to hang out and eat a great meal. It's hard to believe but this library is out of this world. First the architecture is really beautiful, open and airy, with an amazing collection of books, magazines and media. The cool part about it is that at the top floor there is an great restaurant (buffet style) so it is informal but at the same time delicious quality with killer views of Amsterdam and its lovely canals. It is certainly more of a local hangout but if you get to experience it it's worth the time.

Must see. You have to see this libaray to belive it. the technology is unbelieveable and pretty cool.I recommend the cafe if you have the time for a quick bite but it does get pretty busy. One of the coolest libraries I have ever been to:)

Amazing Library. Went just to see the architecture. It is an amazing building! So well designed! It is a little out of the way but near the NEMO center. Would definitely suggest everyone to just to see the building!

Go there for the cafeteria, but not really much else.. I travelled to the Central Library because I'd read that you got an amazing view from the top - well, the view was indeed nice, but useless for photography, as the design of the building prevents you from getting any really good shots (the roof hangs over). That was a disappointment.However, the cafeteria on the top floor was amazing - you basically go along and pick up the things you want, then pay at the end. Tons of fresh juices and meals, staff standing behind the counter to make the food how you like it; I loved it! The seating was great, too. It was a nice place to sit and write some postcards.Other than that, however, there wasn't much else to do - and you had to pay to use the bathroom, which was a bit ridiculous!
A nice break. Pros:-Cool design-tasty food market on top floor-fun place to relax other than a StarbucksCon:-have to pay for the bathroom-nothing special, jus a nice library

Modern library. Very modern design, excellent restaurant and the view of the port was amazing! The books and media are place according to subject matter each in different flloors. The first floor is desinged for children activities and literature.
I have lived here. But to pay for use of the toilet does not fit into my concept of a cozy house) Library chic. I liked everything - but I am a citizen of Russia)
Great rooftop. You have one of the best rooftop, the food is good and organic, free wifi as well, the only bad thing is that you have to wait until noon to get the savoury part of the buffet.

The book's heaven. We spent few hours in this so modern and so amazing building.It doesn't look at all like the libraries you are use to.It is wonderful place to spend your time- reading,working with computer ( even laying on sofa- beds), or eating or drinking in the restaurant - La Place,or just enjoy watching the town from the balcony on the very top,or listen to the music that someone play on the free- for- all piano at the entranceVisiting THIS library is an experience that you shouldn't miss!It is not just a library,it is a museum,a cultural centre,,spread across 7 architecturally different floors,where you can find everything- books,music, CDs,DVDs and books,books,booksIt is impossible to say everything you can find in this place.You just MUST go and see!And you will love it for sure!
Best library I have ever seen. Huge and beautiful building. A must-do for students who needs a nice and rich environment to study, but also for curious people ! The top view is breath-taking !

Great Value. Lonely planet had suggested a visit to the library and I thought....A LIBRARY? Oh, it is so much more. A visit to the restaurant on the 7th floor is a MUST. Fresh smoothies, stir fries, salad bar, sandwiches, even burgers and fries. What? You can even buy a bottle of wine and beer and enjoy with lunch or dinner! Prices are very reasonable and FOOD IS BEYOND FRESH! Sit out on the deck and overlook the canal!

Panoramic view of the city n canal. U will have to walk towards a silver building can be seen on the left when u come out from central station. You will have to walk about 5 minutes to get there until u see a beige building. Take the lift to go to 7th floor for the food. I had the fry curry noodles. I didn't like it but my friend did. So I cant say its very good food or neither. View were fantastic from the balcony. But beware of the Pigeons that try to scavenge your food if u leave it on the table while taking pictures. Balcony is outdoor so wont be able to use it when its raining. Toilet is at basement near entrance and cost 20cents to get in

Scene of Wonder. Amazing Amsterdam panorama from the top floor @ you can sit at the restaurant @ enjoy the view -- also a café on the first floor.The library itself is very high tech and worth a stroll.

Probably the best library I know. Whenever I need to do a school assignment or anything else that requires tranquility I visit here. They have seven floors with a huge selection of books and magazines and a separate floor for kids (not only Dutch but also English and French books). It's a very modern building and is accesable for weelchairs. What I definitely recommend is to pay the café/restaurant a visit. There's a stunning view at the top and there's very good food and fresh juices.The location also could not have been better since it's located practically next to the Amsterdam Central Station.
Funny, but a nice place to visit. beautiful decoration, great place to read a book or a magazine and have a light lunch at the "le place" upstairs admiring the city from a bird's view
One of the best views in the city!. A great building to visit, either to browse in the library or to go to the top-floor cafe for a great view of the city.

A library with a view. I love reading and yes, I have been to many libraries, but no library I've been to has the "come and read books, they are your friends" atmosphere. At the lowest floor there is children's space. A frienly environment with parts of libraries that have ladders and slides. Also, there are mini computers put at their hight and puff sofas.At the other floors, of course you can find books, dvd with films and music, but what it's most important is that, if you want to study there, you can take of of the cosy armchairs, put it next to the window wall and, while reading, raise your eyes towards the harbour. Mmm, beautiful view!

Great View. The thing that strikes most about the place is definitely the view of the canals and the whole area that you get from the top level of this library. There are very many restaurants as well that serves a good time while visiting the place even if you dont want anything to do with books

Top floor food fabulous. Read the reviews and thought we would try it.Stunning design and great chairs to relax in, with a silent, all white spot at the back of one of the floors.The escalator is a must....as it slows right down when no one is on it, but speeds up with a bit of weight on. Me and my son loved that!The food is impressive and healthy, with fresh pizza, big salads and fresh juices. Good value for money and also an outside seating area, if not pouring down. A really wonderful view of the city, with a key to the various buildings.Take a book, put your feet up and while away a few hours here. Perfect for a rainy day.Only downside is that you have to pay to use the toilet. The attendant was too busy on her phone, for some people, who managed to just walk past.

A "Must See" in Amsterdam.... Great location, excellent view, especially for taking photos...Although I went there close to closing time and had no chance to sit at the cafe, the library still looked good...

Great food and view. Ok I would not normally visit a library when traveling for pleasure but a friend had told me about this. There a an excellent view from the 7th floor and the La Place restaurant there serves excellent, fresh and reasonably priced food. Salads, stir fries, smoothies lots to eat for the health conscious as well as plenty of treats, sandwiches etc.
Great views and a good place to kill some time. If you're waiting for your flight, train or bus and you've got time to kill. I would recommend a visit.
Great View of the City. You can get a great lunch and view at the top of the library. Dont forget their is a charge for the w/c facilities. :(
A tribute to books. A beautifully designed and furnished library made for the reader. I envy a city that has a facility like this. I have not seen anything resembling like this in the US.

Not a typical site for tourists but.... The Amsterdam central library is not a typical site for tourists but the visit there is highly recommended for everybody. It is very close to the central station, A beautiful building of 7+ floors, full with books, journals, films, music dvd's and more. THE place to relax in a middle of a long day.

Beautiful!. This is probably the nicest public library I have ever been in. The children's room was light and airy even though it was the lowest level. The librarian was very helpful and generous with her time. The stacks are not crowded and there are plenty of places to sit and relax and desk space to do research. There are a cafe and theatre on the top floor! I loved this place!
love it. Great building, good facilities, great collections. nice buzz. Nice restaurant upstairs with great views. Good combination with visit to Nemo, the children's science museum.

Not just a Library. The library is just a 15minute walk from the central station and set of the waterside do not overlook this place as a mere library because apart from the books, the place has some nice restaurants and the one at the top level actually gives you a splendid view of the canals and the beautiful layout of Amsterdam. Food is definitely another reason of course.
Worth a visit. If you don't stop and look at the books, make sure you go up to 7th floor to look at the amazing views of Amsterdam!

Library with a difference. On our first day at Amsterdam we went to this library and were amazed at the collection of books CDs n the cafe...superrrbbb. the cafe was buzzing with an amalgamation of students from round the world n sm tourists like us. Gv a splendid view of Amsterdam. Wor th a visit

Super Find. Definitely go here for a meal and drinks as the view from the terrace is spectacular. Open for meals until 21:00 and drinks until 22:00. This is a cafeteria type place so there is little ambiance unless you sit on the terrace, but for value and views in Amsterdam it's a must.

Nice building, relaxing atmosphere, good place for lunch. OBA is a modern library which is nice to visit, and a good place to have lunch. They have a self-service cafeteria/ lunch restaurant upstairs, with good food, BBQ, pizzas in nice oven, etc. and excellent views. It is a nice place to take a break and with reasonable prices.

Even non-Librarians will enjoy this. Beautiful and sleek modern building really stood out against the backdrop of ornate ages-old architecture. The cafe had delicious pastries. Hop on Hop off bus stopped nearby. The entire facing of the library on the canal was lined with lounge chairs. Steps down to the water's edge had a couple of teens jumping in and out of the water to shiver on the steps in the sun. I enjoyed a pastry and the view after looking around the library collection and visiting their little shop that featured bookmarks, stationary items, book related doodahs.

hmmm... can't really see the fuzz. Go here for the view and a cup of coffee. Not really that much to see here.The food in the cafeteria is not too pricey so that's okay.The walk to the library is actually more fun than being there :)Using the restrooms will cost you!

Grand view, easy lunch spot!. When we are in Amsterdam we always visit the library for a great view and light lunch at La Place on the 7th floor. It's a wonderful, modern 7 story public library - a lot different than my local library! Check out the underground bike parking next door.It's a good place to get photos of people biking with musical instruments because of it's proximity to the music conservatory, it is close to Star Bikes bike rental, and Central Station.

Best view of Amsterdam...and so much more!. We read that the top floor of the library had the best view of the city of Amsterdam. So true! But also only one of the many qualities this gem hides. It is only about 2 blocks distance from Central station in downtown Amsterdam. An easy walk. It has beautiful modern architecture throughout the building. Comfy seats in almost any design. Electrical outlets to charge the tourist's cell phone. The internet. And two different options if you want to get something to eat. My daughter and I took a 30 minute break from walking the city and watched the sunset from the top floor in the coziest chairs while our iphones recharged. Lovely!My teenage daughter wished she were still young...the children's area of the library was amazing!!!!

Beautiful Building and a free view of Amsterdam. We were tipped off to go to the 7th floor , there is an excellent cafe with fantasic food and a free rooftop view of Amsterdam. There is no entrance fee and visitors are welcome .
Library with a view. Its an excelent library! From the tourist point of view not the mooooost interesting thing to visit but has a nice view that you can enjoy for free and has a nice caffe too!

Top class library. Not usually one for newer libraries, but visit for academic purposes when visiting Amsterdam. As a relatively new built building, this is a top class library with all features you could ask for. My only minor gripe is that they could make the free public wifi system more accessible.
For the book bugs. Huge library with a humongous collection of books, CDs and articles. Also a lovely restaurant at the top. A perfect place for the book bugs.

Almost too many choices. The view is great in the restaurant at the top of the library. There is a vast variety of food choice served buffet style. If you order something that needs cooking or heating be aware they don't deliver to the table, you pick it up. We had a group of six and no one was disappointed in their choices, and all of our choices were different.

Fabulouis restaurants at a great price and a view of the city and/or harbor to boot. The cafeteria on the top floor offers whatever you might like. The Italian place on the second floor is great, but expect to spend a long time in lines, as it is self serve. If you go here, go early.

Central Library. Do not miss out on this most amazing public facility! Apart from the view and one of the best self-service restaurants in Amsterdam on the top floor, the interior design of the building and its resources are mind-blowing.

Fantastic building. The Amsterdammers are understandably proud of this building. It is great architecture and a pleasant space. if you need to use the internet, you can pay for it here, but there are plenty of free internet places throughout the city.

A library to be proud of. I never thought I'd go to a public library and feel compelled to review it on trip advisor but the building and the experience are somewhere for the people of Amsterdam to be proud of and for those of us visiting to envy, and wish this was the quality of local public services around the world.I'd read about the building and that there was a cafe and viewing platform at the top, I just didn't expect to find somewhere that had been designed with such care and attention, additionally the quality of the food in the restaurant was above average.If you are in the area it's worth going up to the top just to see the view. I can't imagine a similar public facility of this quality exists in many places.

Panoramic Views in Stunning Contemporary Space. Most folks come to Amsterdam for the quaintness of it -- the canals, the domestic architecture, the weed, the fabulous museums -- but when all that wears you out, have a look at the most contemporary of places: the stunning Openbare Bibliotheek. It sits just east of Centraal Station, across a footbridge from NEMO. It's yet another testament to this city's dedication to its people first and foremost. Coming from San Francisco, where, sadly, the new (ish) main library is a travesty of lost opportunities and even more lost patrons, many of whom are homeless and encamped within it, I fully expected a similar situation in city that also has a fair share of social challenges. However, I found one of the most exciting public spaces full of engaged readers on every floor. At the top is a well-attended cafe with the most remarkable panoramas of Amsterdam imaginable. The view from here is reason enough to stop by. Inspiring!

Fantastic kids library. It's a great space for kids who love books, excellent selection of both dutch and other languages, events, and a cosy setting even in a large space. The view from the top floor is great and the cafe pretty good. Oh, and a decent selection of books and cultural program for adults too. The only negative is the odd classification system in the kids section which I can't seem to follow at all!
Great space!. We wanted to use a computer but decided just to take a look around - such a huge space. Really airy and bright; the layout of it we enjoyed

Modern Building with a Lovely Cafe. The library was close to my hotel and I had time before meeting friends so decided to stop there and go to the Cafe on the 7th floor which had been recommended. The food was very good and reasonable. I didn't realize just how reasonable as it was my first eating stop in Amsterdam.. Eating on the terrace overlooking the city just added to the pleasure. The building is beautiful, very modern and I was sorry I didn't have more time to explore the other floors.

Amsterdam Central Library - a MUST SEE for library lovers!. I’m a library enthusiast. On my last day in Amsterdam, I received a text suggesting that I might enjoy a visit to the Amsterdam Central Library, if I could fit it in. Understatement! The Library is open from 10 AM – 10 PM daily (yes, Sundays, too!), so it can easily be added to your itinerary at the end of the day when many other tourist destinations are closed. You can see the library from the canal boat tours – but on mine, they didn’t even mention it. The library is an easy (5-minute) walk from the Central Train Station. Arriving after 8 PM, I first chose to check out the 7th floor cafeteria and enjoyed dinner on the outdoor terrace. Good food and a great view!Then, with less than 1.5 hours until closing, I slowly and methodically made my way down the escalators, circumnavigating each floor, delighting in the wonderful spaces, unique furnishings and offerings of a library the likes of which you’ve probably never seen…unless you’ve been here before. There is a whole floor devoted to music and the arts that includes a radio station, and has an extensive and diverse sheet music collection. Unfortunately, my smartphone battery was running low and it was a toss-up whether to recharge so I could take more pictures or make a b-line for the phenomenal children’s room on the ground floor before closing. One thing’s for sure, next time I’m in Amsterdam – the Central Library will be at the top of my list!
Great stop!. The library has a cool, modern vibe. The cafe on the top floor is delicious and reasonably priced. There are also great views of the city from the top floor. Definitely worth a stop!

Best Eaterie in Town. The library was the biggest in Europe until Birmingham, Uk opened and there are computers available to use if required. As a visitor however I found the quality and value of the restaurant on the top floor amazing

Great Views. We were told that you could go to the top of the library to get great views over the city and it was well worth the visit.On a clear days, we got fabulous views and some great photos.There is also a good cafe on the top floor, open till 10pm.We called in at 9pm, and got coffee and a very good slice of apple cake for less than 3 euros!
Oasis of calm in a busy city. Clean fully stocked library with lots of international newspapers & magazines. Easy to get to and good access to all departments on site.

A treasure to visit for free!. A very modern building, wonderful library design, great terrace with nice views with low cost cafetaria, within just a few minutes from the Central Station and next to the Nemo building!

Excellent rooftop view and free wifi!. If you're travelling on a tight budget and looking for some cheap stuff to do and kill some time head here for a free view of A'dam! Go up to top floor in to the restaurant and on to the terrace and you will get some excellent pics! The restaurant La Place is great too, good value for money (actually it's pretty cheap for Amsterdam!) and lots of choice! Also somewhere to go if you're need of an Internet connection!

Not so much a tourist destination, but a great resource.. I heard that the new(ish) library in Amsterdam had an excellent terrace on the 7th floor with spectacular views over the city. It's true, and the terrace is part of the wonderful cafeteria that abounds with fresh food and drinks.The functional library is beautifully laid out, with loads of space and an extensive resource of books, manuscripts (including a huge area of sheet music), CDs and DVDs. I particularly liked the display cases at the ends of most shelf rows, given over to themes of books or other ideas - inspirational. The museum also has art exhibition space.Students were making good use of the library for their studies.The library is less than a 10 minute walk from the Central Station.
Top floor it's a plus. Great view from the top floor.Very calm place in every floor. Need to buy wi-fi. Excellent cafeteria but a little bit expensive.
Recomended a lot. very nice, interesting place. Comfortable to visitors all years old. Very nice view from the 7th floor. Very good food in the cafiteria for reasonable value.

Grab a book and sit facing the great views of the water. Very nice and modern library, futuristic, has a diner and cafe facilities. Free Wifi ,a lot of books obviously and multi media. I recommended grabbing a book going to the higher floors like 4-5-6 sit on the comfortable chairs facing the large glass windows overlooking the water. What a view!!!! And very calming especially after battling the hectic city. There are clean toilets as well and like most amsterdam make sure you have a 50 cent coin.
Amazing. Wonderful modern clean building.A place to go to escape the hustle & busle of busy Amsterdam.Lovely restuarant on 7th floor with fantasic views over the city.

A library in the digital age. Books, lots of them, some in English; wifi and workstations; quiet spaces with gorgeous views; interesting inhabitants of the city; CD's and DVD's; coffee, cake and a solid lunch; white and open spaces to stroll around in. The public library near the railway station at Oosterdokskade 143 is more than just a library; it's an attractive architectural and social space. Don't miss it!

Artistic Lamps. The building zelf is very modern. I'm not a book wurm but it's a pleasure to be in this library. I come specially for the architecture. I love the lamps, very artistic. Sure I'll be back to see the view of amsterdam from the the top floor.
Lovely atmosphere, great views. Good choice of English titles. Little cabins where it´s possible to retreat for awhile with a good book. Upstairs cafe with nice food and great views.

A hidden gem. On the top floor of the library is La Place cafeteria. The food selection is amazing and most is cooked fresh for you as you wait. There is a juice bar, desserts, fresh fruit, pizzas, sandwiches, soups, a grill bar for chicken or burgers, beverages including beer or wine. We chose a chicken stir fry, and you choose your vegs, then hand to a chef who adds your choice of chicken, or seafood, and then a sauce and noodles or rice. A medium plate cost us 8.75 euros and it was a substantial meal - and so fresh. Staff were really friendly and helpful. It is well known by students and staff of the university, but not I suspect well known by tourists or visitors to Amsterdam. Certainly worth a visit, and it has amazing views of the city from large picture windows. A hidden gem.

Best value buffet lunch in Amsterdam : worth seeking out . Recommended by the guide on a walking tour this was the best buffet I've come across in many years in any establishment let alone a non- commercial one! Its located in the modern public library building a little to the west of Central Station. It also has the advantage of a great view from the 7th floor terrace. The selection is positively bountiful and presented in a fabulously colourful manner. There are fresh fruit juices and smoothies; a salad bar with a selection going beyond the usual fare to include sun dried tomatoes, cooked cold aubergines and courgettes, & nuts (all delicious); they also have home made soup; a grill with meat cooked to order; pizzas cooked to order; delicious sandwiches made with excellent brown seeded rolls. All very reasonably priced - my salad plus large cream cheese roll plus banana and orange smoothie was around €10. This place is well worth making a detour for.
Try the view from the restaurant. A friend told us to check out the restaurant at the top of the library. Nice assortment of cakes and a lovely view of the city.

Nice view . No entry fee and you can take the elevator to the top floor for a nice view over the city. They have a nice café there but we didn't try it. Not crowded when we were there but probably in summertime. Worth 10 minutes of your time.

One not to miss!. Going to a library isn't necessarily a tourist treat but this one is different. I was advised to take a look because it's free and you can get great views of a city that's pretty flat. No-one told me how ultra-modern it was and that it had much more to offer than books! Like the cafes and restaurants, for instance. At the risk of disturbing everyone who actually goes there to use the library facilities and not to gawp (like I did), I'd make sure that a visit to the library in Amsterdam (along with seeing the Red Light District) is one thing not to miss.

Tasty Cafe. We stayed in a hotel not too far from here so we stopped for lunch and a wonder round. Its located near the Centraal Station and the Science Centre (NEMO). The La Place which is the cafe on the top floor was very reasonable, loads of choice, very tasty food. They do have these cafes in other places (like the airport) but this one has a lot more choice.
Great place to use free internet. They have free access to computers with internet. Besides they offer a big number of CDs and DVDs if you want to rent something to watch at the hotel.

Biggest Library I have ever seen!. The library is amazing and very closely located to the Amsterdam Centraal Station and to the Science Center NEMO, the place is so huge that you get lost in books. Lovely but cant issue books if you are on a short trip.

Library with musical entrance. During our browse of the last Amsterdam Light Festival we stumbled across the library and were surprised that it was still open quite late in the evening. It has got a nice entrance and we were welcomed by piano music. This was a bit unexpected in a library, where usually silence is enforced. The "stage" can be used by more skilled piano players for maximum half hour per day and a soft touch is encouraged. We looked around and took a few pictures. It has got a lot of books of course. The children section has been nicely designed. Certainly worth to look around, even if you are not a member.

Food and a great view.. This restaurant is a not-so well-kept secret in Amsterdam. It combines books, culture: much of it free for visitors with a restaurant that has a great view of Amsterdam. The food on offer is a good combination of many different kinds of cuisine, all for a very reasonable price. This is a great place for tourists and locals alike.
Best library in the Netherlands!. This library is the best and largest library in the Netherlands. It also includes a restaurant on the top floor.
