More than just a library!. Great views from the top floor, spacious and light, and the most fantastic cafe I have ever come across in a public building !!!! Work a look.

This is the library of the future. All libraries should be like this. Yes, they have books (mostly in Dutch), but they are almost irrelevant. There are computers everywhere as well as WiFi (but you need to sign up as a member to use any of this). The library has a tremendous number of CDs and DVDs. The building is bright and airy and there are comfortable chairs everywhere. To top it off (literally) there is an excellent cafeteria-style restaurant on the top floor with a great over of Amsterdam. All in all, definitely worth a visit to see what a library can be.

It's a pretty library... But that's it!. Keen to see what all the fuss was about, I trekked over to here at sunset to get some photos from the 7th floor balcony.The library is very nice looking and tastefully decorated. The balcony was closed though and apparently stays closed all winter. Worth a quick look, but it's nothing special.

Great views of the city. We went to the Central Library after other travellers recommending it on Trip Advisor. If you go into the library and go up to the 5th floor floor window to take a few photos and see the view for miles, or have a drink at the cafe at the top you can relax and enjoy the view!Highly recommended, and also free!

Incredible. Probably the best restaurant in town (in a shoestring trip) with an unique view of the city. And yes, we are talking about a library. There is a restaurant (La Place) in the top floor. Just get in.

Jealous of the Dutch!. Sadly you have to me a Dutch citizen to become a member of this incredible place but it is worth a visit all the same. An 8 storey representation of pretty much all that I love about The Netherlands!It is modern, clean and environmentally friendly. It is free! Rows upon rows of books, CDs and everything else you expect from a library. Not to mention free wifi, laptops, computers, a piano which is free to play, art exhibitions and a live radio broadcast when I last visited! There are also private "pods" to enjoy some time to yourself, which is rare in the middle of any city.To top it all off, literally, there is the La Place cafe/restaurant on the top floor. Good, nutritious food cooked in front of you and very affordable. Or you can just enjoy the tea and coffee with the delicious cakes. All whilst enjoying the spectacular panoramic view of the Amsterdam skyline.If I was a local I know this place would be my second home.

Unmissable. We went to this place on our last day, simply because it was close to our hostel. I didn't expect much, I saw that the bulding was huge and well...it's a library, usually libraries are not among tourist attractions... But we spent an hour there! The most modern cultural complex I've ever seen, it's free of course and the view from the cafe on the top is a nice place to take photos of the bay. I can only recommend it!

What a library!. I love this library. It is modern and bright and has a great children's section. It is many floors of an extensive selection of all books, including a large reference section.The best part...a 'mini' La Place gourmet cafeteria type restaurant on the top floor - great food, great atmosphere and a great view of the city!It is easy to spend hours at this wonderful library!

Worth taking a walk through. I was a little confused when I noticed a library was one of the top attractions in Amsterdam, but it is actually worth checking out. It's a very huge and modern library. Go all the way to the top and see a great view of the city. They also have one of the best food courts I've ever seen on the top floor. Go check out the view and grab lunch!

great place for a meal. Wonderful library with great reasonably priced food. Omletes, soups, salads, cooks to prepare hot salads, grilled foods. It is on the top floor and has a terrace overlooking Amsterdam
architecture amazing. take some time and visit this place it is truly a work of art. the views ar great and the food court at the top has amazing food.

I wish I could live there. This library is absolutely fantastic! You can find a whole world inside! If you're visiting, make sure you go in hungry, because the restaurante in the top floor has an amazing diversity of food. The view from the restaurant to the city is beautiful and, in the summer, you can go to the balcony to have a better experience. You can't miss this!

A good place to visit while jet lagged. Thanks Trip Advisor! We arrived in Amsterdam and, as expected, could not yet get into our hotel room. Thanks to the high ratings, we went to the library and enjoyed a very good lunch on the seventh floor. The building and views were also worthwhile. It is not a must-see in Amsterdam, but if you are looking to spend some time or are nearby, it is well worthwhile.

New greatest library. the new library near the central station is very interresting, with an very interessant building. It's the greatest library of Europe, but it's fresh, lighting and open. Drink or eat something at the last stairs to see Amsterdam a little different

a place to be in amsterdam. central library amsterdam is the place one should visit while they are in amsterdam , surely there are much more to see but central library amsterdam is very unique and the experience you will have can be cherished life time

Fresh Fresh Fresh Lunch. Top floor of library, what a find. Everything to choose from, all cooked fresh in front of you...perfect for lunch. Only problem, menus not in English, but thats my problem ;)
one of the best. You can find all types of books, magazines and even they have a piano passing by strangers play. You can also visit Le palace restaurant on top floor with amazing Amsterdam view.
Great restaurant overlooking Amsterdam.. We deposited cases at station lockers and spent a couple of hours having lunch with a view overlooking Amsterdam.

Sam and Julia live here. If you (or your kids) understand the title, no more needs to be said. This is the home of the 'Mouse Mansion'. That aside, Amsterdam's bibliotheek is a lovely building housing an impressive collection of (largely) Dutch books. There is an excellent bistro on the top floor that has great views over the city, and an excellent range of food and drinks at very reasonable prices. Defintely one of Amsterdam's hidden gems.The library is a short walk (say 750m) from Amsterdam Centraal station. Turn left when you exit the station.
Another fine example. Cought on a rainy day... enough of the coffee shops & bordels?This is the best library i ever visited!

Great for young families. It's not surprising that a city that engineered canal systems turning flood lands into farm lands would have such an extensive public library. Free education, come on in. This is a beautiful and inspiring place that everyone, especially families with young children can enjoy. The downstairs floor is home to a great many whimsical features including the jacks lighting above, a tee pee, a large glass enclosed critter home, big stuffed chairs, some small tunnels to crawl through and lots of space for curling up and reading a book. Not much in English here so don't think you can go and read books to your kids unless you read Dutch.My five year old met a little Dutch girl here and they were instant friends of different languages. They couldn't speak the same words, but they did manage to get by on their different languages, making up for it with extra enthusiasm and body language. They ran around, crawled through the tee pee and tunnel and had a great time. This is one of the few places you can take your children in Amsterdam and not worry about them getting hurt. While walking the city streets, we were constantly holding them by the hand and telling them to watch out for bikes, trains, taxis, walkers. It's a busy city that requires a great deal of hovering over your young children. But in the library, you can relax, let them move around and play without being right on top of them. And afterwards there is a delicious cafe on the top floor. There were just a few gluten free options up there - but not in the form of bread. Mostly salads and soups. Otherwise, a wide variety of foods to choose from - all of it looked delicious.

Best views of the city. The best views of Amsterdam are from the top floor of this very modern library. I enjoyed the view and a coffee while sitting on the rooftop deck. Very clean bathrooms and if I could read dutch, would have spent more time but I was there for the view.

Great library. This building by dutch architect Jo Coenen is one of the best, if not the best libraries in Holland. I love spending time there from time to time.To really appreciate it you need to spend some time on several floors and don't forget the restaurant on top.
Large library, visit to take a look at the interior design :). Loved the interior of this big library. Near the central station, with a view over the water and surrounding architecture.

Spectacular. what a fabulous resource for any city to have. a state of the art library in a steel and glass building with spectacular views from the cafe on the top floor. only wish there'd been free wifi...

Great place!. I just love the library - tons of great and brand new magazines and news papers and free internet if you´re a member. Last time, I did not bring my laptop - as it was pooring with rain... and was somewhat disappointed that so many of the available computers were out of order.

Magnificent architecture for the People. I visited to experience the architecture and what I found was that I not only experienced it but it sucked me in. I ended up spending an entire morning perusing the stacks. The building is an example of what happens when good design, beautiful architecture and functionality merge. A gem of a building that invites inquiry and exploration. Not only a must-see for design and architecture buffs but a must see for anyone with a brain. This is a library that is truly a gift to the people of Amsterdam.

Tourist? Go for the view!. You might not want to go to the Amsterdam library to borrow books if you're a tourist, but its top floor is worth a visit anyway! Go for a coffee or a bite to eat and enjoy the view of Amsterdam - on a par with that from the Sky Lounge at the Doubletree, just down the road.
Great restaurant and city view. Great design and views of the old town and canal. Good food selection, good price breakfast than at the hotel

Leave your bad habits alone for a day; go to the library. Surprising to find this in downtown Amsterdam, considering A's reputation. Spend a few hours here; you won't regret. Staff are friendly & speak good English, as are/do most Netherlanders.

Nice setup, next gen meeting place for books and study. Extremely nice architecture and well brought to live. Nice design and open spaces. Good for some weekend reading, also there are some good areas for studying. In addition this is a nice venue to teach you (young) children about books and literature.
Excellent. Essential for anyone visiting the city. Amazing library and great views for the city both day and night

Coolest Library iv ever been to. Very cool library, intresting layout with quality facilities, if your passing it's definatly worth popping in just to have a quick look around...view from the cafe on the top floor is nice and lots of choice to eat

Not only books: great food and panorama. Close to the train station, tall building with amazing view from the last floor; nice restaurant at last floor... Many books! In the kids section there is a model of a Netherlands house with lot of details... You can watch it for hours to discover the different rooms and shops!

Seems like a good place to take a break. We visited the Library based on TripAdvisor reviews -- it really is a beautiful, extensive library, but I would advise skipping if you are on a limited schedule. It does, however seem like a great place to take a quiet break from the hustle and bustle, and there are lockers available and free toilets (Be careful, the stalls are enclosed but the rest of the bathroom can be seen from the outside)

Don't miss this library. This is a spectacular building. You will be walking around saying OMG--look at thisand OMG--look at thatMy family said they were not particularly interested in seeing a library so I left them behind. After I walked around every level of this fabulous building, I convinced them to just take a "5 minute look". And guess what--I could not get them to leave.The vast amount of material--books, magazines, CD's, computer research---and the way it is all displayed is really special. Do not miss this!!And FYI--it is open until midnight--so no excuses!

Awesome view, books and food. Great library with wonderful, cozy places for reading; great view of Amsterdam. Also the restaurant is wonderful with various food choices, as well as alcohols. Strongly recommended!

Fantastic. I worked here for 4 hours in a little pod on the first floor - awesome. Really great place, the design is wonderful. Man playing a piano in the entrance hall had me sold from the first. The view over Amsterdam is fantastic and the cafe on the top floor is good value - and has free wifi. You have to pay for wifi in the rest of the building though (unless you are a member).

coffee with a view. We went to the La Place cafe on the top floor. It is nice to have a place this high up with a view on the city so close to the central station.La place has good quality and fresh food and drinks in a self service restaurant here.But during winter the terrace is closed so it was harder to enjoy the view.
Great view for free. OK, it's a library, but the facilities are quite modern, and from the top floor you get a great view over Amsterdam for free !

Still a favorite!. I love spending the day here in this wonderful library. For as popular as it is, I hardly see any tourists here. They are probably at the museums. The seventh floor has an incredible view of the city outside on the patio. It is closed in Winter but you can still catch some glimpses from the windows. Healthy delicious food choices are available on the seventh floor where you can order noodles, soups, smoothies or salads. A great place fo enjoy healthy food.

Magnificent views from the top floor!. The library has been designed, build and decorated (for Dutch standards at least) according to a very new open space concept. At the same time it has many divisions/departments and the use of materials (wood, metal and glas) is interesting. Make sure to enjoy the STUNNING views of Amsterdam from the top floor terrace.

Nice library and travel respite. I was surprised at the top ranking of this site, but it turned out that I needed some study space on this trip, so I went. Robust internet access, but you do have to pay 2 EUR/hr if you're not a member. I didn't get a chance to sample it, but the music collection looked very impressive. The views were nice, as indicated, but not widely viewable by all the seats in the library; sounds like more of a feature of the cafe, which I did not partake.

The most beautiful library I've been. It was so cool seeing the beautiful library, and I think library can say a lot about a country. Do not miss the canteen style restaurant on the top floor, the food is AMAZING and price super reasonable! Even without the library, I would go there just for a great lunch!
Great cafe. Great cafe, great view, reasonably priced and good range of food and drinks available. Pleasant building with lots to see. Definitely one of Amsterdam's hidden treasures.

Wine on the top floor. The library is amazing!! Our 5 year old loved it!!! Books, fun áreas, and books in several languages. The views from the top floor and breathtaking, and you can look while drinking your wine!!!! Loved it!!

Worth a visit. We went here before getting our train for the airport as so close to the station. Spent some time on the top floor with its wonderful view over the city. The restaurant was excellent. What a wonderful facility this is for Amsterdam citizens.

Modern and very organized. Before going I was surprised all this positive comments on this place, but after visited there i say they deserves all praise and its near from central stationDownstairs is dedicated to kids and organized so beautifullyAnd the restaurant on the last floor with a great view

Worth the effort for food, view and a little peace/rest. We only managed to pop in for 30 mins whilst waiting for friends to arrive, but wished we'd come earlier for a meal. The top floor cafe does have a great view and is large and was peaceful at the time of our visit. The cafe looked excellent, even though we didn't have time to eat - significant displays of fresh fruit and veg, great juices and sandwiches, etc. Clearly they are trying to offer something decent. Worth a visit if you need a break from the busy streets of tram and bikes - especially on a clear day.
Great view. We made our way here after arriving in Amsterdam from the train station. Head to the top floor, great views of the city. Worth a visit and it's free!
Unexpected location. The library is worth a visit. Walk the stairs or take the elevator and find the restaurant on the top floor. Fine view and reasonable food.

Modern and still warm.. I went here with my little daughter, so first we checked -1 etage with children's books and it is very nice decorated, with huge animals etc...There were many people sitting with children and grand children, reading them books.On the first floor, close to the entrance, there is piano, so here and there someone sits and play.We took elevator on the top - 6th floor and have a walk to another floor higher, where the restaurant is, but note that from 1st of November, the terracce is closed, sothe view you can have just from inside of the restaurant.In ground floor, next to the entrance, there is nice and cheap self service restaurant.

Very good place to learn. I went to see the library. It's very large, it has 10 stages. There are many books. It's a lovely place to read a book quietly. There is a restaurant to eat when you get hungry.

Fantastic. What a fantastic resource! While our city(Miami) is closing its libraries-amesterdam shows us this--a stunning facility that has all the resources and all the media one could hope for, a phenomenal restaurant, a bar and the best view of amsterdam from the port. Visit at night-or for dinner-and read a book or attend a program-its a 2 minute walk from the Central station and should not be missed.
Birds eye view. Helpful staff, beautiful views from each floor. Unfortunately we were here in a really bad storm and power went off so we left.

Best Library Ever!. My husband and I went based on the reviews, and we thought it was great. Seven floors! There is a GREAT cafeteria/food court style restaurant on the top where they sold very healthy tasty dishes. Great view of Amsterdam from patio.

Amazing building but go the top floor to eat!. By chance after going to Nemo we went into the library. One of the recommendations is the view from the roof top. Nothing wildly exciting but we stumbled on a gem in terms of value in the restaurant on the top floor. Great choice, freshly cooked in front of you and good value. All the family had their choice of what to eat and were happy. Go there, its called La Place.

ABN Bank was the name, vijzelstraat amsterdam. This building is amazing an milistone in banking history, and now an Library but also you can find your family roots becouse down stairs their is the facebook for the past !

a really sociable library. As I strolled after dinner outside my hotel near the Central Station, I noticed a large, luminous building.. couldn't believe it was a library!Open until 10pm also on Sunday, spacious as a department store, coolly furnished. A wide selection of books in English and French. All can be borrowed also by foreigners, provided you've bought a card.. another thing quite unexpected for us Italians.Ground floor is for children and is really lovely: round bookshelves curl, creating islands of peace, bedecked with sofas and pc's.

Spend a rainy afternoon here and enjoy the view. This is where I take my 20 months old daughter for a rainy afternoon in the city. We can spend quite some time in the lovely children's area, with lots of stuff to do for the little ones - quite often reading sessions, live music and theatre on Sundays. We enjoy the visitors playing the piano and taking the elevator to the top floor where you can overlook Amsterdam. They have a nice cafetaria for coffee and lots of nice little corners, couches and hidden spaces where you can sit down and enjoy a book or a paper. Also some Macs available for websurfing.

Fantastic library. Well worth a look around, What a great place. Beautiful design and layout. There was a lovely sculpture exhibition when we went and also someone playing a piano on the ground floor which made a great atmosphere. Restaurant looked lovely altho we did not use it

Must see. Anyone visiting Amsterdam should see. Great collection of books and activities for kids on the basement floor. You can have a coffee or lunch at the top floor while enjoying excellent view of Amsterdam. Next door you can find Va Piano Restaurant. These is also a car park underneath the building.
Brand new library. Wonderful new modern library on five floors, the top being a café with views over the city, well worth a visit.
Nice place. Good to visit. Just a very fast walkaround. As a tourist, I could not find something better to do there, as most of stuff are in dutch. THe building is very nice, though.
Just a library. Okay, so it's a nice library, and if you go up to the top there's a nice cafe and some nice views out, Maybe I missed something

Impressive library, great view from the eatery.. Before we came to Amsterdam, I had read on tripadvisor that the use of the internet on the computers is free of charge, however this is not the case unless you are a member, otherwise you have to pay. There is an eatery on the top floor, which serves a variety of foods like salads, juices, stir fry, pizza and coffee etc. The view from the terrace is amazing and you can see pretty much the whole of Amsterdam. Worth a visit but disappointed by the false hope of free internet.
Awesome design. Great example of modern design and architecture. So glad I went to see it! They also had some interesting books and a large DVD section.

Poor little library, braindead rent-a-cops. This is just a poor little library with nothing going on for it. I'm from a mid size University town in the U.S. and this place isn't comparable to a real library. Not many books, not many people. Rent-a-cops not so smart, not so good at customer service. I have no use for this poor library or any of the creepy losers that work there. Not many readers and surely no one is learning anything at all.

See it!. If you like libraries, this is ghe place to go. The architechture is not that much of wow architecture but I liked the way in which the bookshelves had been made attractive with lights. Also, ecah floor has its own feeling although the style is more or less the same. On the 7th floor there is a restaurant which seemed to be very popular.
very pleasant place!. I would recommend this place to everyone. The library has everything to spend free time with pleasure.

Great find. We had been recommended by friends to visit and were so glad we had. The building is very modern but lots to see inside. There were some sculpture displays in the gallery and the view from the restaurant terrace is fantastic. We had breakfast in the restaurant cheapest and nicest we had all week.
Well worth a visit here.

Fabulous Community facility. It is light, open and has a vast range of English books and a delightful Cafe.
A wonderful facility near to Centraal Station

Absolutely. In many languages so do not stop yourself. Attractive building with its style. many books one can access as Holland encourages literature, art and studies. We sat down, were able to access Internet FREE and had a chance to browse some books, recommends if you like reading.
Great view. Go to the top of the building for an interesting view of Amsterdam. Food at restaurant looked good. Library contained some interesting art and other displays. Worth a visit on a wet day.

Excellent. It's perhaps a little odd to have a modern library as a major tourist attraction, but if any library deserves the accolade, then this is the one. The books are only half the story. Great architecture, excellent facilities and one of the best views over the city you can get.
Entry is free of course.

Must visit site!. This library is amazing. The interior is interesting and well designed and the top floor offers great view of this very low city (it's amazing what a great view you can get from just the 6th floor).
The la place coffee is decent and the food is nice. the Vapiano downstairs is a great Italian place.

one of the most beautiful buildings in Amsterdam. A must-visit for every visitor in the city.Firstly to admire the architecture of the building, secondly for having a coffee or a meal on the top, enjoying a view to the whole city. The library has great material, you can check it out and walk in the 6 floors.There is no fee to enter. It is near to Centraal Station and the Nemo museum, so you can combine with a visit to both of them.

good place to read. A good place to work from or read a book. I dislike the new wifi and no-kids-no-basement-access policies but what can I do. So I now recommend checking out the conservatory building next door which has lots of space to sit, rehearsals to sit in on and much cheaper coffee & food than the public library.
Great view of the city. You can go to the upper floor of the library and have great view of the city for free.There is also a great collection of music, but you need to pay in order to listen to it.

Brilliant library. Total 6 levels of books and cd/dvd of reference. Offer a good city view at 6th floor with a few sofa that you can sit down, relax, enjoying the scenic view and do some soul searching. 7th floor is a 'fast food' restaurant that offer a good variety of food with reasonable price.

A must visit for book lovers. This place is near the main station between the station and NEMO. A very nice building with a lot of books in multiple floors. There is a cafe on the top floor where you can sit with a view of the waters and its just amazingly beautiful. Its a must go place for book lovers.

highlight of my visit. This place is near the main train station an you should not miss it, nice building, modern interior and beautiful books :) I recommend to go in the morning and have a breakfast at the cafe on the roof of the library is a fantastic experience with beautiful views of the city.

Great view, great cafe. Popped in here to see the view as advised. It was a little grey so the view was ok but nothing special. But the library itself was gorgeous and worth a look just for it. There was some great interior design, an exhibition of art which was a bonus and the cafe on the top floor was reasonably priced for freshly cooked and delicious food.

Amsterdam Short Break. We wondered why the library was rated so highly in the TA listing, but its well worth a visit.The café on the top floor is very good and the view from the balcony well worth the trip.The whole building is an interesting example of modern architecture.

Fabulous, modern & wow factor. The Openbare bibliotheek or OBO as its' called is a modern and fabulous main library only minutes by foot from Amsterdam Central train station in the heart of the center of Amsterdam. There's modern furniture and places to just settle in for the day of research and views of the river from the top floors. Very modern and I'd recommend getting the Leenpas for people who live in Amsterdam and it allows internet access and renting books, videos and English language movies and music too. There’s a paid toilet on the first floor and also on the top floor where the restaurant “la Place” is located. Not your typical library and wide open spaces and modern furnishing... there was a piano player playing classical when I was there yesterday, so that was cool too. Bike parking out front of building.

Huge!. A great selection; I am often disappointed by the little selection of philosophy books in British libraries, they had 2 aisles worth here! It's a beautiful place to come and simply admire the views outside with a viewpoint on the top floor. Worth a visit.
Superb. Books, cd's, dvd's, computers, newspapers and magazines, a restaurant with a beautiful view. Places to study, read or rest.Last minute ticket outlet.Well done Amsterdam!

Must See. Upscale cafeteria on the seventh floor of the city library Openbare BibliotheekOosterdokskade 143Great views of the water; indoor & outdoor seatingSalads, sandwiches, pizza, desserts, coffeesReasonable prices, good food

Amazing. The biggest library I have ever been to. It has literally everything, very modern, the view from the top floor is amazing, it is very well decorated and all in all it just looks amazing and I would recommand everyone to go there!

Great building with small modern art collection also!. Great building with nice staff. Security let us leave our luggage with them as we had just got to town and it was to early to check in at our hotel. The library is only 4 blocks east to Central Train Station. A small collection of modern art sculptures is a great addition to a great building. It also has a very nice restaurant on the top floor so you can get a bite to eat and look out over the city.

Big Library right on the water. Big library, plenty of places to read and chill, et cetera. There is even a piano to play on the ground floor. And a restaurant at the very top of the library. Only drawback is having to pay to use the toilet.
yes the library. The interior is just plain a knockout. Someone even pl aged the piano while we were there. This is what a library should be.

Library with a view and food. Nice view of Amsterdam and the cafeteria on the 7th floor had a nice selection. We had fish cooked to order, fresh salad; made to order pizza is also available along with entrees and side dishes. Reasonably priced.

Great view and food on the top floor. I really like the layout of this library and its very modern.
But do not think its just a place with books, go to the top floor and eat at La Place and enjoy the view! It is very worth it!

A must to visit and have coffee and lunch!. A must to visit, the cafeteria at the top of the library gives you a great view over the city centre and with that you have an excellent choice for lunch. A very popular place. The building itself is also worth taking a tour, fantastic place.

Do not miss the Amsterdam Library!. Food and views on the top floor make this a needed stop on your trip. The actual library is also over the top with books, cd/DVD and art work.
It is by far one of the nicest libraries. Happy to recommend!
The nicest libary I know!. Just enjoy yourself reading books or having lunchor dinner @ the rooftop with an incredible view over amsterdam. The building is very modern.
La Place has fantastic food.. Do not miss this place if you are in the city. Thoroughly enjoyed the soups and salads. The view from the top floor of the library was fabulous.

Interesting Architecture & Wonderful Cafe. Wander through to see the modern architecture, lighting, and fun furniture in the library, and the famous "Mouse House" in the children's area. Sometimes the library has Special Exhibit that's worth checking out. The cafe on 7th floor is an outstanding eatery at reasonable prices. Views are nice too! (Free wifi).
Perfect lunch. Go to the top floor (7) and have lunch while looking out to the top of Amsterdam. The food is very good and reasonable prices
views of the city. take the lift to the top floor for a panoramic view of the city. have a coffee or lunch in the restaurant.
Modern. Modern building with art gallery and nice view from the top floor. If you like books you should go there.
Great view. Well worth the trip for a nice meal in the eatery on the top floor. One of the best views of Amsterdam.

worth seeing. Went here on my first day in Amsterdam for the view and for an easy meal at LaPlace. It is less than a 10 minute walk from Central Station. The building is interesting and filled with funky art and sculpture. The cafe on the top floor is accessible by escalator which gives you a view as you ascend. Would be a convenient stop off if you are walking from CS to the Scheepvart Museum.
Good view ,good lunch. Easy access to a great view of the city on the 7th floor from the restaurant. Buffet lunch, fresh salads and hot meals, good canteen food. Pigeons were annoying on the terrace.

Edutainment (education and entertainment) Lounge. When I still study, I can stay in this library to do my homework and assignment whole day. It is a perfect place. Now, every time I visit Amsterdam, exhausted from hectic crowd city walk and I want a quite spot to chill, I'll go to Central library :). If you are a tourist, you better go to this library - oh wait, library! Yes it is a library. A must visit destination because you can find anything you need including R&R on a fancy designer lounge couch. If, you want to read surely this is heaven, want a little doughy? head yourself to music section - it's universal music. Want to browse any information "be my guest", they have plenty iMac computers available for you to use or just connect to their wifi for free. Are you hungry? want to sip a coffee? Level 7 is serving plenty delicious food and beverage. For children, this is also a great entertainment place. Last month I took my 1 year old daughter there so she can play and read a book she wants in a toddler book section. She loves it!

Lovely library with great cafe. We are book lovers so have visited libraries in many cities. This facility is beautiful and the cafe/cafeteria on the top floor is very high class. The views from the deck area are not great due to the large concrete overhang, but it was pleasant to see the city.

Public service and Top 10 tourist attraction. The largest public library in Europe has free internet access for all, every magazine in circulation that week/month, music and movie pods and the odd book or two.Most impressive of all is its location with 7th floor La Place restaurant with your food cooked fresh in front of you. Enjoyed over a bottle of organic wine and one of the most impressive views over Amsterdam.A must on anyones trip to the city!

Amazing place. As the title of the review says, it is an amazing open library, even if you just visit it as a tourist without much time to enjoy what it offers you. Located near the Amsterdam Centraal, by the river, the building is beautiful and you will get overwhelmed by the number of floors filled with books and media. Funny thing was, we weren't even planning on visiting, we just stumbled on it and went in. Definitely worth it.

Great View of the City. The library is near the Centraal Station next to the Hilton Double Tree. We just went into the library to check out the view from the top floor. And it was really nice. The Restaurant is also really nice and stylish. I was quit surprised by it. I can only recommend going up to the top floor to enjoy the view and drink a smoothie. Same view but alot cheaper than the Hilton. :-)
amazing views. great views! nice food and beautiful and interesting building. There was someone playing piano in the lobby which created a special atmosphere.

Awesome public library. I went to have a lunch at the last floor. It has a beautifull terrace, the only problem were the pidgeons. The library has a loot of books and even music and movies. The kid's sector is very interactive and full of itneresting books.

This is what a modern library looks like.. In an age of budget cuts and library closures, this beautiful building houses the gold standard of what every community should aspire to provide its current and future generations. Floor after floor and stack after stack of books, media, and recreation, all housed in gorgeously clean lines and peppered with wonderfully whimsical pieces of art. When you reach the top floor, spent from the dizzying amount of information and entertainment on offer, you find a stunning altar upon which you can celebrate the city forward enough to provide a home to this magnificence. The terrace overlooking Amsterdam provides such far-reaching views that, on a crisp, sunny day, you feel you must be looking at a mural. The pictures can't do it justice. Out of a fantastic trip to Amsterdam, this was, hands-down, my favourite location. I wish I'd known I should have planned a full day here; it would have been so easy to get lost in the stacks, or even just in the beautiful view.

A Bibliophile's Dream. I cannot say enough good things about this library. I was stunned at it's contemporary architecture, clean lines, beautiful open spaces, thoughtful layout, and a media floor to beat any media collection I've ever seen. The art collection spread throughout the library was a nice touch.My only regret was not spending enough time wandering and exploring the stacks. This is a MUST for any book lover or architecture aficionado.*see my review of the 7th floor café.

Lovely views, great food. Had seen reviews for the library and decided to go for lunch on the top floor. Lots of interesting sculptures on the way up, would love a library like this near me. La Place on the top floor offers a wide range of food at reasonable prices. Some food s self service and others you order and wait for. Take the time to read all the boards before choosing what you want.

Great food with a great view.. On the highest floor of the public library there is a self service restaurant from the la place group with nice food for a little price. The view over amsterdam is great and it has great capacity for a lot of customers. Lying near the central station it is easy to get there by public transport. It has the same opening hours as the librrary so keep that in mind.

Rooftop view of the city. If you make it to the public library (near Central station), go to the 7th floor for a rooftop view of Amsterdam. There is a delicious looking cafe there too (we didn't try the food but it smelled great!). The library is also quite modern and sleek looking. A nice, off-the-beaten path side trip!
accidental visitor. stumbled acroos this building by accident - lovely modern building with a nice cafe right on the waterfront - perfect place to kill an hour or two

Astonishing View. It was worth going to, and going to the top floor to look out over Amsterdam. It is right on the water [not too difficult considering where it is!) with a wonderful view of the harbor and the city.

Brilliant way to spend an afternoon. We went to the library on a rainy morning - it's only a 5 minute walk from Centraal station and opposite the floating Chinese restaurant called "Sea Palace". The library is beautifully modern, we spent a good half hour on the 1st floor which had music - we went on the Macs with headphones and used their amazing music database - every song and artist you could possibly imagine is on it. It's in Dutch however the words for artist / song / pop / metal / rock etc are very similar to English so you'll be able to make a good stab at it!We went upstairs and seen the wonderful views, but didn't eat in La Place, having ate at another branch of it earlier! Would recommend a visit.
Awesome View of the City. The library has a wonderful view of the city. A food venue is also located on the top floor near the outlook of the city. Very beautiful Library.

Be sure to go all the way to the top. My husband and I had heard often about how beautiful the library is, and being bookworms ourselves, we were excited to see it. It didn't disappoint, either. There is a restaurant on the top floor, where you can get everything from a piece of cake to a full meal, and the burgers are delicious (I do wish they had cheese available for them, though - I'd even pay extra for it). There is an outside seating area which we tried to use, but it was so windy out there that we had to give up and come back inside. If you're lucky enough to live in Amsterdam, this is an excellent venue - there are artsy offerings going on all year long, and of course there are the numerous resources of the library itself. Well worth making it a part of your regular routine.

Enjoy lunch and a good view!. Walking distance from the Central Station, the library is an interesting modern building looking over towards the old town. You can't borrow books if you're non-resident but go to the top floor and have a light lunch enjoying the view. The green ship hull shape of the science museum NEMO is just a short walk away across a foot bridge

Added bonus of great views from top floor. The location of this modern build is most impressive, one of a group of attractive architecture overlooking the IJ. Inside it is fabulous. We took the escalators to the top sixth floor, alighting at each one for a browse. The first floor has a vast collection of DVDs, covering every genre. Another is devoted to travel and history. The top floor has a café where we had a cappuccino and light snack, taken out to the terrace. There are fabulous views of the surrounding city, all for free. The sun was shining with a clear blue sky, adding to the panoramic vistas.

Nice library!. This is a super library as far as libraries go, but not worth the #2 place on TripAdvisor! We enjoyed it - the view is nice and La Place a pretty good café, good but not spectacular (there are many of them, in V&D department stores across the country). But there are so many wonderful museums to see and neighborhoods to wander in in Amsterdam - so don't go here above other attractions just because you see the nice rating. It's good for what it is and that's that.

Great view. A very attractive Library with nice artwork and design. The best thing about this place is the view from La Place, an eatery on the top floor. It's not too great for picture taking because of the low roof and protective plexiglass.

Gorgeous new library, must see in Amsterdam. Went with my 2 daughters who loved it. Lots of space, free wifi (if you sign up for a card) HUGE children's area. Great theater for kids under the stairs. Shame that non of the computers worked. Would like to see more activities for kiddies. Open until 10pm EVERY NIGHT which is crazy awesome for Holland.

Views and thrills. I heard someone said in the Rijks library: "wow, lots of books!" Well, the bibliotheek has even more books! The building is located about 5 minutes from the Central Station. Don't be tempted by the many cafes along the quay, since the library offers several food outlets, the best being La Place at the top. Here, one can get several types of food, self-service, then choose either comfy seats indoor or outdoor seating with a panoramic view of Amsterdam. There are events at the library, such as film showing. Check those out. Ask any library assistant for information. If you have children, this is a good place to introduce them to the world of culture - books, multimedia exhibitions, views, and good eats!

Wonderful place to visit. Great library in the heart of Amsterdam Centraal. Easily accessible by tram, bike or even car. Ask about the English or foreigners section if Dutch is not your native language.

Place for a concert. Belief it or not: every year in August there is a free open air concert on the Canal with hundreds of listeners on the boards of the canal and in little boats on the water. The Queen of nowadays the King attends this concert. But also without the concert this is a beautiful canal with lots of houses and buildings from the 17th century (The Dutch Golden Age). Stroll along the canal or make a boattrip through the canals of the city.

Excellent library lunch!. We ate lunch on the roofdeck of the central library. The views were amazing and the food was very good. They have a cafeteria-style set up with a salad bar as well as hot food options made to order.

Relaxing hang out. Conveniently located right near Central Station, this gorgeous building is home to Amsterdam's library. It was a hot and humid 30 degrees the day we went, it was just lovely to walk inside this massive building after being outside in the hot sun all day and a bonus was that we were greated by two friendly staff members. After reading reviews of the spectacular view and the cafeteria on the top floor this place was on our list of things to see. Definitely lived up to the positive reviews, we enjoyed relaxing outside, sipping coffee and taking in the views. Entry is free which is an added plus. Highly recommend.
Fantastisch facility. Great space; nice to have La Place (?) cafe on the 7th floor. Good place to go to read the papers, too - and very easy to withdraw books, DVDs etc
Sculptures are ok. They have one room upstairs of sculptures so I would only recommend visiting if you happen to walk past it. Not really worth a visit

An interesting place!. Our Marco Polo Amsterdam attractions guide highlighted this place for a visit, and also mentioned the view from the restaurant at the top. Since we were practically walking past, we stopped in for lunch. Very interesting to see all the very modern pieces of art on the way up to the 7th floor and the whole way in which the place was set out. Restaurant at the top was well worth the visit! Great food (the banana yoghurt smoothies were to die for!) and a lovely view of the city of Amsterdam over lunch!

Wonderful place!. Loved everything, especially the fact that they had a really cool art exhibition on, and that people (of skill) could just sit down and play the piano in the foyer. Great selection of movies and music, wish I lived in Amsterdam!

Ultra modern!. I wish the libraries in Scotland were more like this one! I might have actually used them more at Uni had they've been.The cafe on the top floor is amazing, and the views are incredible. Really cool building, even though I'm not a big fan of modern architecture, but this one is pretty amazing!
Interesting. Not a free, public Library. Subscription to use materials. Great view of inner harbor from roof.Very modern building and collection

Architecture, Food and view. Great architecture, the inside space is a dream space, my idea of the perfect library. Shame i'm not dutch and don't live in Amsterdam!The restaurant at the top is nice and kind of cheap (for Amsterdam). the view from the last 2 floors is great.Overall this is a great place to spend an hour or two to take a break from the hustle of the city.

Great view from the restaurant on top!. It is right on the water, and has a fabulous view of Amsterdam and Nemo, the science building...the sandwiches are okay, not great, but they offer wine, salads, etc. Anyway, you're there for the view and the photographs that explain what you are seeing!
Good variety & quality of food. Restaurant on 7th floor. Great view of the city & very good cafeteria style food. Reasonable prices, good food, great view, what more could ask for.

For architecture and design lovers. The library is often recommended for its fabulous views of Amsterdam and it is true that the view from each floor is spectacular, especially from the top. But the building itself is a gorgeous example of contemporary minimalist architecture and the interiors are striking. You can take an escalator, stopping at each floor to walk around and peer out the windows. The top floor holds a cafeteria but that name hardly does justice to the establishment. You will find there a brilliantly colorful spread of fresh produce, salads, soups, sandwiches, stir-fries made to order, pastries, and many other delicious options. We greatly enjoyed the reasonably priced lunch we had there.

What in the world....?. Could not understand why a library was ranked in the top 5 things to do in Amsterdam....but had to find out. Quite nice actually. Very modern architecture, and probably the brightest library I've been in. We happened upon the music floor and there was live music toward the front, playing for a radio station. We sat for a while and listened...very eclectic and very nice. We ventured to the top floor for the views, which I'm sure would have been fantastic if it hadn't been overcast.I would recommend it, and while I wouldn't place it in the top 5, probably the top 10!

Great View. A few minutes walk from The Central Station (turn left when leaving the station) is the very big Public Library. If your not there to read then head for the top floor cafeteria which has an open terrace overlooking the City. Mind the pigeons though.

How is this one of Amsterdam's top attractions??. Amsterdam is an amazing city I'm very surprised to see the library as one if it's top attractions. Yes, there is a good view from the cafe terrace but that's about it. It reminded me of a nice university library and certainly nothing remarkable. We had lunch at the cafe, good food but from a chain cafe so again nothing special. And after spending 15 Euros on lunch I then had to pay to use the toilet which I felt was particularly cheeky. There are so many other exciting things to see and do in Amsterdam. Don't go out of your way to see this one.

good for people who forget to take their laptop...... lots of computers for silly people like me who don't have smartphones and forget their little laptops. the library also has a great cafe and a good view of the water

First things you do when you get to Amsterdam... LIBRARY! *nerd snort*. Just east of Amsterdam Centraal Station stands the most awe-inspiring Bibliotheek I have ever seen. Books are in English, Dutch and other languages, a vast array of DVDs including an extensive queer section, a whole floor or CDs, another floor of every magazine genre you could think of, a recording studio, a museum, and a restaurant on the 7th floor.They have comfy chairs facing the windows so you can chill out, read all day and occasionally look up at the rain falling outside, or work stations including desks and computer areas to use the internet with token-operated printers (there is a little machine where you exchange $ for tokens). The tenth floor (top) boasts a panoramic view of Amsterdam, with delightful little cafes serving snacks, meals, fruit, dessert, smoothies, cookies and so much more. Really comfy plush booth style chairs with warm lighting. You can take books up there to read if you want.Open 7 days - 10am til 10pm.I love this place, I spent the whole day there, then went back a second day.Plenty of space to park your bicycle.
Quick visit. Quick little visit to the library as we were walking by. We went saw the quick view from the 7th floor and left. There appeared to be a nice looking cafe on that floor and free wifi.
Nice panoramic view from the seventh flor. Nice panoramic view from the seventh floor on this beautifull but flat city. nice restaurant. good price of the meal

Beautiful modern building. Beautifull building with easy access. Can take pics from 7th floor. There is also a reasonable and very tasty cafeteria on this floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
Modern library worth a visit. Easy walk from the Centrale rail station. Fascinating architecture, user-friendly library. Various exhibits.

Better than all the rest...simply the best. Even though I don't read Dutch I feel at home In this 7 floor media emporium. It is the Harrods of the library game and also has free WiFi and great views from the 7th floor cafe/terrace. Lots of non Dutch materials available to use and borrow.

Great View of the City. Go to the 7th Floor - you will be overlooking the city and the harbor - great photos. Also, the restaurant on the 7th floor of the library serves delicious fresh food at extremely reasonable prices.

Everyone to the Rooftop!!. The building itself is impressive, but what we were really interested in was the view from the top floor!
The sweeping views of Amsterdam are amazing from this top level and there is a reasonably priced casual restaurant there as well. So anything from a drink to a meal is catered for.
Best thing of all.....it's free!!!

Fascinating place !. Would that we had a library like this where I live !! Modern architecture. Great self-serve cafeteria on top floor with outdoor terrace dining for views of the old harbour of Amsterdam. Ideal for lunch, a coffee break, afternoon tea. Food very good and reasonably priced. Won't break the bank!!

Coolest library!. Have brought a few friends to this fantastic library when they visit me in Amsterdam and it never fails to get ooohs and ahhhs...Check out the "Mouse house" at the children's section. And have a cup of coffee at the rooftop with an great view of the city.

An amazing place to relax, have some food and enjoy culture!. The OBA (Openbare Bibliotheek amsterdam) it's located fews minutes away from central station. 7 floors of books, CDs, movies and much much more. The OBA is accessible for free by EVERYONE, you don;t need a registration to walk around, to use one of the several PCs that are in there, to enjoy the view from the bar/restaurant at the 7th floor or the music that, sometimes, someone is playing on the piano at the first floor.It's perfect if you are alone and have some free time to relax, it's perfect if you need internet connection and you don't want to pay or go to one of the awful internet point, it's perfect if you are with your kids since there's an entire floor dedicated to the kids with books and games... It's perfect for everyone, i totally loved it!
Cafeteria!. Try the cafeteria on the top floor. Great prices and good food. Library is worth a visit - lots of internet stations
Mouse house and great top floor cafe. We visited to see the mouse house which was great, especially for children . Had a great dinner on top floor with lovely views over the water

Beautiful, modern facility!. Great view over the Amstel. We had a great meal here - one of the best in Amsterdam. The Asian-looking cook was very surly but we enjoyed looking around the place. There is an attractive desk made of cardboard box sheets over at the Music section - sustainable effort - very good!

Great library, ok restaurant. This is a really great library, but, despite what I had read, the restaurant was just ok. It's kind of a station-concept restaurant, with different lines for grill, stir-fry, pizza, etc. There are no directions to explain exactly how it works and the cooking staff were surly and/or busy. I didn't find that there was a lot of selection... pizza, stir-fry, hamburger, soup (sold out when we were there) and it looks like usually a fish dish and a dish of the day (a curry the day I was there). The outdoor seating area is lovely in concept, but I conclude Amsterdam doesn't have much of a skyline, given the flatness and low buildings. The library itself is pretty inspirational in both design and contents. My kids loved the teepee in the kid area, the Mouse House of miniatures (at least 8 feet tall), and the gorgeous curving, nook-like shelves.

Best library in the world?. I could live here. Every floor was a new vista of delight--music listening stations! Books in foreign languages! The wall of magazines and journals with lounge chairs! DO NOT MISS the Muizenhuis in the Children's Department downstairs, and be sure and to up to the top floor to the observation deck. The enormous cafeteria is great. AND there is Wi-Fi!
Amazing library, great views over Amsterdam. You don't need to speak Dutch to enjoy this library. There is a lot to see, from books, videos, cd's, but also the view and a good restaurant on the top.

Worth a visit. We visited after several days touring Amsterdam for something different to the canals and museums. It's a lovely airy space with a piano on the ground floor which you can play if you are of a certain standard. When we were there the pianist was very good indeed and his music added to our general enjoyment. All the national newspapers and magazines are available to read and there are several cafes. Unfortunately wifi is only available at a charge.

Must visit. Do lunch.. Seriously! Wind your way to the top floor of this ultra-modern, wonderfully designed library and eat at the wonderful restaurant up there. You pick whatever you want at the kitchen and they will prepare it to your specifications. Prices are very reasonable and there is a lot to choose from. On warm days, sit out on the patio for a wonderful view of Amsterdam.
A little light reading!. This free public library is beautifully laid out over several storeys which all look over the river. Apparently it cost €100 million, but WOW!, what a library.

Lovely!. I absolutely loved the layout and design of this library. This feels like a place where I can spend my entire day in as everything is so well laid out and the architecture is simple but elegant!
Great Library. Nice, modern and neat. Good city view from the top floor. The library itself is very well-organised. It's worth to visit for sure.

Spectacular Facility.. have to see it to believe it.. Simply beautiful. Great observation deck on top floor. Great cafe. Really fun to walk through this awesome building that you'd expect to only see in architectural magazines.

interesting library. What a great library. There are so many books, CD/DVD, and movies. You can hear lots of music using their terminals for free. very friendly securities. fantastic view of the harbor. Free small locker in its basement. The toilet costs 0.2 Eur and is clean. Something you can hear live piano show.

great place to work & chill. great place to explore and chill. good alternative to reading/working from starbucks. mind - on weekends it can be packed, so if you arrive too late, it may be hard to find a place to sit!

If only we have such a library in my country. After reading the numerous fantastic reviews on Tripadvisor, I made it a point to visit here for my Amsterdam trip.The cafe was fantastic, a great place to relax & chill out, enjoying the scenic view of Amsterdam. It was a pity we couldn't seat outdoors due to the annoying pigeon that kept hopping around, unfazed by humans.Food was pretty decent for the prices. Had a quick tour of the place & the library is HUGE.
The place you would love to read. Exceptional design, cheap internet (1 euro per 1/2 hour) and printing and a great view of the city.The cafe/restorant on the last floor has free wifi access.
love it. great place. it's a plasure stay into it. a place where you can lear and relax and beautiful to see and very very well organized

Big Library. One if the nicest libraries I've ever seen. Each floor is dedicated to a different field, with the basement being a children's library, and one floor filled completely with DVDs and CDs. The food court 'La Place' on the top floor is reasonable, and the best thing is that they have a terrace which allows you amazing views of Amsterdam for free!
cheap internet. When our laptop broke down, this was a great place to use cheap internet. Only a few euros per hour.

Cool children's department. The new Library has a special section for kids, with round shelves, colorful decoration, seating/reading spots and crawl space. There's also a café inside and a nice restaurant on the outside

It is one place "must go". The Central Library is a fantastic building with a very modern architecture. In the seventh floor there is a nice self service restaurant (La Place) but where you can have a fantastic view from Amsterdam from its terrace. Try not to get the elevator, so you can see everything is each floor. The library has all the technological resources that one can imagine. The CD collection is impressive. Go - at least for the view!
amazing view. the central library is situated near central station . on the top floor you have a great view over Amsterdam. Great lunches, good prices!

A place you do not want to miss!. My husband and I LOVE libraries and we have been to many great libraries, including New York City Public Library and Chicago Central Public Library. When we walked into this library, we were like, WOW!!! This is the best library we have ever visited! Every section is clearly marked, they have a great collection of books in English, the children section is playful and cheerful, they also have a nice little gallery and a wonderful cafe on the top floor. You can see the city of Amsterdam on their rooftop. Do no miss this place if you have time. It is only a few minutes walk from the NEMO museum.

Outstanding Library plus View Terrace. This is probably the most technologically-advanced library that I have ever seen. There is plenty of light and space on each floor, and ample computers for everyone. On the Terrace Level there is a cafeteria (operated by local restaurateur le Place) which includes beer and wine with a variety of foods and great view.
Great view. One of the best views over Amsterdam! Wait for the winter sunset with a hot chocolate on the top floor!!
Great Place for seeing all of Amsterdam (Photo). The Library was very well layed out and functional for foreign turoist as we were. The view is well worth the visit.
Super-cool library!. It's really neat to walk through this completely new library. There's tons of seating and snack bars and all sorts of awesomeness.

Fantastic library & restaurant. This is well worth a visit. Go to the 7th floor and there is an amazing restaurant along with a great view of Amsterdam. Restaurant has all different kinds of areas and is not overly expensive. Great place for lunch. Just down the way from Central Station.
Insider tip.. We were told to take the lift to the top floor there is a good café there very reasonable and it has a terrace which looks out across the harbour and the City.

Great place to visit and what a view from the top floor restaurant!. This is what a library should be. It's worth a visit if you are in the area. On the 6th floor there is a staffed travel information office with info on all areas of Europe.

lovely view. came here because hoped to see a good view of the city and was not disappointed. The view of the inner harbor and older parts of the city is great, but somewhat limited by narrow opening on the outdoor balcony and by the windows. Only could locate view looking toward city, not the other way toward sea and harbor. The outside of the building has a popular IAMSTERDAM sign for photo ops. The library sits between the central train station and the NEMO or science museum. The library itself is very nice and modern, but use of its internet is limited for nonmembers such as a typical tourist. You can buy a ticket to use it for a limited time. Terminals are available. The receipt from the Cafe says there is free internet, but my phone could join in but not use the wireless so I found it not worth fooling with. The library has restrooms which cost .20 euro cents. Recommend checking it out for the view if you are in the area, especially if you think you might enjoy a coffee, drink or a meal at the library cafe on the top floor.

Beautiful architecture and great views of the city. Whilst it might be a little out of central (hardly), the library is definitely worth a look.The architecture is very pleasing on the inside, and the views of the city from the upper level are equally as good.I only wish I had a library as good back home.

Nice architecture and a good viewpoint. The library is located a short distance from Centraal Station, and is worth checking out. It can also serve as a good place to rest for a while if weather changes for the worse. The top floor of the library features a good viewpoint of the city, just pick one of the many comfy seating areas and enjoy. The library itself is also worthy of your attention, with it's modern architecture and interesting sections. The library was constructed in 2007 and is the largest public library in all of Europe. All in all, for a beautiful free attraction so close to central station, it's a shame to miss. allocate about 30 min. of your schedule to visit the Bibliotheek.
Great Library. This library is very big.It has all kinds of books and it has an excellent view.Although most of the books are Dutch and there are some in English.
very peaceful and inspiring. interesting architecture, very light and spacious, nice cafeteria at the top floor and great view of the city, just a few minutes walk fro the Central Station
Great Rooftop Cafe for City Views. Only ten minutes walk from the Central Station. We went twice to eat/drink at the rooftop cafe. Really worth a visit. Child friendly too.

Mich133. Visited here after reading reviews. It was a delight, with a light & airy feel to the whole place with excellent areas for quiet reading or studying. The childrens area was fun with lovely models and great seating areas. There were beautiful views of the city and the restaurant at the top was brilliant value with a huge choice of food from soups/salads to stir fried meals. There was also an amazing array of smoothies and cookies and cakes

Viewpoint. Great location from which to get an elevated view of the area. Central location make this easy to get to. Very clean and tidy inside with free toilets if required!Free to enter and worth stopping by.

If you like libraries.... Amsterdam's Central Library is the largest public library building in Europe, and it's full of surprises. The restaurant on the top floor is a great place for lunch (and there's a wonderful view from the terrace).

Best Lunch in town!. Unexpectedly found ourselves at the library after a very helpful guy in the Apple store, advised us to stop by for lunch........ so glad we did... the library itself is worth a visit but the lunch on the top floor with fabulous view and perfect multi choice fresh cooked/ help yourself salad restaurant.... was one of the highlights of our trip.

Fantastic modern library. Anyone visiting Amsterdam should definitely check this out. The view of the city from the top floor restaurant is breathtaking and worth visiting for that alone ( and totally free! ) - There is an outdoor viewing area, so perfect for some photos.The library itself is amazing, the largest multimedia section I have ever seen!
Beautiful selection of food. Really worth a stop off on your touring of Amsterdam. The library itself is very beautiful to look at, but the food and view from the cafe is spectacular!
Great city view and wonderful architecture. Balcony to view city only open summer months. Great use of space and comfortable seating to rest weary feet. One of the loveliest libraries anywhere.

Excellent. Fabulous location, fabulous building, fabulous views both from the front, and the cafe terrace on the 7th floor. We were there on a cold clear day and you could see for miles. Cafe was great, huge (I mean really huge) portions, cooked in front of you and massive variety. Would definitely go back

Fabulous venue and great facilities.. Well worth a visit for the architecture, facilities, views and coffee shops etc. Oh, and the books! I visited on a cold, winter's day, but it would be even more amazing when the sun shines...

tasty lunches in a quiet zone. We were recommended to try the café by the Maitre de of our hotel (Barbazon Palace) as we wanted somewhere that served a light lunch. It is 5 minutes walk from the station and served amazing lunches. It is all self service but with friendly staff on hand. The courgette with salmon soup was delicious as were the various salads of roasted vegetables and a good choice of sandwiches made with wonderful bread. Lots of choices if you want a healthy well priced lunch but go early (just before 12) as it soon gets busy with office workers and seems to be a popular business meeting place. The tables are communal and the views, if you venture onto the open area, are panoramic as it is on 7th floor.

Wish all libraries were this good. A wonderful space. The collection looks wide and deep. Very impressed with the music and media section. Enjoyed the small exhibitions throughout the building including the sock mosaic.La Place was a fantastic place to stop and eat in Amsterdam. The views over Amsterdam during day and at night are great. The food is reasonably priced, very fresh and wonderfully cooked. The cake counter was a feast for the eyes and stomach. Like others, the queues were somewhat confusing. Make a point of trying this place when in Amsterdam.

Huge impressive library. We went to this library on our way to central station (only about 5 mins away). It is very impressive, clean and well layed out. There is a large cafe/restaurant on the top floor where you can see lovely views over the city. It's worthwhile stopping by sometime during your visit to Amsterdam

What a great place. What a lovely modern building. We went here for the food, lots of good quality food at one of the best prices you'll find in Amsterdam , we had cooked to order pizza as good as any Italian, yummy cake, fresh salad bar, fresh squeezed orange juice.. Also soup,cooked in front of you noodle bar,sandwiches also available. Great roof terrace views and children's section with English language books in the lower libary area, if you have kids take them for a look on a wet day and wonder why we don't have library's like this in England.

Large collection of books. Floors and floors of books and a nice view from the top floor which has a restaurant. Plenty of English books as well for those who need it and open till 22:00 on most days. A good place to spend time when one has nothing to do on a cold chilly evening.

Sitting reading with such a lovely view across Amsterdam - heaven. I spent a lovely day here - just relaxing - reading different books and looking across Amsterdam. I was on the 5th floor mostly and it was heaven to me having this wonderful view to look at while pondering over what I was reading.I am learning Dutch and there were quite a few books to help with that, and also a massive range of magazines.Also, as you would imagine, lots of English books - I found a couple of cracking old maths books and there were some good modern ones too.There is something about Dutchness that I love, and this library had it too - just the atmosphere of people doing different things - and the space for people to do different things with lots of different seating styles and layouts did it for me.Also loved the wailing wall of lost socks!!!Didn't have any food but it looked delish! V.v.v. fresh and lots of choice.
Oasis. books, journals, free access every day till late in the evening, free internet, coffee, amazing view over amsterdam, liberal space

Food great, but the rest is boring.. I'm amazed that this modern library gets such great reviews. It is pretty much boring until you get to the food on the top floor. The children's section looked good but I'm way off being qualified to judge that. They do have a good selection of international newspapers however.If Ikea did libraries this would be their catalogue offering. Unless you want the food and the good views from the open balcony then I advise you give it a miss.

Good cafe with view. Visited on the recommendation of a work colleague.
Great self service cafe on the top floor.
Different stations where chefs cook your pizza or curry especially for you.
Great view over Amsterdam, although terrace wasn't yet open.

A must in Amsterdam. What a beautiful library particularly the children section. They have a wall decorated with socks upstairs. Very impressive. On the 7th floor they have a self service restaurant La Place serving very good food with good view. Must try their breakfast. You just choose 7 items from the breakfast selection and with a small coffee only cost 4.30 euro. Open from 10 to 10 in the evening.

Beautiful. I am so shocked about how great this place is. It is beautiful, clean, has amazing views and is a place for everyone to find something of their interest. It is in a great location, the children's section is great for them (specially the mouse house). I loved this library... I wish they were like this back home... Maybe more people would be encouraged to actually go to the library.
Extraordinary atmosphere.. I always come here to read, study, and prepare for meetings and presentations. I just love the atmosphere, the architecture and the design of the interiors.

Who Knew?. I've been to Amsterdam many times, but this was my first time here. What a treat! A beautiful building. Great food. Away from the hustle and bustle. Half price tickets are available to cultural attractions. I bought tickets to the Philharmonic for the same day.

I never thought I'd be jealous over a library!. When I saw that the #3 attraction in Amsterdam was the Library I was quite confused, but it's actually amazing! It's open until 10 and is a great chilled out place to watch the city. It's also nice to go somewhere that's free!
Great place!. Great place to spend a grey and cold afternoon in Amsterdam. I was very surprised by the music and art floor, lots of CDs and DVDs! Delicious smoothies and teas on the last floor!

Worth a visit. It is very central, easy to reach by walk or bike. And on the upper floor you have the chance to eat good food for a cheap prize and with an amazing view. And it is far more stylish than the libraries in Germany.

Very nice view over Amsterdam. A very nice and free view over the city of Amsterdam. On the 5th floor there is a self service restaurant with good quality food for a sensible price. There is a selection of English books as well, so if you have some extra time and the weather is not great, the central library is a good place to relax.
Library and much more. Loved this cultural space and the restaurant was absolutely fantastic.Freshly cooked food at unbelievably low price.A must!
Wonderful new library!. A wonderful space and a couple of nice places for a meal! No wonderf that this has become a very popular place to visit in Amsterdam!

Brilliant for book lovers!. I spent a few months in Amsterdam for work and frequently visited this Library. It is unlike most library's; light, bright, wonderful building.It has excellent facilities, internet, a wonderful newspaper and magazine reading room. On the top floor is a great restaurant with views of over the city. I spent many a rainy weekend afternoons in the building.A MUST for book/architecture lovers, even if you are on a short trip to Amsterdam.

Mouse Mansion display. I went to the Library to visit the Mouse Mansion (Hel Muizenhuis) constructed by Hagar. The Library is well worth a visit while in Amsterdam. It is absolutely stunning! This Library should be listed as a place to visit for a number of reasons including enjoying a lovely lunch and taking in the view of the city. (And, the Mouse Mansion is delightful.)

very good. Great and modern facilities, cafe-restaurant on the top of the building with a nice panoramic view of Amsterdam. In spring and summer, you can go outside to a balcony and have your coffee there and take some really nice pictures. Worth visiting,
Lunch. Worth the walk to see the building, there was a concert in the entrance lobby and the café great value

It's amazing =O. We went to the public library that lies next to the central station and away from all crowds. I really have to say it is an amazing library! I have never seen a library so big and so modern and luxury like this in my whole life. It's defenitely worth seeing it. In the entrance hall there's even a piano for people who are skilled to play on it for 30 minutes. And thne you can go take a walk around and there is also some art exhibited in the library so it's also a little museum tour. The best thing: It's for free :) Probably one of the little things that are for free in Amsterdam.
Go for the free view. This was a short walk from the centraal station. The library itself was nothing exciting but the view from the top floors was great. There was also a restaurant up top.

the future of libraries. the internet may take over (a lot of) the functions of a library, so a library has to evolve. go take a look at the Amsterdam Openbare Bibliotheek. A meeting place, a wifi place, a seminar place, a place for reflection, a place for research, a restaurant, …… At 7000 visitiors a day (I think) it certainly has become a work-play-cultural hub in the city.
Nice high tech library.. Nice high tech library. Worth a visit ........ however dont expect much....... the view from the 6th foor is just spectacular !!!!

Top floor provides excellent view of Amsterdam. A beautiful modern library with a La Place restaurant at the top. You can go enjoy a lemonade on the top floor as you sit in the terrace which overlooks Amsterdam.

Closed for the winter. Probably great view from the last floor, but it is closed for the winter, don`t understand why. It's beautiful inside, but I don`t think you should go just to see inside the library...

Great facility, great collection. I love this place. The modern structure is amazing, has great collection of books and multimedia, a lot of space for studying or working with your laptops, also provides public internet stations.Random people playing the piano in the lobby level, interesting for a library!If you are hungry in the middle of your studying/reading time, an Italian cafe, Vapiano, provides good food and snacks.

Lovely. This place is huge! We went to check it out on a short trip to Amsterdam and glad we did! On the top floor is the cafe with amazing views and a balcony (it was closed due to the weather but it would have been good to go out and see more). The is loads to check out and I don't think you will be disappointed. We weren't and we didn't just go to read.
Superb. Beautiful design, incredible automated lending process, loads of space to work, wireless internet, dvds and music... what's not to like?

Fun place to do some reading up. on the top floor you have an outside balcony where you can enjoy a great view over the harbour. Lot's of cosy places inside to do some reading up on a great selection of books. Upstairs you can have something to drink and eat in the Laplace restaurant. Free internet is also available

Best photo's ever. The OBA has a terrace with a real view, come here to make your best photo's of Amsterdam. The library is a very special building , with great sofa's, and a piano, that you can play for free, if you feel like it, your own private concert for all the visitors in Amsterdam. How cool is that. On the top floor there is a organic food restaurant with a salad bar, great chicken, and all kind of juices... water for free. Top location, top food, top architecture... you would even forget that you can also rent books....

definately a recommendation. As mentioned before, go to the top floor, have a meal at "La Place" and enjoy the view. The food is good and you get great value for your money. Take your time and head one floor below to sit next to the windows and relax!

Amsterdam's new library. It's a great place to hang out, with regular live radio broadcasts (in Dutch) and excellent food at the top (La Place) and below (Va Piano). There's also a theatre on the 7th floor and a balcony with wonderful views of the city.
