Massive Library. This is a massive library, and within is a massive childrens section. It even includes a English language area for children. Grest place to relax and unwind. The higher floors have great views and it has a good restaurant. There are plenty of computers for internet connectivity.
Must see. Amazing view of Amsterdam and a wonderful cafe. A real surprise find and a low cost attraction, you must visit. Highly recommended.
Reading in interessting architecture. This is impressive modern architecture! Lively Place, english magazines, free entrance, feel-good atmosphere.

Play piano in the central hall! (only for skilled players). The Openbare Bibliotheek located at the Oosterdokskade 143 is the largest central library in the Netherlands. The building is designed by Jo Coenen and opened it's door in 2007.If you like architecture I recommend you to visit the Central Library, the structure and design of the building are very nice. Locals go here to study, borrow books, visit an exposition, play on the piano in the central hall (only allowed if you are a skilled piano player), or have lunch at the top floor of the building. The lunchroom on the top floor is catered by La Place, the food is good and the the atmosphere relaxing. In the summer you can have your food on the rooftop terrace while you enjoy a view of Amsterdam.

OBA, Best in Amsterdam!. This rather new library, set near het Ij, and right next to Centraal Station, is a great place for anyone who is interested in modern Dutch architecture, reading (yes, there are many, many books in English) or a nice, light Italian lunch at Vapiano (really great for the busy tourist, and an excellent price!).

Great library with a great view. Great place to hang around and read books. On almost each floor they have put chairs for the huge windows overlooking Amsterdam. On the topfloor is a an inexpensive restaurant with a terrace
White ascension to a great view. Inspiring building near the Central Station of Amsterdam. On the top floor a buffet restaurant with a great view.

Delicious Italiano. I am in love with this library. Not only full for the lists of books? The food specially the Italiano Pasta which is gorgoeus! Not to mentioned, the varieties of drinks and nice reasonable price for their wine which are brilliant! They have the card system which you obtain from the hostess upon you walk in the entrance, order, eat up and pay when your leaving. Nice view and friendly services.

Excellent place for book lover . I m a book lover so I can be here all day. Mondern design and all the i mac computer, private study area.Huge restaurant , top floor sea view. Lots of books , CD . Its really an amazing labrary that make u wanna stay. Worth to visit even u r not a book lover!

Interesting and modern place.. A very modern building with lots and lots of books, films, music... There are many computers with free internet connection and a free wifi net point. There's a beautiful sightseeing from the 7th floor.

Truly inspiring and great food!. This is how all libraries should be! Packed between Christmas and New Year, there is so much to see, so well laid out and a fabulous cafe at the top with fresh food very reasonably priced. We wandered in for a quick look and were fascinated. Do take a look, however briefly, and see what is truly possible with public libraries and attracting people o use them. Truly inspiring.

modern library. Pretty cool. Very modern inside with a view of the city. Even though the terrace is closed in winter, you can still see out the big windows and enjoy the view. The restaurant on the top floor is pretty good; not cheap but not outrageously priced. To access the internet or check books out you need to have a membership. In the building next door (some kind of music rehearsal hall), you can use the restroom for free, but in the library you have to pay.
Must See!. Prepare to be blown away. One of the coolest, smartest and best appointed libraries that I have ever seen. Don't forget to pop up to the top and enjoy a snack while overseeing the harbor.

wow. what a library never thought i would spend some time in a library on holiday but we were amazed,we took some wonderful photos from the top floor
.
Central Library. love studying here. such a quiet place and nice place to study since everyone there is also studying or doing their work on laptop. wishing for a free wifi and it will be perfect :)

A place to be, even if you sing in a choir!. When I need an inspirational working environment, I usually spend the whole day at OBA. It has a lot to offer, including a collection of musical scores which I usually borrow from time to time. They also have a free wi-fi connection throughout the whole building, so I can study some music score whilst listening to Spotify recordings of the piece I'm studying.

Closed for winter. This was supposed to be the best view in the city, but the terrace was closed for winter. I realize I could have gotten a similar view the next floor down, but my camera doesn't shoot through glass. If you're just looking for a view, the nearby Doubletree hotel is similar. Otherwise, huge library. Very modern.
A coffee with a view. Go to the last floor for a drink or bite at La Place and sit on the terrace (if open) or at the bars that overlook the city center.

the mousehouse, must see. free to enter (good) nice and clean. And them the big surprise: the muizenhuis. You can watch and indulge in this cosy world for hours. Nice for children, parents, grandparents..
Great view. A great view from the seventh floor restaurant. The food is also excellent and cheap. A great place to view Amsterdam while having a drink and something to eat on the open air balcony.

Great to see the biggest library in Europe. The library is good to see even if you dont want to read any books or surf the internet. There are many floors with a great number of books and it is very close to the Central station.

It's like a modern art museum gone wild with Mac's.... Stunning views with affordable restaurant on top floor. Buzz up with elevator for best view of Amsterdam eating local dishes at a reasonable price. Free no hassle internet too!

This library has it all. I have not been in such a huge library. We went here to use the internet and was amazed. The Wi-fi is free, you just have to register and the use of their computers is very reasonable. We went here every day to check in with home. The restaurant upstairs is huge with great food and reasonable prices. Some of the staff were not very helpful, while others were amazing. Once you learn the tricks of how to buy computer time, registering your device, everything worked well. It was very clean and there was a piano in the lobby for anyone to play, so it was nice to have some beautiful music while sitting there.

best library to entertain yourself!. don't miss the chance to visit Amsterdam central library with it's unique architecture and good collection of books and multimedia. there are always plenty of activities for kids to do and you can enjoy the restaurant La Place with it's high quality dishes and snacks.
Very pretty. Nice to see - people playing piano in lobby. Also fantastic restaurant called Vapiano above the library - cheap and delicious .

Best children's library we've found!. This is a must for a rainy day. The children's section is huge with sculptures and artwork, beautifully designed areas for lounging and reading together and free computers. Books available in many languages too and if you live in Amsterdam, your children can join for free and borrow books, computer games and films for free - fantastic!The rest of the library is also impressive, especially the music floor!

The view from here is quite nice. Nothing fancy to see except the view according to me. Obviously a lot of books, but this is to be expected in a library ;-) I would visit it frequently if I lived nearby since I like books, but as a tourist it was not the most fancy place around.

Great library. Excellent resource or just to chill out and read a magazine. Do not need to be a member to just browse. Go to "The Place" in summer and sit on the terrace with an amazing view of Amsterdam.
Nice environment and rich menu. To have a library like this is a great plus for q city of Amsterdam. Very well organized and laid out. Worth visiting
A wonderful experience. Right beside the hotel. Has everything and more than you would expect in a library. Worth seeing just for the building itself!

The most amazing library in the world. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Amsterdam. I spent a few hours reading in the super comfy seats on the 5th (i think) floor.This library has the coolest kids section I have ever seen and if there are Dutch families living in Amsterdam who do not take their children here I would like to find them and have stern words!This is also the library where New York Times Bestselling author John Green wrote the majority of his book 'The Fault in Our Stars' If I ever wrote a book I'd certainty be happy to spend hours upon hours in this place! There is also a restaurant on the top floor with breathtaking views over the city.It's well worth a visit
A fine library. A great library - had a play on their piano. Great for tourists who need free internet access on their many computers. Stocks a wide range of international newspapers
A fine library. A great library - had a play on their piano. Great for tourists who need free internet access on their many computers. Stocks a wide range of international newspapers

Das Buch? Het Boek? Whaaa?. It had booksIt had MusicIt had DVDsIt had computersIt's a [--] Library!OK, it also had a cafeteria. OK, it also had an observation deck on the 7th floor, which closed on Oct. 1. (Ahem, clean the windows, please) If you like libraries, knock yourself out. I took an hour out of my life for this? An hour from my vacation? I want my hour back. It's overdue!
Amazing. The library is impressive and the view from the top was beautiful but the terasse was closed unfortunately

disappointed that the terrace was shut.... We made a special excursion to see this following the reviews on Trip Advisor but were disappointed that the viewing terrace on the top floor adjoining the restaurant - one of the main reasons for us going - was closed since October 1st.... a great pity as I think even I, with severe vertigo, could have coped with admit=ring the views of Amsterdam from there in a way that I could not have risked attempting form other vantage points...However it is clearly a fantastic library and a wonderful facility for residents and students.

Best Library I've Ever Been To!. I would make a special trip to see this place. The library is fantastic. The restaurant at the top has lovely views and wonderful food, at great prices. I had an apple pastry with chocolate sauce and coffee for 3.50e, and it was lush. You could easily go there for an evening meal too, it's open till late and serves a vast array of food.

Family of five. If only all libraries were like this, we were really impressed. Great views from the top. Enjoyable couple of hours spent here and topped by excellent (good value and tasty) lunch. Something for everyone.
Read and eat. Very modern and open design. Excellent food choices in top floor cafeteria, with great views of old town Amsterdam
Only the architecture alone is worth a visit. The Central Library is open 7 days per week from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. and the lending and returning of books is fully automated.

Excellent. Big, impressive building, excellent resources with regards pc's and electronic equipment, photocopiers, scanners, etc. Great internet connection. Attended lecture there - good, comfortable venue.

Excellent library. You can do a lot worse than spending a few hours here. There are literally thousands of periodicals and newspapers to read, not to mention millions of books. There is good coffee/ light snacks to be had in the newspaper section too.There is a fine cafe at the top with a decent selection, and a terrific view from the veranda as long as the weather's good. We always like to stop off here for a few hours on every visit.
Good food. Lovely fresh inexpensive food choices with a calm and relaxed environment. Nice to wander through the library, its a great library.

Its free to visit. What a fantastic gem right alongside the waterfront along from the Central Station. Admission is free and its worth the walk to the Top Floor Cafe/Bistro where for under €10 you can have a drink and food whilst eating Al Fresco in the glass open top veranda with a view of the whole of Amsterdam.

Best library ever. Do not be confused with the name library. It's a big science and culture hub. Restaurant on top (Ikea type) is serving among other great coffee. As I've been there in October can not spend time on terrace (closed from 1st October). Plenty of available computers and w lot of interesting people around. Worth to spend an hour or two with you favourite book or iPad in hand.

Unbelievable!. We were blown away by this library. Close to Central Station. Very modern.....tons of computers....study areas.....fantastic cafe on top floor with stunning views......food stations to choose from.....grill...forno oven....dessert bar....fruit juice bar.....really cool to visit and have lunch at the same time!

Best view of Amsterdam from the library. Go to the top floor of the library - there's an excellent restaurant with a terrace and a fantastic view of Amsterdam. The library is a few blocks to the right of the train station.

Exciting. I've visited and used many libraries in the U.S. and abroad and don't recall a more exciting library than this one. This is a model of what libraries of the 21st century should look and function like. Not to be missed!

What a place to take a break from the buzz of the busy city!. We have been twice to Amsterdam, and went to the library almost daily! First of all, the self-service cafeteria on the 7th floor offers not only fresh, tasty and very reasonably priced food, but also an amazing panoramic view of Amsterdam. You can sit on the patio, sipping your coffee, enjoying the food and watching the scenery. They have free Wi-Fi, so while you are relaxing and having your breakfast or lunch, you can also browse the web, connect with friends or check the news. We used the library as our base in Amsterdam - the place to get some rest, unwind and have a bite before heading off to do more sightseeing. There also is a nice restaurant on the bottom floor, which stays open after the library closes - we ate a few dinners there, and the quality leaves nothing to be desired. The way it works is that you get a pager and a tracking card at the entrance, then go around to various cooking stations, order your food, take a seat and wait until your pager buzzes - time to pick up your meal and enjoy it. When finished, you return your pager and the card and pay for whatever you ate. We loved this casual approach to dining. I also like to see the food before ordering, and this self-service approach allows not only to see the food but also to see how it is cooked.

great view of the city. this nice place is located not far from the central train station. at the top floor there's a very very nice and reach cafeteria, that has a big balcony from which you can view the city's skyline over a cup of coffee or a light meal.

Great view from the 7th floor. I had breakfast at the cafeteria at the 7th floor watching the city. It was such a good point to start my tour.It's a self service restaurant where you have many choices either for breakfast or lunch. There juices, drinks, soaps, salads, sandwiches and asiatics dishes.

Excellent library!. This is a beautiful new, spacious, modern library. There are several floors connected by escalators. On the top floor is a large cafe with a great selection to choose from. Also on this floor there are comfortable seats along floor to ceiling windows inside as well as an outdoor deck with great views of the city.The selection of CD's and DVD's puts the USA libraries back home to shame. I just stopped here while on vacation to look around, but I know if I lived in Amsterdam, I would be here all the time.

A remarkable find. A library may not seem like a tourist destination, but this one surely is. It's eight floors, bursting with lots of material, cool furniture and unlike any library you've seen. As a bonus, the cafe on the top floor has great views of the city.
amazing view. who ever visits the library should go to the roof floor to enjoy his coffee with the amazing amsterdam view

Worth seeing, especially the view from atop. This library is huge, interesting, modern and comfy. I enjoyed walking through it (even though I don't understand any Dutch). It's one of the coolest libraries I've seen so far.They have a lovely café on the top floor and a balcony where you have a spectacular view over Amsterdam.The library (just near the Central Station) is open daily until 10 pm, which makes it easy to find some time to visit it.
Huge. I don't think there's a book that they don't have in their collection. The building is very nice. They have a collection in LGBT history etc also.

Great restaurant on the 7th floor. Just a short walk from Centrall station. Good choice of reasonably priced meals with a panoramic view of Amsterdam. The food is cooked fresh in front of you while you wait. A good and varied selection. You can sit outside on the balcony if it's not to windy or inside and still get the view - PLUS toilets which are few and far between in the city
A visit to the library. This is a beautiful building, worth a visit. Great cafe on top floor with gorgeous views. interesting exhibits

Excellent library, a model for future libraries. This library is open late, open everyday and open concept. It is inviting and has a cafe on the top with a super view. The internet is strong and everywhere and the library has scads of computers aw well as a huge book collection. Super!

WOW. Must visit place in Amsterdam! It is an amazing library with so many resources available, six floors as I recall and very modern technology. The only disadvantage is that there is no translation on anything in the library on English. There is a Restoration at the top floor with a great view!Worth visiting!

21st century style, nice architecture!. We like visiting libraries wherever we go, smalltown places and universities, every library has a special atmosphere and is a meeting place of the local community. This new building with its open setting is a great example of modern-day libraries. If you're a fan, like us, go see it!
Place to go. Excellent place to take a aereal pic of Amsterdam...also in the 1rst floor on o f the best italian rest.
Unique collection in fantastic new environment. If you love architecture and great display of books, just go. The library has great places to sit and read.

AMAZING!!!. it's got a vending machine with office/study supplies in it. the kids section is downstairs and is like this amazing maze with cool things for kids to look at and it's basically a play area. there's a piano you can play for 30 mins if you want and when i was there a girl was playing and she was AMAZING! plus it's where John Green wrote some of 'The Fault in Our Stars' so you have to go even for that.

Wow what a library Britain needs more libraries like this. I've been meaning to visit for years but somehow always got distracted en route. There has been construction East of Amsterdams central station - forever - so getting here looks like something of a challenge even mid 2012. Pass by the rather soulless concert/ music venue, the movenpick hotel and hit the library it's sensational.Entires Floors of DVDs, CDs , magazines, Mac music stations. I found copies of both items I looked for. Then at the top a super friendly La Place cafe - think John Lewis top floor Oxford St. - More choice and better quality. If David Cameron ever wonders why there are higher levels of ENGLISH literacy in The Netherlands he could well start here. Without a parental credit card kids CAN download music , TV, DVDs for free but it's illegal , surely it's better to offer access , teach people to share care and appreciate culture in a great environment. Rather than own more stuff ?? Let's have Lighter brighter libraries and less ownership.

Not to be missed!. I know. Visit a library while on vacation?! You won't be disappointed! Free internet, immaculate rest rooms, spectacular views, AND a wonderful cafe for lunch - something for everyone, even picky eaters! It happened to be near our hotel (Doubletree), but is worth the walk from the Dam Square area - near Centraal Station, too.
Don't miss it!. So spacious and serene, scrumptious restaurant and fabulous views. The children's library area is a beauty to behold - guess you could say I liked it!

Unbelievable Design. This library is literally like sitting inside an iPod or an Apple HQ. Everything is white plastic, huge windows, all beautifully designed. It's also not that crowded because there are eight floors! Restaurant at the top level is really cool and has great views. Free wifi, good food, cool location on the water, lots of space in a beautiful building - what else could you ask for?

Incredible!. This is what a library should look like! Very modern and clean. They have over 30 IMACs on each floor. Beautiful presentation and most importantly, it has 2 places to eat, one on the ground level and the other on the top floor with an entire view of the city. This stays open until 10pm on most days. Must see.

Fantastic. I was taken here to be shown the views from the top floor and it was amazing the Central Library where amazing! If you are afraid of heights be warned it is very open and do not look down like me and scare myself!! There is an excellent children's section to keep them occupied while you read in peace and I had my photo taken with the giant polar bear! When going on the elevators on the way down there is something for everyone peace an quiet to read and fun for all the family. Computer access is available and cds to hire as well. Miss it miss out!

go have a cup of coffee. when I first walked in here I thought I am in the future. It is a very beautiful designed building with a great concept. You can spend easily a few hours. Sometimes there are little art exhibition on different floors. Don't forget to have a cup of coffee or tee in the the restaurant on top and enjoy a great view from the deck.
wonderful!. what a beautiful library! also an overwhelming array of multimedia to explore. i loved it so much, i just wish more of the books were in english. ..or i guess i could learn dutch

Best view from Amsterdam. If You want t take a nice panoramic of Amsterdam ou gt to reach the 7 floor of this library, also the restaurant was nice, if you want thou can get also to the window in 6th floor and enjoy e view form a really comfortable couch.
I so close from central station and easy to reach, recommended

Best library I've ever seen!. There are just so many reasons to love this library. Very modern and sleek design, Mac laptops everywhere, free wifi, discreet study corners (and air con in hot summer days!). And have I mentioned the self-service restaurant with city view? It is small but inviting, with lots of healthy options on offer. Fresh juice and fruits, milk, oven baked pizza, salad, beautiful dessert.You can choose comfy indoor seating or outdoor seating with nice view. I didn't even have time to browse the book and DVD collections during my brief visit, but they sure looked promising. It's less than 10 mins walk from central station, so worth a visit to cool off in summer time (or get warmed in winter time) with a few drinks and good view.But you do need to pay a small token (20c) to use the toilet.
Great View!. What a great economical way to get a beautiful view of AMS, and there's free Wi-Fi! We had a coffee upstairs and enjoyed the view.
perfect view!. from the terrace on top of the library you can have an wonderful view!! don't forget to take a coffee & cake at the self-service restaurant there! :) excellent food!

Woow!. We got there looking for a museum that once was there but not any more (in our map it was still there!) and found this huge library! It's located in a modern building with a lot of windows from which you could have a beautiful view of the very center. There were plenty of books (of course!!), DVD...and many places where take a sit and chill out reading or listening to music or watching a DVD or simply looking out of the windows.

Libraries are not just for reading!. The building is such a great space, with all the contents you could ever desire in a modern library. Even if you just go for a coffee, make sure to go to the top floor and admire the view.

Wonderful library, great section for English language kids books. One of my favorite libraries in the world. It's not that the collection is all that remarkable, but the combination of architecture, selection, vibe, and cultural components make it a destination point itself. The bottom floor houses an excellent English language children's section with both books and DVDs.
Fantastic library!. What an amazing building...definitely go and see it. If I was a kid, I would love going to the library if it looked like that. Modern and fun!
wow!. what a fabulous library. 8 floors of shiny books in white zappy cases, stunning views on the top floor and a to-die-for lunch cafe (with views) at the top. Don't miss it!
Very different to a provincial Library. Litirature and information in so many forms, hard copy of digital, available at your leasure. Enjoy learning or just looking-up
Wish this was my library. The 1/2 price ticket booth is at the information desk. Go up to top floor for cafe and view over the city. This is east of central station.
Stunning library!. The library itself looks fantastic though it is a working library and not really an attraction - still great views and a relaxed atmospheres for some down time and a coffee!
Great place to relax for free. Free internet and lockers for any traveler on a budget! (Lockers require a deposit but you get it back when you return the key)

Awesome. Beautiful building and worth a visit. Each floor held a surprise to see. From the media desk of cardboard to the suitcase diarama exhibit on the fifth floor. Take time to explore each floor. The restaurant on the second floor was great for lunch while the bar on the seventh offer great views.

The most amazing library. Breathtaking.. The building itself is a masterpiece, then your breath is taken away as you enter. Soaring celings, masterfully displayed books, creative spaces for studying, reading, playing. A great cafeteria with a city view. It is a total must see, even if you are visiting. This is what a library should be.

Fantastic library & eatery with fab views of Amsterdam!. Amsterdam's Central Library is so worth a visit - even for non-library lovers! And just a 10 minute walk out of Centraal Station (direction, left), it's worth going just to have some refreshments at one of their three cafés & to get online for free! The first café is at the entrance of the library and, in good weather, you can bask in the full sun with a view on the water.It's a great building, well designed, packed to the rafters with great material. Of course books :-) but racks and racks of CDs, DVDs and so much more! Free internet access for all, using Apple Macs, offered with various funky seating solutions.All the international daily newspapers are available to read in their huge newspaper & magazine library - why buy it when you can read it in great surroundings whilst sipping a tea or coffee from the adjoining café!There is a piano in the lobby where competent pianists are invited to play for up to 30 minutes - on a good day you can hear some gems.To top it all (literally), there is a brilliant café / restaurant (a branch of La Place) on the top floor, which does delish food, from snacks to full-on freshly cooked pizzas, stir-frys, etc! Beer, wine, tea, coffee. The ambience of the restaurant is very nice, cozy, gezellig! No matter what the weather, you've got to get out on the terrace of the restaurant to take in the fab views of Amsterdam from up so high! You will look out across the water to the beautiful Old Centre of Amsterdam.

Learning in a modern refreshing way. If you are stuck for something to do, and its raining,head over to the Bibliotheque.Here you can spend a full day, between reading, watching movies, listening to cds, free internet access, a fabulous cafe on the top floor with a splendid view over the city, to having dinner on the basement.Its everything you can want, and something to entertainment yourself with!
what a view.. never seen so many books. what a fab building. the view from the 7th floor resturant was amazing. to top it all the I AM AMSTERDAM letters outside. seen them at last.
Library was huge. The library was huge and completely different from home.
ok. It's a pretty modern place with a nice view. But I really think there're more interesting places to visit rather than this one.

The Library with the most !!!!. My wife is an Executive Librarian overseeing some 13 libraries, and she was amazed at how the Dutch have brought the family "into" the library. It is an interesting concept and well worth a visit, stay and have a snack, or take a glass of wine on one of the terraces and watch the world go by.

Mind Blowing. Set on reclaimed earth beside the Central Train Station sits the Modern monstrosity that is the Library. I wondered in here and I was astounded at the size and scope of the place. Each of the 7 floors is dedicated to different subjects, organized and laid out beautifully.There's lots of places to sit and lounge, one could easily spend days here. It's an amazing place to visit on a rainy day in Amsterdam. Check it out!!

Very nice building. Living in Amsterdam makes it easy for me to visit this building. During the Documentary Film Festival I visited also the big movie theater for the first time. It is a bit hidden behind the restaurant on the top floor. The library always gives me the feeling that I have all the time in the world and that I can find anything I want. Love to have a coffee in the little bar and read my favorite magazines.

Cafe on 7th floor. Visited the central library to mainly look at the modern new building. This part of Amsterdam has been fully built on land they made. The architecture was worth the visit alone. On the 7th floor is a very well priced cafe with a great view.
You could spend a full day here. Stunning library, beautifully organized, incredible view, full internet, loads of culture. Restaurant on top floor, lovely!

Views-Gratis!. An easy walk from Amsterdam Centraal to the public library (Bibliotheek) is certainly worth it. FREE! Always hard for a tourist to find something of such good value! The views from the cafe on the seventh floor are fantastic, over the city and canal activity below, but can be equally awesome from out of the windows on any of the other floors. Hard to ignore the cafe, though. I recommend the local fresh mint tea with appeltaart (apple pie), though plenty of other things available. A wonderful place to whittle away a few hours browsing-the only negative is you have to pay to use the toilets (20 cents), though they are nice and clean.
WOW!. Amsterdamers are lucky to have a place like this where to study and also a great outlook on the top terrace!!!free to visit!
Must see. Stunning views and a great restaurant full of different world food options which was far less formal than I thought it would be and great value for money

Not only for reading. I like visit the public library in the State I visit because in Italy we don't have this Library concept. The Central Library was very nice, comfortable, lighting. There are also one bar and one restaurant.

Modern library. I just stopped in here to go up to the top floor and take some panoramic photos of the view, it is very modern and sleek inside and I understand you can get free wi-fi here.The view was very good, though a little boxed in. It looked like a nice spot to sit and sip a drink, and many people were doing just that.

awesome public library. would like to have a public library like this in my city. As a tourist, the building is worth a quick look on the inside and out, unfortunately you have to sign in at the desk or something like that to get access to free wifi...that was lame.
If you need a computer/internet, this is the place. Nice and helpful staff. A lot of computers, and cheep to use

A modern Library. Everyone should visit this library even when they are not a member. There are plenty corners to chill and read books/study/chat.
Many computers are available with free internet.
There are also restaurants and a theatre at the top floor.

The Best Library I've seen!. It's huge and modern! I love it. It's a nice place to spend a quiet afternoon reading, or watching a movie. It has a lot of magazines, newspapers, books in different languages, movies, games and music. On the top floor there is a restaurant, where yo could have a bite and enjoy the great view.
Libary. Great library to visit. Plus we had lunch at the roof top restaurant. A little pricey but cool experience.

The Library. Beautiful view from 7th floor deck and restaurant. Went to the library to get wifi connection but had a lot of difficulty with the language and trying to join the library to use the connection. However the panoramic view of City Centre was well worth it.

a modern library experience. Went to see this library as it is a new addition in amsterdam.What an experience.it cost a lot of money no doubt but all the floors are well laid out with books.dvds, cds and plenty of computer terminals for use by registered members.the building has plenty of space and plenty of staff to answer queries.It must be great being a student in AmsterdamTo top it all there is a great cafe at top of building which has good food and excellent views over Amsterdam.The Library is well worth a visit to review how a library should be laid out

Joy. Spent half a day here instead of at the airport after checking out of my hotel as my flight was later in the evening.Amazing collection of books, magazines, AV media and most of all very helpful assistants.This is the only public library that I have seen has iMac's everywhere.There was also an exhibition of some posters that interested me.A very nice place to spend time if you have kids too.

What an amazing place!. This is the perfect place to study, find what you need (mostly for free!!!), use internet and pc's, and even have great food (last floor)! And the location on the water is breathtaking! As well as the building itself!!!

Something for EVERYONE at Amsterdam Central Library!!!. There really is sommething for everyone at the Amsterdam Central Library!!! It opened in 07.07.2007 and is presently Europe's largest public library. It's easy to find - between Central Station and Nemo! Opening times are 7 days/week 10am to 10pm (closed on holidays). Computers are available on all 6 floors - ***since Jan 2012 a smmall fee has been implemmented(1 euro) for 1/2 hour internet use, if you are not a library member.***Lower floor contains the childrens books and lounge area. Public washrooms (.20 euro cents).Ground floor: Piano available for experienced players!/ Exhibit area for various exhibits (mmostly free charge)/ Large selection of magazines/newspapers/ Leescafe/Vapiano cafe (entrance front of library).The 1st floor is entirely mmulti-media. Loads of CD's and DVD's and games!!!The 4th floor is where you can watch live studio tapings: Amsterdam FM and OBA Live (Be part of the studio audience: no charge plus complemmentary coffee, tea, water, juice offered to studio audience! Check OBA.nl link for Radio/Interview times. OBAlive airs on Spir24 channel at 13:00 - you may catch a brief glimpse of yourself on public TV ..fun for the kids!). In another floor of the library is the 'silent piano.' This is for experienced and unexperienced piano players. You are able to hear what you are playing through headphones.The 7th floor is La Place restaurant. You can access the outside terrace for a mmagnificent panorammic view of Amsterdam NL!!! The Central Library has books mainy in Dutch, but there are books for everyone in ALL languages available. !!! A word of warning to be careful & keep a close eye on purses, bags, personal belongings as unscrupulous individuals do visit the library and look for opportunities to steal if you becomme distracted!!! The following link will lead you to a video which will give you a better idea about Amsterdam's Central Library. It is just over 7 minutes long - Dutch spoken with English subtitles.http://www.oba.nl/index.cfm/t/Video/vid/6C2D704D-CF49-8BC7-51BED10C3DED24E2isabelydancer00

Peaceful retreat in busy Amsterdam. If you are tired after a long day visiting beautiful Amsterdam nothing better than relaxing at this modern and large library. Otherwise, it is also worth visiting on its own. I wished I would have such an impressive library in my home town. The views from the cafe at the top floor are really nice.

Impressive collection and great view from top. Worth visiting just for the view of Amsterdam from the top floor.
There are computers to use, but not for free.
Lots of international magazines to browse.
Good cafe on top floor.

Modern design. This is an amazing new library well stocked with books,CDs and up to 500 computer terminals (available for free to residents, but for a modest fee for visitors). Escalators whisk you quickly up and down. The top floor offers outstanding views of the city from the cafe terrace (food is good value too!) and there is a space just for senior citizens. Enjoy it now in case it becomes redundant - we saw just two people searching for books, whereas every computer terminal seemed to occupied!
biggest European public library. free internet, very good restaurant at the top, good prices, free practice on the piano downstairs

so glad we went. I'd read tripadvisor reviews and planned it into our itinerary - and we are glad we made the effort to get there. Fabulous building, amazing interior, great view of Amsterdam from the restaurant level outdoor seating area. We used the panorama feature on our new camera and had a great time playing with it from up there ! After about a half hour, we headed inside and selected foods from the large and lovely cafeteria style restaurant line, then sat to enjoy it. Fresh fruit drinks, salads, soup, entrees, desserts, burgers, coffees - just about anything you could want for a nibble or for a meal. We had used the escalators to go up and stopped at each floor for a look around. Descending, however, we just went escalator to escalator and had a great "ride" seeing each amazing floor again as we passed. We had no idea Macintosh computers were so popular there. Loved seeing the study pods, the lounging couches, the dvd collections, the 2 or 3 story reading rooms with great view from the top one. Take 20 or 50 cents for the bathroom attendant if you want a paper towel . . .

New and huge!. We were staying nearby at the Doubletree and checked this out. It's open from 10 to 10 daily, and offers hundreds of computer terminals, listening stations and magazines in English. Obviously if you're a tourist you can't check anything out, but if you need a computer connection or waiting for a train, this is a great place to go. They had a little exhibition too. There's even a piano where people are encouraged to play. The cafe up on the 7th floor is very good with a nice view.

knowledge and fun!. apart from the library's facilities that are very impressive, complete and helpful I would definitely suggest to go for lunch or just for a coffee on the last floor. The whole city of Amsterdam will be on your feet, especially if you are lucky enough to get one sit by the window!

Amazing. this building is epic inside - if all libraries were like this people would definitely want to hang out there. there is a bustling and very good cafe at the top with am amazing view across the city.

A pure treat. This is my favourite space in all of Amsterdam. Every floor of this very beautiful, modern building is a delight to discover. From the children's section at the bottom - with great beanbags and tree houses to climb and read books in many languages to the impromptu piano recitals in the foyer to the huge selection of DVDs and magazines to the fantastic view of the city and water frim the top, I have spent many pleasant hours here - either alone or with friends or with fractious children in tow ( this being Amsterdam, no-one frowns at a bit of noise!)

What a place to learn!. Beautiful view from the top floors, gallery on one of the upper floors, restaurant on the top floor with a great view of the harbour on an outdoor terrace, learning "pods" to settle in and study without distractions, a kids area to die for, etc. The video online had me hooked, and I'm glad I went. Just a quick walk from Central Staion, too. We loved it!
Library Lover. Love to get away from the noise and the crowd once in a while. During my stay, I visited the library and was very relaxed and enjoyed reading the books that I love.

a suprise. I didn't expect much of this when it was recommended. But there is a lovely cafe on the top floor and a terrace on which to sit and enjoy your coffee as you look out at a birds-eye view of Amsterdam.

new. new, trendy, I first hated it because of a lack of atmosphere, and less books than the old library, but I might have to review my opinion now it is really a building being used by everybody. Nice view over the city from higher floors.
Go for the view. We went specifically for the views from the top of the building. Fantastic. Good little cafe at the top.

Great cafe on 7th floor, fab views. Choose any food, cooked in full view, lovely salads, smoothies and naughty cakes!
Balcony with fabulous views.

Central Library (Openbare Bibliotheek). The library is a short walk from the train station. The resources there are wonderful. Check the children's department on the bottom floor. The DVD and CD floor and the .music section are worth exploring.From the seventh floor is a spectacular view of Amsterdam. We went in the early evening and took pictures when it was still daylight. We then had dinner in the restaurant on that floor ( a steak dinner with French fries for 9.90 Euros). By that time it was dark so we could take pictures of the the city at night.The men should pay the .20 Euros for the washroom and look at the urinals.
Great views. Worth a quick stop if you are nearby -- great views of the city.

Beautiful view. The library is truly beautiful inside, but what's better is the cafe (open to the public) on the top floor, with a terrace to sip on a smoothie. The view of Amsterdam there is beautiful and worth the detour.
Big library, bigest in Europe!. Liked the piano in the lobby very much and the music area. The views are spectacular.
Library View. We had heard about the great views, and it was worth the walk. It is also a very cool library

One of the coolest libraries ever!. Located around 10 minutes walk away from the Centraal Station, this is a really cool building, which doesn't seem like a library at all. I highly recommend travellers to pop by the library, head to its top floor, have some food/coffee at the Cafe (it has cheap and good food!) and enjoy the spectacular view of the city. A very lovely site to visit in Amsterdam.
Best library ever!. Great books. Excellent exterior & interior design! Great food and even better view from 7th floor.
beautiful view. I advise to get to the bar on top floor for a stunning view of Amsterdam
Excellent view from the terrace on the top floor. Excellent view from the terrace on the top floor. The library inside is very nicely designed as well. Huge selection of magazines

Okee for dutch books, dont look for other languages. Recently opened library. I was surprised at how much i could not find, but then; i prefer reading in english rather than dutch..... The media side of it is okay, you can browse endlessly, BUT compared with other libraries e.g. Miami/Reno/Brisbane this one is unbearably small. Even though its supposed to be bigger than the last one, i dont buy it. The dvd's are all rental, just as the Books. Even though you have a library card, you have to pay for the books. Cheap rip off.The view from the steps on a sunny day with a book, is the only reason to go here, but be prepared to share it with 100 more people.
No good wifi network. You first have to sign up and show your ID before you can access the WiFi network of the Central Library. Which is very stupid!!
Fantastic restaurant/café. This was a real find! There seemed very little in the way of food and drinks that one couldn't get here. Situated on the 7th floor there is a superb view of the city.

Great library, great restaurant. We visited the library, out of interest and to see the views from the upper floors. Interesting displays of pottery etc were on show. While there we had lunch, and could see why it filled up soon after midday. Inexpensive and really good!
Yep, visit the library. A spectacular place - books, films & CDs, PCs, and loads more, in a fabulous space including a fab restaurant. Great views of the city.
Amazing!. Not like any other Library I have ever been in! An absolute must see in the City!
Amazing!. Every city should have a library like this! Also do not miss one of the city's best views! 7th floor, u can also get some nice food in there ;)

Lovely Building. This was a great and friendly place to visit. we had to use the computers to sort matters out back home. And the staff here were totally great at helping us out. Lovely big building as well.
Not just for borrowing books. Fantastic building, clean, light airy modern, serves good food, good views of the city. Open till late.
great space to check it out. free, great interiors, great staff, great location!

Nice cafeteria style cafe on the top floor. My husband and I stopped by here on a Sunday morning to check it out and have a late breakfast. The breakfast is served cafeteria style and there is so much to choose from. So much beautiful, fresh food on display, it is a feast for the senses!! I had literally the best fresh squeezed orange juice I've ever tasted. Where do they get those oranges? Definitely not from Florida. Unfortunately the outside terrance was closed the day we were there but we still got to see a nice view of the city from inside the restaurant. The library is beautiful and worth a trip to walk around and grab a snack. :)

Quiet, warm place to escape. We decided to visit here when we had benn walking around for a while. It was lovely and warm inside and you are free to have a look around. We enjoyed a coffee and a light snack in the cafe on the top floor which was relatively expensive but was delicious and being on the top floor, it has fantastic views over the city!
For sunny days. Nice view, if the terrace is open. The restaurant has snacks and meals.
Fabulous public library. Check out the cafe on the top floor for views of the city!

MIss the char, of the old location. Miss the charm of the old location, but never travel without checking out local libraries. THe staff is sweet gracious wonderful. Building is relatively new. Worth the stop!

Stunning - a must !. I was very impressed and enthusiastic about this excellent library. Modern and exceptional architecture and interieur, a very wide range of books and new media, amenities as a restaurant, computer for free, numerous places for reading and working, and stunning views to the city.If you are there with kids, don´t miss "Het Muizenhuis", a big model of the mouse house in the same-named book of Schaapman. Your kids - and not only the kids- will be thrilled by all the tiny details in this house.I wished I could use this library regulary...BTW, they have books in other languages too.

Books and bytes. You can play the piano or just admire the space when entering the Central Library where books and bytes have found each other. The library has stunning views over the city, a nice restaurants with rooftop terrace, exhibitions, movies and of course books, books and some more books. The modern and light building is a very nice place to escape the city hassle and enjoy some food for thought.

Great place to eat. The new Biblioteek beside Centraal Station and Nemo has a fantastic cafe on the top floor - fresh food, prepared ready for you (watch your steak sizzle!) is a fantastic, good valu location with brilliant views of the city

a must see building and view on the city. This 21st century building combines all usages any one could wish for in a library: it is of architectural beauty, has all kinds of art, interactive pc-facilities, large reading areas, a stunning view towards Amsterdam city, a museum, theatre rooms and a good restaurant..what more do you want?? So walk in (for free) and around and let yourself be inspired
Excellent Architecture. Very nice looking building with a modern library. Nice vie from the cafe on top floor. You can have nice lunch in good price.

Its a Library.... A large and well stocked library, it would be of great interest if you read anything in Dutch. Not being able to do so, for me I'm afraid it was just an Internet cafe. Unfortunately the printers weren't working either but as the use of the computers is free I wouldn't complain.It is a new building, clean and well laid out. The staff are very helpful.

Great space to relax.. This is the best library i have ever been in,as a visitor you cant borrow book but you can use the many free computers.It has an Italian restaurant on the ground floor and La Place cafe on top which wasvery good. We were very impressed.
Wonderful. Another must seeYou must not leave Amsterdam until you have seen there Library
Very Cool Building. Great place on the water. Public Washrooms in the basement. Nice views.

nice view. Its really a cool place to visit. It's a very nice and modern library. On the upper floor there is a restaurant, La place. It's not very cheap, but tasty. The view was really amazing. On a sunny day it's worth to visit this.
Great building. Top to see over all of Amsterdam. And there are many silent places to look in the special books they have.

Impressive. Several floors, comfortable interiors, library as it should be plus much more! At the top floor restaurant with nice view (it's a pity that a tarrace was closed when I was there - January). Many free to use computers around all the place.

One of my fav spots in the city. I always recommend it to people coming over to Amsterdam: it's a very cozy library, with a lot of lounge places, a cafe to read your magazine and from the top floor some of the best view of the city.

Impressive. Really cool, big library. The wifi is a little hard to figure out, but if you get clear instructions at the reception, the guest access still works fairly well. The food at the restaurant on the top floor is good, if a bit pricey. Great view though.

free internet and great views, good food. went here to get free internet access, cafe on top floor had nice food and with some of the best views of amsterdam, entrance if free, a cheap and easy way to spend a few rainy hours
Cozy atmosphere with lots of books, computers free of charge and live piano performance. everything is perfect here! one of my favorite places in Amsterdam

Wonderful experience. Such a beautiful building. Great view from the top floor outside the cafe. The cafe was a surprise! Moderately priced, but excellent food. Perfect place to check the email and have a coffee and pastry.
Books, food and views. Beautiful, modern building. Great restaurant LaPlace on top floor, offering marevlous views on Amsterdam waterfront. Great place to relax, read a news paper, drink a coffee...

great place! Beautifull with a super view!. It's a beautifull place with a super new decoration, very actual!
Have a perfect view over the city (and it's free) and a great restaurante in the last floor!
Very nice food and offers!
DON'T MISS IT! you will not regret!

An unexpected treat, great view of the city. The library, tucked next to the Central Station, is a gem in the heart of the city. 7 floors high, with lovely views of the city from the restaurant situated on the top floor. Interesting design, free internet terminals and it even had a piano for the public to play on the ground floor!
Great to spend a day!. You can read, listen music, study, have lunch while enjoying a great view of amaterda, enjoy people playing piano all this in one place. Worth the visit!

It is a new Amsterdams must!. Do not forget to visit de nieuwe bib of Amsterdam! It lies next to the Centraal Station. Go ahead straight to the top floor, there is a big public cafeteria. Have a meal or a drink there, I recommend the smothies and enjoy the fabulous views from the terrace. There are just a few places wherefrom you may enjoy the views of Amsterdam from the top.
Should go. do not come back without see the Central Library, you can spend time and discover the smells of books
Beautiful building, and restaurants!. Was surprised to find a really nice restaurant inside the central library. Good views from the upper floors.
Wonderful. What a fantastic library. Be sure to pay the cafe on the top floor a visit!
Amazing library. Really fantastic design, good facilities. Great views of the city.

Best food of trip. The Library is amazing, a true MUST. Has a view room upstairs, but the best part is the Italian restaurant with cooked to order FRESH amazing food. They cook it as you select it pulling fresh herbs off their plants as they cook. Then you sit outside overlooking the river. There is also a piano for those who can plan well, for free to use. We enjoyed Classical while dining. This is a wonderful experience.

Great restaurant!. If you are looking for a nice place to eat that is economical--and has a great view of the city--go to the Central Library in Amsterdam. The restaurant/cafeteria is on the 7th floor; the food is really good, prices very reasonable, and it's not a tourist trap (when we were there it was mostly locals). We went there around lunchtime to get coffee/snack and liked it so much, we went back for dinner. Stays open to 10 pm; is just past the Central Train Station, very convenient and terrific photo op!

A library with a great place to eat. A very modern library centrally located with a great cafeteria style restaurant inside. The food was delicious, the views of the city superb & a welcomed break in between sight seeing.
Great Food Court. Travel to the top floor for an excellent food court serving fresh healthy food!

Great building, free internet. A bit of a walk from the Central Station, guided by barriers around construction sites, this is a place well worth a visit, even if you only want to get onto the internet to do a little surfing. The Dutch manage to make a very modern building bright and inviting, and the mezzanine floor has a ring of laptops (or laptop stations) overlooking the main floor available for free access by the public. If you don't know Dutch, the person sitting next to you probably has better English (and with an American accent) than you do.
Everyone should have a library like this!!. Hundreds of high speed computers for everyone to use without any fees. Amazing and beautiful.
free internet. free internet was great and a great view from the top
Great business facilities. Nice location close to train station. Great meeting rooms with bathroom, coffee, and tea facilities close by, beautiful views, and buffet restaurant with good quality food.

For a book lover, this is heaven!. I found out about this place on a blog where the title was "Library Porn" and had pictures of the world's most beautiful libraries. This is certainly one of them. From the circular children's area to the gorgeous music/movies section to the clean, easily accessible fiction/nonfiction sections, everything is perfect. The seating is modern AND comfortable. Books are catalogued well that even when looking at the headings in Dutch I could find what I needed. You can access the online catalogue in English and sort by many different options including language. There's also a piano in the entry way that students from the next door music conservatory come and play. An absolutely lovely place and a great way to spend a rainy afternoon.

Worth a visit. Anyone can go it and read. It looks modern. Frankly speaking it is a medium size library for citizens. Most of the books and medium are in their language and not in English. Don't expect to have surprise as achieved in those great libraries around the world. It is just 6-7 stories tall and already one of the tallest building nearby that provide a superb view of the city when looking from the top story.

Beautifull contemporary building with easy top floor restaurant offering amazing view on the city. I love contemporary architecture, and thoroughly enjoyed the lightness of the building lobby. We ate on the 7th floor restaurant, easy food buffet style, with plenty of fruits and veggies options, and a stunning view of the city!
Great view across Amsterdam. The food court was great, especially the soup on a cold day. The actual Library was amazing.

Perfect place for a lunch with a view in Amsterdam. As Amsterdam does not have an attraction like the Eye of London or the Eiffel tower we decided to go to one of the few places that has a view being the restaurant of the library.We didn't look much into the library itself, but it looked big and modern... The food in the restaurant was ok, good for breakfast and lunch and not too expensive and probably the best view in town!.

Gorgeous building & great lunch. The central library in Amsterdam is a beautiful, huge modern building and definitely worth a visit. Just a 10 minute walk from the central train station, the place was well signposted and easy to find. The best part was the self-servive restaurant on the 7th floor. The food was amazingly fresh and delicious and there was a great selection on offer - all at really reasonable prices. Hot pizza, fabulous salads and sandwiches, fresh juice and a glowing selection of fruits. It made my day! You can sit on the terrace which faces south and has a beautiful view of the city. Highly recommended.

Not Just a Library - A restaurant with both view and character. The library is to the left of centraal station as you leave the station - just passed/beyond the new mint hotel and opposite the Sea Palace chinese floating restaurant. Or to the right as you look at the station facing it.It is fully accessible thanks to a chair lift and lifts, and indeed has many free computers offering internet access. Dont miss the restaurant la place, on the top floor of the library; excellent fresh cooked meals - top quality restaurant food at canteen prices. Also for food, there is a pasta house on the terrace - again good quality an cheap prices.

Best. Library. Ever.. Of all the weird and wonderful sites in Amsterdam this is one of the more lateral choices. There's a whole redeveloped side to Amsterdam, which includes the Movenpick hotel, Nemo science centre, Phillips HQ and now the central library. It's an 8 story steel and glass extravaganza opposite the floating Chinese restaurant. Here you'll find multiple cd and dvd lstening stations, high quality Mac computers throughout, a sheet music selection of multiple rows with a silent piano to practice on. A concert hall on the top floor. A very spanky silent area that looks more Buddha bar than library.Lighting throughout is of the anti- SAD kind, making it a great place to go on a winters day.And to top it off? A couple of good quality restaurants.
Nice food and view. Brilliant place for lunch with a wonderful view of Amsterdam, cheap and very nice quality, good variety too. It's on the7th floor so you get a very good view of the city.

Excellent view over Amsterdam from.... Excellent view over Amsterdam from rooftop terrace. Modern design library with lots of little hideaways. Free internet access. Coffee corner with newspapers and magazines from all over the world. Two reasonably priced restaurants.
